qgCGzX6rkWnio554h9u1Wg.text: OMG this was an amazing meal!! So delicious, great service, cool atmosphere. This is a MUST STOP if you are within 20miles.   I had the eggs Benedict and my wife had the enchiladas. Both were out of this world.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg Benedict and enchiladas.

KUkN06M7JzvwEox-gMwlwA.text: Meh! Had the carne adovada. It's a sloppy sludge of meat, cheese, beans. The meat is ok but nothing to write home about. The service was pretty poor and if I'm going to be abused and neglected, the food needs to knock my socks off. Which it did not. Ugh yelp, you led me astray this time.

O02dDUe-2ZWp8mHZZc2DNA.text: I was randomly looking for somewhere to eat lunch today, saw some pics of the food and thought I would give it a try. Legit probably one of the best things I've ever tasted. The carne Arvada is so flavorful it's unreal. One of the staff told me how they smoke the meat and chilies and they def do a phenomenal job. I'll absolutely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

98tet-ON8xHsmcLpHrjO1A.text: This place if fantastic! Great ambiance, awesome food:) I haven't had anything yet that I've disliked. highly recommended. Just a heads up, the place is a little small so it's cozy.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Other special if the day is the Asada omlete
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This one is the special Chorizo Benedict.

bz1W9_4B1cfQ6BAt82kpaw.text: I'd tell you where this place is but then you'd go there. I don't want you to find it. It's tiny and it's hard enough to get a seat there without other people finding it. So stay away and let me enjoy it. Here's what you're missing. Food cooked right in front of you, on a grill or a spit or an open fire. New Mexican food...not hot but spicy. Carne adovada with beans and rice that melts ( well, almost). Cold draft beer, friendly customers (they have to be...the quarters are that close) and great servers.

gX-aZOZ089vQmCrKDJkXkA.text: Awesome food, cheap drinks, fun servers - what more could you want?   We're from San Jose, so only get here occasionally, but it's a don't miss, especially for breakfast.   We had the combo (1 eggs Benedict and two enchiladas with red & green chile and the enchiladas where you can pick any 3 of their six options.   Bloody Mary is pretty spicy, but mimosas were good too, and only $5 each.     Dick's is a bit hard to find, but there are pics posted of the sign above the entrance - I think it just says cocktails and parking in rear...  Monica was a great server too!

qDrm3r84yqLpMQM_ArmCgQ.text: Seeing previous yelpers having trouble finding this place, we were concerned.   However, the address number is above the door. We stepped in, and we were immediately in a bar. The bar was packed with patrons along the left side. There were about three small tables along the right wall. There is NO place to stand and wait. It was rather uncomfortable for a moment while someone noticed us.   There is a small, very dark dining room to the right as you first walk in. We were informed to sit wherever we like. This room had one very large table (room for 10 I believe), and two 4 tops. They had extra chairs, so they may be able to squeeze in more. NO high chairs.   They do not split the dish, but they will bring out an extra plate to allow you to split it yourself. We split the tenderloin benedict. Omg. This was a dish with two 3 oz filet mignon, eggs, hollandaise, and a side of pinto beans and potatoes. The tenderloins were so amazing, we could cut them with a butter knife. The beans were so flavorful, I did not realize pinto beans could taste so good. The service was incredible. The wait staff definitely knows what they are doing.   The food and service is 5 stars. The awkwardness that we felt when we first walked in brings our scoring to 4.

3rzp8YJc1YZ_BlBhBHhc6Q.text: Exceeded expectations! The pork chop was huge and came with TWO pork chops, sides of delicious broccolini and asparagus and a stuffed green chili pepper! The place is atmospheric (dark) and small (you will inevitably jostle your neighbors) but in a good way. Love the New Mexican cuisine and even the happy hour beer (which we'd never heard of before) was surprisingly amazing. If you are in Phoenix, you should definitely check out Dick's Hideaway.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chops at Dick&#39;s Hideaway!

rlNr8aFXqedpCYGdiwUblw.text: Awesome little hidden gem. I wasn't sure if it would be a family friendly place based on the reviews but we decided to try it anyway. Seating is VERY limited no matter the size of your group. They're are 3 tables in the bar and an dining room that has 2 additional tables. One table is a "community" table. We sat at the community table and it was a lot of fun. Our kids are well behaved and it wasn't long before us and the 2 other groups were chatting it up. The staff was attentive and made sure we all had a great time. Only thing that keeps it from a 5 star is it was a little stuffy inside but to be fair it's the dead of summer in Phoenix. I'll be sure to add this to the list of places I recommend to others

GuYy-qPZS4sfKs0rXBU5og.text: Great food and excellent service!!! Great place for unique food and nice drink selection. Alway have a great time here!   Alway choose the special and have always been happy with it!

wV7ycS3DGehR4SgjcEWxBQ.text: We have been patrons of Richardson's and Dicks for 20 years but will not go back after this experience. We booked a private dining room for a company party and were informed the day of the party that there was another group in the room but they have an "even better" private dining room that is right near a bathroom and we will love it!  We reluctantly agreed, as we had nowhere else to take our employees for our annual company holiday party.  The "private dining room" was 2 tables in the back of the noisy restaurant right by a kitchen and gross bathroom. Throughout the night, customers from the bar passed through our group on the way to the bathroom (which we had to wait in line to use).  We were overcharged inflated contract private dining room rates (even though we were kicked out of our reservation for said room), service was bad, the server was argumentative and the food was barely warm and tasted terrible.  Steaks were cooked wrong and "tenderloin" was more like some tough sirloin I couldn't cut through. Sauces were not good and also luke-warm.  Sadly, we won't be back again.

MTfX7-M14BSJZuO6uePgLA.text: I came here on a suggestion from one of the guys at Magnums.  He said it was a place I had to experience, and I had a lazy Saturday so I decided I'd hit it up.  It's the best place you never knew existed. I did all the normal preparation, look it up, get the intersection and drive.  I felt I knew where it was as it's astonishingly close to the Whining Pig, another place one must visit if in Phoenix. So I drove the 20 minutes it took to get there, took a right on to 16th and a few blocks later I turned around and went to the strip mall to park and look it up with my GPS.  I was pulling out of my parkingspot before I noticed the address, then looked at the door I had parked in front of.  I was there and didn't even know I was.  Unashamed, I drove around the complex, then took a parking spot nearby. I walked in, taking careful notice of the sign that said "Sorry, we're open". What I expected the interior to be like was a dive bar that you'd only go with a few chums to have a beverage and a few beers.  What I found was quite different. The interior was dark, the blinds hid the blinding Phoenix sun and a large bar lined the wall to the left of the door.  Candles were on the tables, and the earthy fire stove helped to illuminate the backdrop.  It was mid afternoon, so the cooks were doing prepwork for the evening, and there were a series of chickens being rotiserried over a wood fire.  The bartender, she was beautiful, although I never caught her name, came to me and asked what I wanted. I had read prior sites on this place and saw it was listed as the best bloody mary in town.  Therefore I asked "I heard this place has the best bloody mary's in town?" To which she replied, "Of course."   I eagerly ordered one plus a water.  I'm a bloody mary lover, so I've learned each place has it's own flavor to it's bloody mary, and sometimes water helps. The concoction was placed in front of me, and I ordered the pork shoulder.  Now one cannot complain about a hand made bloody mary, and this one was good.  It had the traditional celery and an addition of pickled asparagus.  The two mingled well with the spicy bloody, which was served with a shot of beer.  It was delicious, but when compared with Mort's back home, I was missing a beef jerky in it too. Soon a large lump of pig flesh with beans and rice was placed infront of me.  Once again it was well spiced, with a plethora of delicious porky flavor to it.  I didn't need a knife to eat it as tender as it was. I gnawed at the pork until I was thanksgiving full.  You know that fullness, the one where you don't have any more room in your gastric tract for anything else or you may burst. Knowing full well that the best course of action was to retreat and take a nap, I couldn't help but order a unique beer to the region. They had one named "Leg Humper" and as that's one of my old gamer nicknames, I had to have it.  The mellow brew had a hint of yeasty sweetness to it.  Needless to say, the trip back was miserable.  I was on the verge of popping, and was carefully driving so as not to upset the delicate balance I had achieved in settling into my drivers' seat. I kind of feel guilty about posting on this place, as it seems to enjoy it's clandestine anonymity, for goodness sake, they didn't even put a sign out for it.  However, something this good shouldn't be hidden.  Instead I'll post it and hope that I can find a seat next time I show up.  Oh yes, there will be a next time.  Things this good are hard to pass up!

YY_cixipLcC_71fgnuSsqQ.text: Went back to Scottsdale with some friends for a part work trip part vacation and we had go here.  The food is just so good and the bloody-marys are also very tasty.  I went for the meatloaf topped with green chilis.  It is a giant slice of meatloaf that comes with a couple eggs.  I went with over medium, not to runny.  Also comes with a flower tortilla to snack on, we had to remind them for this.  My wife had the green chili stew that I had to steal a bite of and as expected, she could not be trusted for her word alone, was pretty spicy and equally tasty.  Once again wish we had time to stick around for the happy hour.

eAXeG95JFl98LL1vHvJNBA.text: The New Mexican Surf and Turf will change your life!!!!  I had the Mexican Surf and Turf and I only have three words.....A---MAZ---ING!!!  OMG!!! I can't say enough about this place! The food is crazy good!!

5_eQLKMdoWjv4zLkA-UfpQ.text: It is refreshing to come to a venue that offers something different. Not only it si secluded and somewhat exclusive, when one has managed to get a seat in a small booth-like table with no space - but I like it. It makes me feel like I am in a place that is not a franchise (if it is, I don't want to know). This establishment is austere without being uncouth in any way, like a diamond in the rough that you do not want to polish.   The servers are amazing. Personable and friendly. On top of their shit, and not too busy to squeeze in a joke here and there. The beer list is not extensive, but it works. The food menu is nice. Overall this is my kind of place. I would come here often if I didn't have a decent drive associated with it. The bathroom is one coed bathroom located in the kitchen. This is good and bad, it feels odd walking into the kitchen - but I like that you can walk into the kitchen. A feel of transparency to see what is going on in here.   What I bring home from my visit is the service, and the feel of the place. Both are top notch. Yes, there are things that I could suggest that would improve my experience - but i'd rather not. I want to leave this place as I found it and hope that they do not change.

zeW54_osvt2Gq1vOA9HezQ.text: Everytime I come here, the food is on point. Love the atmosphere and I love chatting up people at the bar. The service sometimes is spotty but that honestly won't deter me from going just because I love the place so much!

FdK0oYV-82Q2kGOg5otpcg.text: This is a hole in the wall place with tables in a separate room adjacent to the bar. Like the reviews state no sign so look for the copper doors. The atmosphere in the restaurant area was nice and quiet. We 4  sat at the community table which was a beautiful polished copper.  We all had the special which was ney York strip topped with crab and came with asparugus, brocoli,  and carrots with a jalapeno hollandaise and their signature potato in a green chili. We also had chips salsa and guacamole which all had some heat especially the green salsa. Everything was prepared perfectly and was delicious.  I would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Daily specials

jm2cp5iPWm_pDHkdCXvuGg.text: Two words... Jalapeno Hollandaise!  Dark and mysterious on the inside, good service, great food.

p8jzoA-bxAWEPnqgD0N6Uw.text: It's listed as Mexican, which is a mis-categorization. It shares menu's with sisters Richardson's and the Rokerij. So, it's really a New Mexican fusion with lots of fresh fish and always excellent specials. The Hideaway is petite, though with an extra room available on brunch- filled weekends. The wait for brunch on the weekends can be lengthy if you're more than two, but it's worth it. The food is great, and I recommend sharing a plate unless you plan on leftovers.  I frequent this place and have only two gripes, otherwise would have given 5 stars.  1.) cocktails are outrageous. $10 for a manhattan otr.  2.) more than once I've seen a cook handle raw food without gloves and have sent it back due to this, so keep an eye out. It's an open kitchen which I prefer.  Otherwise it's bomb!

29q56RteQN68okP6mx2-Ww.text: It was ok my family is from Nee Mexico and I grew up eating Nee Mexico red chile. This red chile had a sour maybe a can taste to it. The rice was on the sweet side for some reason the bean (de la hoya) were really good. My enchiladas chicken and beef were full of meat and cheese and because they weren't drowned in sauce were tolerable to eat as the red sauce and green were pretty spicey. But enchiladas were good. Hubby had asada Acado platter said it was really spicey and liked my dish better. Cousin had chile relleno and said it was ok but he's had better. The service was excellent and quick and if you've never had New Mexico food you should try this. For me not so good will try another place next time.

SAVE54tdOtPFlOLuEw6cFA.text: Amazing Mexican restaurant, the best pork tacos and Enchiladas we have every had!!Hard to find, look for a metal sign that says "additional parking in rear" and the front doors are underneath.

hrj7A_IVyT8f15ThqYYDJw.text: Great brunch.  Sit at the bar for the best experience.  Mimosas were fabulous, food was better.  Hard to find the place...but that's the point!

vW-RF4Xk2OtUvL2uy7TAuw.text: Visited Dicks before I left Phoenix and all I can say is I wish I had more time and money to spend here! Brunch was delicious and huge (I shared with a friend) and could have happily kept drinking a few brunch cocktails.

9QSgfymN9oAUUzvsM6BxCg.text: This is a great little place that is tucked away on the northwest corner of 16th street and Bethany Home right next to Luci's.  It originally branched off from the old Richardson's that burned down a couple of years ago.  The menu offers a great variety of some delicious New Mexican food.  The atmosphere here is great but place is very small, although they do have a larger room for a bigger party off to the right when you walk in.  The larger room an be reserved for special occasions with a $500 deposit.  I personally enjoy having Sunday brunch here early with my parents or a couple of my closest girlfriends.  They offer a $5 bloody mary or mimosa all day Sunday!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AgqZXBTVEv2Yr5gXxjk7Vw.text: Always amazing food at the hideaway.  The drinks will help sooth the burn of the spicy food but it's all good for sure.

D-jVnupTQGQ_18s-Jp1F-A.text: Place was good, but not worth the rave reviews.   Service was poor, and our server was aloof. We never received our appetizer. He came by infrequently, spent minimal time at the table, and could be easily replaced by an iPad. The menu clearly states absolutely no split checks or split plates. This place needs to get a new attitude, or a calculator. Service is obviously not high management priority.   The Carne Adovada was a salt bomb, but still good. For $17 I could think of a million other things I would rather eat.   The atmosphere is cool.

ejMFL3aSa00BlNMKbKnqaw.text: Another winner for me and the wife. Spicy however (we love our food spicy anyway :-)). We had the enchilada and the new mexican dish. Service was top notch.

xhE_PFnv8QHF723xoI9Z6w.text: Oscar Mike Golf!  With a side of Whiskey, Tango, Foxtrot.  How is this so good.  How am I summoning the willpower to type as I am floating in a wonderful world where there is no such thing as war, disease, corrupt politicians.  Where there are no people who cut you off on the I-10 only to realize they don't need to and promptly go back to their lane, and then realize they wanted back into my lane after all, giving my brakes the workout of their lives, damn you random teenager.   I give my heartfelt thanks to whatever noble bovine prince gave up his life so that I might have such a wonderful, spectacular meal.  And also my thanks to Dick's Hideaway, for giving me this moment to revel in this dream world composed of nothing but delicious flavors and complete food coma.  True to its name, Dick's Hideaway has no signage proclaiming its location, quietly residing on the northwest corner of 16th St and Bethany Home Road.  Of course, it needs no signage either, with its legions of fans and great reviews.  Walking in today around 1pm, the bar was full, and there were only 3 tables in the main room, but our server let us use a table/booth in the adjoining room.  It was a little daunting having this room to ourselves, surrounded by hundreds of bottles of wine, but the comfortable booth we were in helped, with pillows bountiful in number and cushy, as well as the flat screen on ESPN.  Having been here numerous times but not for nearly a year, I called up a number of old favorites, getting the Pasta Heidi, Carne Adovada, and the Richardson's combination.  Pasta Heidi was a beautifully presented and tasting dish, with green chile linguine covered in an addicting chipotle cream sauce, topped with grilled chicken.  This hit all the right notes, in terms of texture re: the linguine, creaminess of the sauce, lingering spicyness of the chipotle, tenderness of the chicken.  The tortilla that lined the bowl underneath was given no mercy, as it had soaked up all the wonderfulness above it.    Carne Adovada was the previously alluded to pinnacle of porcine expression.  Whereas the Pasta Heidi was wonderful with multiple levels of flavor woven together in harmony, this was more in your face with each aspect fighting to the forefront.  An initial smokiness greets you when tongue meets pork, followed by spiciness of the red chile sauce and savoriness of perfectly cooked, ridiculously tender pork, and returning once more to the smoky.  There has never been a war so happily fought as the one these flavors battled for supremacy over your taste buds.  You might be confused for a moment after that first bite, asking yourself did that really just happen?  I assure you, it did, and to take another bite.  Conversation died off at the table as we were quietly in awe of these dish.  Finally, the combination plate I ordered had asparagus, chicken enchiladas in green chile sauce, and a single portion of eggs benedict.  The asparagus was competently prepared as was the chicken enchiladas, but lacking the depth of flavors found in the other dishes.  The eggs benedict however was superlative in its own right, with a perfectly poached egg on top.  A gentle tap with my fork had that yolk spreading like golden bliss over beef tenderloin and english muffin, all crowned with a jalapeno-infused Hollandaise sauce.    With these 3 entrees and coffee, iced tea, and sprite, it came out to be $57, so this restaurant could never be called cheap, but even with tip bringing it to $72, I would say that after leaving I feel we still got the better of this exchange.  Dick's Hideaway.  I bow to you in humble appreciation, and will return for more time and time again.

u8kegSlJVxLL02k6fIoVNQ.text: We love eating breakfast out with our group of friends, so we chose this place becuase of its' wonderful review in the Arizona Republic.    It may be wonderful for lunch or dinner, but we had by far the worst breakfast and the worst service ever experienced in the Valley.  I might note that we arrived at 7:30AM and were by ourselves in the dining room.  You would think that because we were early the service would be wonderful.  Not so!!  We had to go and find out waitress to refill our coffee.   She served toast but forgot to bring jelly to the table.  Everything we ordered was either wrong or undercooked.  One person in our party sent her food back to be cooked; the other was so disgusted with the appearance of the raw eggs (in her omelet) that she chose just to eat the toast and forget the eggs.    The "special" that day was a crab omelet.  Unfortunately the omelets that we ordered tasted like fish, whether we wanted it or not.  (We didn't)    We had a very hard time locating the restaurant, and would have been much better off  if we had never found it and went somewhere else.  Terrible experience!!

B3YnMvqgt-vw4BCNrwn7NQ.text: Amazing enchiladas ! New Mexico style . If your are in Phoenix check it out . You won't be disappointed .

e3wnW8DWunVxuQou_KY4vw.text: The Skinny: There isn't a clear sign outside but just KNOW it's there so find parking even though you don't see the restaurant.  It's located next to Luci's Healthy Marketplace so if you see that, you're good.  They have this amazing Carne Adovada so make sure you don't miss it (this is the sole reason for the 5 stars).  We came here for breakfast on our way through Phoenix thanks to fellow yelpers and it did not disappoint.  We got the Carne Adovada and Eggs, and the New Mexico Burger.  The Carne Adovada was delicious.  There is no other way to describe it.  If you go here, this is what you need to order.  The hash browns were pretty limp and had a weird, bitter taste to them...not sure if it was the oil they were using or what, but I was pretty disappointed...I really wanted hash browns!  The New Mexico burger was pretty good and did not have the kick I expected.  It was a little bland though so I had to use some of the ketchup that came with my fries.  The fries were tasty and crispy so it made up for the hash browns...somewhat.    So, why the 5 stars?  The Carne Adovada...it's out of this world.

B8HsKQytVShP9FAuqo7KRQ.text: It was spicy, but delicious and my New Mexico friend love it. The chile is on point :) the flan is very good. First time coming not disappointed, it's a nice looking place.

v8EuAhWCDFMBBDjGIuKnpQ.text: The place is hidden, and has arguably the best breakfest food in the area  What to get:  The Tenderloin Eggs Benedict (you can skip the pork and tenderloin and go straight for all tenderloin), and I would recommend subbing out the potato's for fries (usually they will do that if the fryer has time to get to temp, aka not at 7am but probably at 8) - That is the best item hands down on the menu, not cheap but if you order that you will have zero question why everyone rates this place so highly  Other excellent items:  Chille Relleno's - add one on if you arent 100% sure you want them as an entire order, they are fantastic  The Meatloaf if very good, it does sound a bit strange to get, doesnt beat filet at 8am, but is quite good  Adovada is also fantastic, very good heat and is worth a go if you want something on the spicer side  Mimosa's are $5 in the morning as with Blood Mary's - and their orange juice is always fresh squeezed

Ep8NozLLP8t4OZTyD5jcjw.text: The best kept little secret in town. Don't tell anyone about this restaurant, its outstanding service, delicious New Mexico cuisine, and its ecliptic atmosphere.

TwK9vzHXr9TIo6y4E1jOeg.text: I absolutely love this place!   I moved to Phx almost 3 years ago & discovered this place pretty quickly.   I'm now getting ready to move to DC and hosted a dinner here for my team.  They were all amazed at the quality of the food,  service, and atmosphere.   I am going to miss this place,  but hopefully I have passed it on to others who will also share.   We had a number of different dishes, and everyone raved about how good it was.

wEEilo0Wquc8ZsVz0Vfprw.text: A local favorite; not easy to get a table, cuz its small!  Love the NM cuisine; spicy - absolutely, that is the point.  Just a local's hangout; nothing fancy, but a cool feel.  Don't spoil it, we want to keep going here. Been so many times and had just about everything on the menu.  I'm not a big meat eater, but we do just fine with the rellenos, enchiladas; and the guac starter!

c8q5HqXSqNu3mol1siNKXA.text: They were onto something when they named this place Dick's Hideaway. My friend and I felt like we were on a treasure hunt to find this hidden gem. We passed it probably 3 times as it is disguised with a sign that says "Additional Parking in Rear". No sign with their name but they are right next door to Luci's Grocery Store on the Northwest corner of 16th Street and Bethany Home.  Once we finally found the speak-easy like restaurant we were surprised at how small it was. There was a bar section that could seat a max of 10 people and then 3 booths against the wall. There was a room next door with an extensive wine cellar and tables big enough for 6-8 people. The room was dimly lit to give it an intimate feel but not too gag-me-with-a-spoon romantic as there were several flat screen TVs with the DBack's game on. They have a wood burning stove that gives the restaurant a campfire smell...making it seem that you're in the middle of nowhere in the wild west at a divey saloon (but much more classy).  On to the good stuff...I had researched the menu prior to getting there to give myself an idea of what they had. I was excited to see that they had breakfast and then sorely disappointed when I found out it's only served until 4 PM. Yelp considers this place Tex-Mex but I would have to disagree and say that it's definitely got a taste of the 505 (New Mexico speak for those of you that aren't in the know).  As I mentioned in my previous review, whenever I go to Mexican style restaurants, I will judge them by their enchiladas. I decided to be on the wild side tonight and try something different. I went with the Carne Adovada since the server advised it was spicy and I like it hot and a glass of the Malbec. My friend opted to get the red, white, and blue enchiladas.  While I normally love Malbecs, this one was more on the "eh" scale as it was too earthy and overly ambitious with the tannins. So if you like a strong red wine, this one is for you!  We got our food and they were not joking when they said the plate was hot. You can get third degree burns from those steel embossed cowboy-like plates. Also, if you are watching your calories or trying to control your portions...this is definitely not the place as the servings could feed two people.   The Carne Adovada was delicious...the meat was tender, juicy, with a red chile kick and topped with a layer of melted gooey cheddar cheese. The rice and beans were tasty and the homemade tortilla made the meal complete. My friend let me try her enchiladas and let me tell you - they do not disappoint! Next time I will definitely be getting those!  We were in a food coma getting ready to go home and put on the stretchy pants when we were informed that there was a massive dust storm taking over metro Phoenix. I felt like I was back in CO experiencing a blizzard of sand. So we decided to stick around for a bit longer. Good thing we did because we wouldn't have been able to try, by far, the greatest flan I've ever tried. Dare I say better than my mom's flan? Gasp...I would dare say so! The flan was delicately creamy with just the perfect amount of sweetness in every bite. I've never had a flan that was a mousse-like texture and not custardly. Hope you like flan cuz that's the only dessert they have there!  Overall, I give Dick's Hideaway a 4 because I can't give them a 4.5. The service was great and our server was friendly. The food, ambiance, and good company made the night. I will most definitely be returning to the hideaway known as Dick's.

zi5r4SSe_Rejj-Pc7iQ1YQ.text: What a find! Actually, it wasn't easy to find, but once we did, we had an absolutely fantastic brunch. My daughter and I stopped in before heading for the airport, and were greeted and seated immediately. The community tables were a little unusual, but we had nice, albeit brief, conversations with others seated before and after us. The huevos rancheros were fantastic, with just the right amount of warmth, and the New Mexico sausage is not to be missed. My daughter had blueberry pancakes, and found them light, fluffy, and flavorful. The only downside was the service. While it was good, it was a little confusing with several servers offering coffee refills - sometimes infrequently, and once 3 times on 3 minutes. Value was good for the money. I will have to stop again for a lunch or dinner.

3muz-5qJZ2Zc4cBB1xzdUA.text: Absolutely the most unique "New Mexico style food and the portions will come home in a doggy bag. Try the Carne Avodada from the brunch menu. This is also where George W. Bush eats when he is in town (is that a plus or minus?). We were there one night when Bush came in with McCain and there was a rent-a-mob out front. Boy those Left-wingers know how to organize, I will give them that much credit.

lFcDIaiJDXc-UjsbiqoClw.text: Unlike any other place in the valley - the best guacamole & salsa, interesting & unique dishes and really cool atmosphere (especially the adjacent room w/ the fireplace on the side.) One of my favorites for a cozy bite to eat! A great escape!

r4toJ8xZQvZnrnrWyaDJjg.text: Seriously one of my new fav spots. The brunch is bomb and the bloodies are to die for. I just don't understand why this place isn't more packed!

jVYLQ_tLSdB_4lHn8LV0SA.text: I have LOVED Dick's (And Richardsons) for years. There is nothing wrong with this quiet, hidden gem of a dining experience. Sit at the bar in the winter and enjoy the warm drinks and open flames or sit in the cozy, hidden table in the back of a huge party.  I love it all. The food is incredible. BREAKFAST is the BEST!  The service is stellar and the bartenders are fun. The wait staff will sit down and chat with you and take your order in the tightest spaces since the wait is typically 30-45 minutes for brunch. It's super popular and well visited by the locales. If you are from out of town, get there early and expect to have a hard time finding this place (no signs) and know that you might have to wait - you can drink while you wait and the vibe is fun and engaging.  I am not sure I would recommend this for toddlers, it's tough for them to wait that long - but the staff will ensure that no matter who you are - you are comfortable and well taken care of while you wait!~ TRUST GOOGLE.  Look for the small wooden door with overgrown vines...again - no signs! Get the Pork Chops, or the Chile Verde.

hGBHDFvbC4SMlmqtimkIAg.text: This is a cool spot, seating is very limited and once the few tables are taken they may seat you at a communal table. I personally don't love eating at a communal table but the ambiance is still enjoyable. The food is delicious, drinks are excellent! My only complaint is service could be improved. I would recommend visiting!

PlON3UOVY7vLzdkjKNiHkA.text: Great little place with a unique atmosphere. I got the green chili burrito and it was good. Spicy! The hideaway part is no joke. Be sure to go to the address and you'll see the door.

qGNH8TLITRDhDXv1r8aREA.text: First off... please look at the pictures before coming to dicks hideaway! It literally is a hideaway but we had fun trying to find it!! We finally decided it was a good idea to get on yelp and look at the pictures...  We then got sat at the bar (pretty cool to see the food getting cooked right in front of you!) I got the carne burrito and he got the carne eggs Benedict off the brunch menu... both super good but almost needed a bit more flavor! I was pretty pleased with it but maybe had my expectations too high! I'll be back to try more!

uKSQUboegV4gFVCNXha7aA.text: Dick's Hideaway is a must for anybody in Arizona who craves food.   There is no signage, no advertising. Tucked away neatly between stores in a strip mall, you'd walk past it, unaware.   And that's the way we want to keep it. You pass it along to your friends like a good joint, a beloved book, a great whiskey.   Most mornings you'll find me here.   Ruminating over the smells and tastes distinctly New Mexico.  It's in the hands. Blood of the Earth. A hardscrabble Zia sun bleached New Mexico soil.  If you've ever worked with your hands you to understand the wisdom of the earth, of chalk & clay.   It gets in to you; how you think of humus under your fingernails.   It gets in you.   You can feel the minerals hardening your hands. Weighing into your pores. Channeling its way into your bloodline.   How we think of the core of the earth. Out of the toil, the ground was sluiced; Until it yielded.  Hand of the salt. Hand into the Earth.   If you wake up, and you want that taste, that smell-- you'll follow your feet here.   --  P.S.   Oh! And see that guy? That guy right there! The one you always over look. The faceless, nameless perfectionist that cooks, plates and never asks for a thank you.   I watch. I watched him kill a mid-morning, standing-room-only breakfast rush.   He sipped water where he could. Caught his breath where he could. But he never tired.   It was an artwork--a swordsman using a paintbrush instead of a epee.   You study under masters: Socrates & Plinius the elder, Plinius the younger, Aristotle & Archimedes.   I watch cooks.  I've sat here, and I have studied; hoping to learn in a way, some magic by inculcation. Watching to glean some slight of hand; some abracadabra by seasoning.   Hernandez--I'm told that's is his name--I once tipped this man a $100.   Skill is an investment that can not be negotiate.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hernandez--A Man&#39;s name, a Man&#39;s Work.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Why are you still looking at pictures; go get this fucking food!
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Umami.

MHSdWWEnZqV2tDLYpGf7_w.text: Hard to find and easy to like.  Dark muted interior and all menu items are delicious.  Friendly staff and a good vibe make this a sure go to.

JQi1H6p9d_3t0fQtxQR0dw.text: We came in yesterday from Chandler to celebrate a birthday, and deeply regret making the drive out for such a poor experience.  I will start by saying the food was above average, and it was the service we were disappointed by.  My mother in law has a thick Russian accent, and it can be hard to understand her (especially if it is a bit noisy around.) She was trying to ask our server, Lauren, a few questions about the menu and was given nothing but short and disrespectful answers. As a server, I could see this was a busy Sunday morning and she probably had a lot going on, but you have to be able to take the time to answer your customer's questions. Don't act like we're an inconvenience to you for not knowing your menu!   When our food came out, the food runner put the plates down and I went to move mine closer to myself. Not until after I touched the plate did he mention that they were EXTREMELY hot. I immediately got a blister on my finger. If plates are that hot, you should tell your guests before they even touch the table.  After we paid, we asked Lauren if we could speak to a manager. She told us that she did not have one, and that she could give us the office number. I called yesterday, and have not jeard anything back yet. Doubtful I will.

Ev3zzmOAUDjzqwxXGkf51A.text: We ordered appetizers and dinner at the same time since our waitress was clearly busy we thought we'd save her some time.  We ordered at 4:30. At 5:30 we still had nothing.  I asked the waitress if we would be getting our appetizers any time soon? She said no, they would come out with the dinner.  By the time we got our food and paid, we were there for 2 hours.  Stick with Richardsons other location.  Food was good, but not worth the wait, nor the VERY cramped atmosphere.

HfjPYGX9W1pYrFGoHIIeCQ.text: We didn't know what to expect, especially since it was truly a "hideaway". It was a wooden and iron door with the signature coyote on the front -right next-door to Lucy's.   When we walked in, it was a small space and  the room was dimly lit. it was nice and cool inside, the AC with fantastic on a hot summer day. It felt like a cozy romantic escape to us!   The food was phenomenal we ordered the Carne and the chili relleno and the portions were huge! We almost think we could've split a plate instead. The food was rich and full of flavor and to top it all off the staff was so friendly and helpful.

gghsQ9ORjY5KFy6Q_oSYyA.text: Stopped in for brunch on a busy weekend with some friends out of town. This place is very unique, didn't get to experience the bar aspect, it was so packed we were deated in the dining room area. Place is really cool and unusual, bigger than it appears. Food was hot, timely and delicious, definitely see why people love it and I'm not even that big of a fan of (New) Mexican cuisine. Service was fine, they were super busy and we were away from the main area, so a bit hard to judge.  Definitely will be back.

EzB9Ac4grjW5XkaAGFSJSA.text: Awesome little hideaway with great ambiance, service and huge portions! Try and get a spot at the bar, come hungry and leave fat and happy.

Xoke8jF8Ps6HHOPZTGwjJQ.text: WOWZA....had a girlfriend of mine bring me here today...OMG, heading back this weekend for more!! We had great service and we even went off of his suggestions; enjoying every single bite!! I love that it was a cute little dark place... made for a prefect late afternoon lunch!  Well done chefs and servers!!

aevfbUmwTDhhUFSQV1HmEw.text: When eating at a breakfast place that sells bomb ham I like to order the ham. Did that yesterday. Me likey bomb ham

8yBMyG8mLxBFEHzHlvdiEw.text: I was there yesterday for Brunch. It was the first time that I have eaten there. I had the Carne Adovado Benedict. It was AMAZING! Great flavor with just the right amount of kick. The portions were huge and the staff was attentive and friendly! Will definitely go back

6LYJXyUI-fZsFwGDnpOZGA.text: Dick's Hideaway... it was an adventure here!  So technically we made two stops in here on Friday night.  When we first walked in, it was crowded!  So we made our way across the street for a drink before popping back in because after having a great Bloody Mary with dinner and seeing how this place boasts about having a "top rated Bloody Mary in the valley," I couldn't stop thinking about Dick's!  Plus the Persian with us wanted a creme brulee so we came back.  The bartender even recognized us!  While we awkwardly stood around waiting for some chairs or a table to free up, the bartender came by and asked us what we wanted.  A Bloody Mary and a creme brulee was ordered and I was soon handed my lovely drink along with a small glass of Hair of the Dog beer on the house.  Sweet!  After being bullied into chugging this tasty and smooth brew, I was buzzed.  Even though I might have been a little intoxicated, I still found myself underwhelmed by this "top rated" Bloody Mary.  Whaaat!?  I had a much better Bloody Mary like one review ago.  Get on their level!  Kazi H. and I were soon to be escorted to two stools at the bar while the gentlemen we were with still stood awkwardly by the door.  What were they talking about?  My love and I cracked into a nicely caramelized shell and dug into a creamy custard.  While not the best creme brulee ever, I still found myself stealing more and more bites of her abandoned brulee.  More for me, yay!  And then some more stools freed up and our crew came to sit with us.  So the adventure?  Kazi and I stumbled into the private, dark, adjoining dining room to use the restroom.  Let's just say that two girls entered a bathroom with a shower included.  Much shenanigans.  As we made our way back to the bar with her iPhone lighting thew way, we were told that there was another bathroom.  Oops.  Thinking about Dick's makes me smile.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kazi H.&#39;s beautiful picture of my &#34;top rated&#34; Bloody Mary and her crème brûlée!  I just realized there was an asparagus in my drink.

1Xyuj2fjdflFKpB8LAAbmw.text: In Phoenix for the weekend and wanted to try some local food...if you go here, don't look for a sign with their name on it because they don't have one, we entered thru the kitchen (a business next door said everyone goes thru there-we parked in the back) very very small inside, in fact the area they sat us at had only 1 table which they call a community table because you are sitting with others. The food took almost 30 min to arrive, it was delicious but the pancakes were cold. I had teenagers with me. Maybe if it were just the adults that may have been fine. I ordered the carne adovada because it is a specialty of theirs and it was absolutely DELIGHTFUL! ...enjoy

EZZIQPlE53WWOgFLJdtTfw.text: Holy hidden gem!  I love brunch, it intertwines two of my favorite things.. Breakfast and bloody marys! So, this past weekend I decided to take things up a notch and try out Dick's Hideaway, It had been bookmarked for awhile of places to try so I decided that Saturday was the day to cross this bad boy off my list.   Dick's is hidden, like no sign hidden. Not only is it hidden but it's small. I walked in and there was a good 30 minute wait for a seat at the bar... But I am a firm believer that good things come to those who wait... so I waited! My time finally came and I took my seat at the bar, ordered a bloody mary (delicious by the way!) and perused the Brunch menu (it's served until 4:00pm, so all of you hungover party goers are solid!).   I decided to order the Enchiladas (Shrimp & Green Chilie Pork with red and green sauce) served with 3 sunny side up eggs, beans and a flour tortilla on the side. My first bite was heavenly... The enchiladas were delicious and spicy, my eggs were perfectly cooked, the whole meal was seriously out of this world. And for $14.00 your can be sure you are getting your money worth (I had some serious leftovers!).  Dick's is officially on my brunch rotation! I can't wait to come by and try more of their dishes for breakfast, lunch and dinner!

WOeEldgAIa81gqYBBlCXiQ.text: My boyfriend treated me to brunch and Bloody Mary's and I couldn't have been more delighted! Excellent food and friendly service. Our server, Rachel, was sweet and attentive. We split the carne adovada- definitely was enough for two. The Bloody Mary was delicious- I wanted a whole plate of the pickled, spicy asparagus garnished on it! We thought the beer back was a nice touch as well. Intimate and low-key spot- a local's haven. I can't wait to return soon!!

oi-E_f8TIsRjslRTO3Ut4g.text: I just had THE BEST enchiladas EVER at Dick's.  One green chili pork and one chicken.  Both smothered in green chili's and topped with 3 fried eggs.  Absolutely amazing. There is a reason this place is named Hideaway.  No signs, you have to search but it's so worth the effort.  Great waitstaff, fast service.  A must if you want great New Mexican in the Phoenix area

7RA8g1ZGgOk63kpBkOUepw.text: Always good food!  Dick's is always consistent with the quality of their food and food presentation. Service was good as usual.  Even though the place is small, you are not in everyone's business.   It's casual, but intimate.

-lhOn4Ls5uN0IYx4aYpolw.text: This place... I mean wow!   Adam is on point and the cooks Manny and Philly know what they're doing! They have a system down to a tee. The service and food is excellent.   This is my second visit here. The first time was for a hardy dinner. The second time, an epic mound of breakfast deliciousness.   This spot has a low lite feel with people flocking everywhere.   Don't come, I don't want to have to wait too long for a table.   P.S. Watch out for the piping hot plates!

Uz1BOQpGxUqONysJZdJRGA.text: Looking for a brunch place before spring training game and this place hit the spot perfectly. Really felt hidden away and trippy atmosphere but once we got seated couldn't have asked for a better experience. Very busy and feels crowded but the servers are always stopping by to check in and the food was amazing. Definitely recommend the pork adovada and will be back again!

4fpDbRpE5qcy9jBmpUP4hA.text: People what are you thinking with the high ratings here? This hole in the wall has very limited space on the bar side and we waited at least 45 minutes for a table. Once seated at a table I felt I was going to fall on my ass BC of the wobbly stool. The place is super dark so you can barely read the menus or see what your eating.   I ordered the New Mexican platter at $16.00 - tamale, chicken burro enchilada, chili relleno, rice and beans. The chile relleno was so tough I couldn't even cut it with a knife. I had the waitress take it back and the cook said that's the way they are!  My tamale was mostly corn and I've had better at Costco's free samples on weekends and the chicken burro was dry. For the money they charge here i thought my dish was overpriced and lacked taste & quality. With all the authentic Mexican Restaurants in Phoenix I would suggest going elsewhere for comfort and taste. The best thing here was the Stella on tap - ice cold! The service here was good but I felt sorry for the waiters and waitresses BC I saw at least 3 party's leave BC they didn't want to wait.   I would not return here again - overpriced and overrated!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. new Mexican platter

Im5-e4Hm9iHRPvxOk7TXJg.text: Who'd have thought that my first excuse to try this place would be because they happen to have the PAC-12 Network on TV.  To explain, I planned to watch the ASU - Arizona Football Game on TV at my house and about an hour before the game started realized that it was being aired on a station my DirecTV doesn't get.   I initially headed over to Zipps at 16th and Bethany Home to catch the game, but quickly realized that everyone in the area had the same idea. So I decided to walk around and see where else I could watch the game. After checking several places I ended up walking by the door to Dick's and noticing that the game was on its TVs.  I had run into a couple of other guys while walking and so I grabbed them and we headed in. However, because the bar was already full, the host said that he could put us in the back room that also had a TV.  The three of us ended up getting our own table next to the fireplace and located within easy site of a big, flat screen, TV in the back room where we got personalized service from the waiter. The service was great and the food and drinks were excellent. What a better experience than being crammed like a sardine into a sports bar! In fact, this may be my new place to watch games when I'm not at the stadium.  Dick's Hideaway, I hope you don't mind if I call you Brad's Hideaway!

vYCs5FinDzXiDMkII8yxvw.text: This has always been my favorite bar in the valley...  until last night. I went with the intention of discussing the use of their private dining room for a birthday celebration but the service was nothing like I've previously experienced. It felt completely impersonal and rushed. Plus paying $9 for one enchilada a la carte is bad enough but then being charged another $2 for tomatoes as a garnish is completely ridiculous.  Disappointing!

PulFu9kEy0SwuaEc-dcHDw.text: Truly is hidden. Entrance is next door to Luci's Market. Not a lot of seating. I would say it is a $$$ rather than $$ menu but food is delicious. House salad dressing very lite and savory. You are Able to watch the chefs if you are seated at the bar, polite servers, great drinks.

c4hgNRao_NinRO0wkeUFgA.text: From what I can tell, I don't think Dick's wants your business. With no sign out front and as hard as it is to find, you have to be in the know to give the aptly titled Hideaway a try.  But search for it you must, for it is truly one of the best breakfasts I have ever had the pleasure of consuming!   I'm a huge fan of Mexican style breakfasts and the Huevos Rancheros are insane! Two eggs any style, served on a blue corn tortilla, smothered with green or red chile and cheese, served with potatoes and beans and it is enough for two people.  Just look at the pictures posted by the other Yelpers people.  You can tell just by looking at the photos that this place is going to be awesome.  Just go in and give this place a try already (if you can find it!).  How many more five star reviews do you need?!?

l6aK8vKdG5S5eakNnUAppg.text: Outstanding New Mexico-style food, creative menu and every dish is delicious. Depth of flavor,  great sauces, lots of spice and plenty of heat. Warm, funky interior decor with minimal lighting. Dark, cozy and intimate. Delicious food, a good draft beer selection and talented wait staff - what's not to love? Go. You'll be glad you did.

a3DHr_cqenFPNk8cxscfOA.text: A True "hideaway," as it was extremely hard to find. No outside signage. Great menu selection but should be marked as $$$ - food is outrageously expensive ($51 for two drinks, chips and chorizo queso and 6 extremely small mushrooms). Service was good, small setting, very dark and quaint. Decided against having full dinner because of the prices.

sg6s6zbSRkAiFLS6IMh6sQ.text: Hands down best breakfast joint in Phoenix proper. Your food will take awhile, your drink will always be full, be patient, it's worth it.

xJrSC_ZuRV0b0MoKLnaT-w.text: Literally almost gave up on going here because we couldn't find it. After reading the reviews we found it. Massive portions, good food, quirky, awesome, just go here! We will be back to try more menu items!

og9a-ZXJXuoV_sNQwxeJIw.text: Mere words alone cannot describe the tantalizing cuisine found here. The Oscars New Mexico Ceviche is to die for served with warm blue corn and regular tortilla chips. My entree, the pork chop stuffed with chorizo was incredible! It's very casual and a friendly locals atmosphere. Find a reason to eat here, you will not be disappointed!

mYP9n_t-NzN52sLXgu6IZg.text: Our best meal in Phoenix.   It's in a dowdy strip center, and a little hard to find, but worth the search.   They have a killer happy hour, with awesome New Mexican cuisine.   Not a cheap meal outside of the happy hour specials, though.   But, no complaints!

w5SCCXEdmGNgkm94VpDP0w.text: Really enjoyed the dining experience.   Started with the calamari and bacon wrapped jalapenos.  Both were excellent, the jalapenos packed a little heat.   I had the New Mexico Enchiladas and followed the suggestion of the waiter to have both the red and green chile sauce.  Great suggestion both had a different flavor that added to the overall great taste of the plate.  My wife had the salmon with blueberry salsa and also really enjoyed her meal.   They have a HH that ends at 6, some of the items on the main menu are also on the HH menu at a lower price.

mtswZAa8DMaQH4Hc4RtehQ.text: There is NO WHERE else to go for brunch.  Mimosas with fresh squeezed orange juice, the best bloody mary ever.  The next decision is whether to choose red or green to put on top of your enchiladas, huevos....I pick both!   A local gem, for sure.

2eybG7kEkgrdEtA7TvwOJg.text: Went to Dick's Hideaway the other night with a group of 4 for dinner. Thought by reading some of the reviews it was going to be a pretty cool place. Unfortunately our experience was not the service from two different waiters was straight out rude. Chip on their shoulders and really bad attitudes. Ordered drinks to start and had to send them back twice because they did not get the order right and both times they gave us looks and comments ( attitude again)  about requesting to get what we originally asked for in the first place. I'm always considerate and kind understanding of how the service business is so continued to be light hearted and friendly to the servers but we definitely did not feel the love coming back LOL. The food was okay but not anything to go back again for. Too bad for them! So many great places to go with great food and exceptional service that appreciate the business!

xjVIq-CiOn3yVqzRYQDSew.text: The best food in the valley. Period. Their breakfast enchiladas are incredible and I crave them weekly.

2Xbtr2FSJwhxMtXj3CcEaQ.text: We visited Phoenix last week, husband wanted some southwestern food so found Dick's Hideaway. Went for lunch, drove by twice, really is a hideaway, no sign out front. Walked into a dark bar area, was a little worried because we had our 3 year old but they said sit anywhere. Cozy seating and dark. Nice service, but this got a 5 because the food was awesome. Loved it, wish we had something half that good where we live. Husband had the chilorio, was perfectly spicy and wonderful. I had the carne adovado, can't say enough, was so good that I wished we'd ordered more to bring home.

TGJONUCR0TIcMfdlD6NWkA.text: This is a funky little place with real chacter . Menu ranges from breakfast to dinner. Entrees are numerous; from American, Italian and Mexican . We found food way above average. Service above average. A few cautious: dining area is unusually dark and caution is necessary because of steps, there is no sign out front, check with waiter for how hot chili's are before ordering.

E9_4rsNsOlrN8WTp2zk70Q.text: Pretty much the best breakfast/brunch I have ever had.  Chile rellano was unbelievable and who doesn't love one for breakfast.  Wife had the breakfast burrito.  It was great.  It had broccoli and asparagus in it.  That doesn't sound great but it is.  Also, beans were tasty.  They did have an extra vegetable charge and didn't put tomatoes in the burrito, but it was so good we didn't care.

P4EKr1Jso9MozwfZGoFHbA.text: Great atmosphere, dark and smokey (from the grill). The food is super spicy but amazing! Park in the back and enjoy some of the best tex-mex in AZ.

JEZiWW3l4A39dWfyp5JdFQ.text: Hidden with no signs Dicks is a gem.  Great quality food and service.  Try the cocktails they rock. Laugh but their beans and rice are my favorite.

CJLZHfCUdVyqO2CIxTOJrA.text: One word can describe the food here:  perfection.  All the meals I've had here has been absolutely delicious served by the most charming waitstaff.  Someone recently told me their Chilean Sea Bass was the best he's ever had and I believe him . . . I can't wait to taste that dish!

hIv1TTDjssRPpsgvf-I2Pg.text: I enjoyed the Benedict combo for brunch.  The place is a real hole in the wall and you have to know about it or you'll definitely miss it.  Great service and great food and reasonably priced. Definitely worthy of the high ratings it has gotten.

3nYHPYMinvqX_UDuLF0meg.text: We have been to Dicks twice.  Both times we have been amazed.  The slightly wood smoked smell and taste was intoxicating.  We couldn't decide between the breakfast burrito or the Chili Relleno.  Both are excellent.  We get red and green sauce, or "Christmas" because both sauces are wonderful.  We will be back.

2baUHqT-pTYdhp21nDMMlQ.text: I am not sure who labeled Dick's Tex-Mex, they are WAY off.  It is New Mexican for sure, and AMAZING for certain things and ok for others and not so great for some things.  The atmosphere is fun, quirky and all Dick's!  Wood floors, cozy tables, cool wood bar, fully testosterone driven decor with some Kokopellis  and Coyotes thrown in for good measure.  Dark, smokey (the good kind wafting up from the smoker and the hot hardwood coals on the grill), comfortable and casual.  John Wayne would have felt quite at home here. The wait staff has always been awesome.  In the 12-15 year that I have been going to Dick's I have only had one bad experience with a member of the waitstaff, luckily they are gone now.  The food is great in very specific areas, like the Carne Adovada, Blue Corn Smoked Turkey Enchiladas and Posole which are exceptional.  Smokey, spicy, tender and savory.  Sunday brunch with a plate of Carne Adovada and an over easy egg will make your entire year!  The quesadilla is solid, the hamburger is wonderful, the grilled shrimp and smoked foods rock!  When they stick to the New Mexican cuisine the food is heartwarmingly great.  When they stray... sometimes it works and most of the time it doesn't.  I usually steer away from the fish specials which usually are over breaded, over cooked, over sauced and unfortunate when it is all said and done. I also stay away from the salads which are over worked and heavy.  The wine and beer selection are unexpectedly good for a neighborhood bar setting, but I usually go for the Prickly Pear Margarita!  Needless to say I weigh just under 200 lbs at 6 foot and two are sufficient to make me slur my words a touch, well, more than a touch (even with a full belly of Carne Adovada).  But it I enjoy every minute of the food, atmosphere, drinks and camaraderie at Dick's Hideaway!

poxX6izt0QcioaOFOFwu0A.text: I have driven by this place for years and knew I needed to stop in.  How can a place that doesn't have a sign stay in business if it's not good?  It was just good, it was fantastic!  We had a breakfast burrito with chorizo and green chile as well as the carne adovada.  Both were spicy, flavorful and delicious in every bite.  In addition to great tasting food, they also give you plenty of it.  We even took a to go box home and hubby had that for lunch!

JOvfx2SjDlIr1BKjloKY3Q.text: We absolutely loved the carne adovada. Hubby had it with eggs and I had a burrito with green sauce. Fabulous smoke flavor. Our new favorite restaurant. Recommend the pasta Heidi too. Fantastic!

LxGr9lkTgKFmiHkoIc-8tA.text: Great place to eat if you're jonesin' for a more laid back divey ambience. Also $5 margaritas for happy hour can't be beat! Thank you Dick's Hideaway, I'll be back soon to try more of you!

SLjHwxDLpUXM0LAMXuV_Ow.text: Oh. Mah. Gah. So delicious!  Sure, it's unmarked, and therefore difficult for an out-of-towner like myself,  but it's well worth the effort. The green chile and eggs was amazing! The pork was amazingly tender, the chile spicy and full of roasted flavor, and the eggs were perfectly poached. Come hungry, you'll need the space and want to eat every last bite. I've also had the Fish Trio. The wood-fired grill adds significant flavor to three large portions of fresh fish (mine were Mahi-Mahi, Swordfish, and Salmon), but the flavor pack was in the salsas - a Mango, a Pineapple, and a Red Roasted one. The fruit ones had a nice balance of hot and sweet. The red roasted one was smoky, savory, and spicy without overwhelming. My Bloody Mary was solid, not particularly boozy, and the mix was more on the good spicy, homemade side of life than on the straight outta a bottle grossness. The accompanied shot of beer was much appreciated - Is this an Arizona thing, cause if so, I want to move here.  The atmosphere is quirky - think "No Kardashians" and "Unattended children will be given an espresso and kitten." It's cozy and intimate for lunch, and I can imagine it'd be super crowded at dinner. Service was excellent without any issues.

5Qe76g6TuQL4WKEiGsQrHQ.text: Was walking to another place for a late breakfast when I saw someone walk out of Dicks Hideaway, when I asked them about it he said its his favorite place to go. So i wandered in and was not crazy about how dark it was and the seating was odd...like a bar. (it is a bar)  But was intrigued by atmosphere so I stayed. Besides it was dark enough to hide the fact I had no make-up on. ^_^.  I ordered the Huevos Rancheros with green chili, that was months ago and I still think about that dish. I would go back anytime.

KtVZCFdDoPAb42MzskC_OA.text: The best New Mexican food I've had in Arizona. It will be on the stop list when we are in Phoenix!

lRVnYgAlZMLufGQjacskZg.text: Yes, it sure is hidden.  No sign at all.  Only way I found it, is that it is on Yelp with great reviews.  You do need the physical address.  Look close at the door NEXT to the restaurant, go in.  You will be surprised.  Went for breakfast and bloodies on a Sunday morning.  It was very good.  Not cheap food, but this is a bar type atmosphere.  Not a bad bar, a nice relaxing place.  The portions are large, and the food is on the 4-5 star level.  Service was very good too.

cIyEuwyLVI8BewM4nQCETg.text: I really enjoy this hidden gem. I wish someone had told me about it sooner. Food has always been enjoyable regardless of what I have tried and service is quite decent. Definitely a fun, cozy little spot to visit. Dick's Hideaway is on the short list of spots I like to visit while in this area but note that due to the size I suggest planning your visit well as it can fill up quickly.

VKzEp0ljjBt3NsXt-DU-bg.text: One of the reasons I like Yelp is the opportunity to find small, local places you would seldom be able to find on your own.  Dick's Hideaway last night was such an experience.   You would never find it if you didn't have the actual street address, there is no sign outside!  Once you are inside it's something else.  A long bar facing the open kitchen was packed with at least a dozen diners.  A handful of tables in front of the bar and in an adjacent room were equally packed at 8:45.  I went inside and found no host, when a pleasant guy who turned out to be host, bartender, server asked us to wait on the sidewalk and handed us a short wine list with very good selections.  Before he could deliver our glasses he told us two seats were open at the bar and we were seated.     The menu is predominately New Mexican dishes.  My wife had the Santa Fe style pork enchiladas and I had the New Mexico platter with a chile relleno and chicken burro, all with the green chile sauce.  I have to say, we spent a week in Santa Fe a couple of years ago and the food at Dick's was every bit as good as anywhere we ate in Santa Fe.  Their tiny kitchen cranks out some very good food.   The portions were large; I would recommend splitting a salad.  A couple who sat next to us at the bar split the most expensive item on the menu, rack of lamb at $42, and seemed very happy.     I will definitely plan to visit Dick's again next time we are in Phoenix, fun and good food and wine.

DZ3IzREH37XeS4TYosnHsw.text: Dick's Hideaway has great food. The people inside are always friendly. Sitting at the bar and having a one or two of their great Bloody Mary's is fun.  Go ! , You will like it.

6HLm8iTsTydyL7-AAwAx8Q.text: My only complaint was that it was still very hot inside during our summer visit though air conditioned. Tried their chili relleno. The BEST I've had in 20 years. Our waiter practically read my mind as to the wine choice though it was my first visit. Definitely returning soon!

htT9HNz5IaNPvP_5pqTZ1A.text: I forgot where I heard about this place, but I'm glad I went. Great food! Here's a few things you should know before your 1st visit:    ** First off, there is no sign on the establishment -- at all. So, don't bother 'looking' for this place while trying to find it. Just use the Force, follow your instincts, and find the address provided (it is correct).    ** This place is SMALL inside (that seems weird using big letters to emphasize something tiny, but I digress...). This place is so small that if the small bar fills up, you may have to sit at the big community table in the small dining room and eat with strangers -- which may feel a bit awkward at first, but do it anyway. It's kind of fun.    ** The food is very delicious. I had the Tenderloin Benedict and I'm salivating now just thinking about it. Mmmm. The beef was so tender, and the flavors so rich. I also took a taste of the Carne Adovada (which isn't the usual Mexican style), and that is good too. I'd like to come back again and try some more dishes, but I'm definitely a fan already.

K44W-LQToiDZimd8_Hyriw.text: Chile rellenos make me pretty happy! Oh, they're amazing here, too. You should take me...

VPlh56td1lSD-1RntF7AQA.text: Revisited Dick's after a ten year hiatus(I lived in NV). Was as great as ever.   We sat in the back area (new since my last visit). It's nice and was empty as we went late.   We order a quesadilla the three enchilada plate and the reyeno plate. Wow tons of food. Like three meals for two. Was great. Way spicey.   The only downfall was how loud those plates are as the clearers and servers toss them into the bin.   Love that great things only improve with time.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesadilla
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enchiladas
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

D23ZzZXga7N-LDh_38bzOg.text: By far the worst service I have ever received at any restaurant. Waited for a table for over an hour, then waited for our food for over another hour. We had to ask to have our water refilled and no servers came to check in us or apologize for the obscene wait. Asked to speak to a manager, who never apologized but just said they were busy with a large party. Will never return

RE-WESvlyQvuYbxue8jHig.text: Great reviews so we gave it a go.  I wasn't really into any of it.  IF the food was killer I would have loved the whole feel but I wasn't so it felt tight and dark for a brunch place.  I will say I think they use quality ingredients so I understood the price being kinda high, but for the price I can think of a TON of places I would prefer.  I haven't been to New Mexico though so maybe I just don't care for this style of food.  Another thing that bugged after being underwhelmed by the food was getting the bill.  I had ordered the Carne Adovada Benedict which as you can see in the pic is $15 and comes with carne, I was charged $2 extra for carne added on my bill.  I didn't order extra, and it is in the name and description of what I ordered so I don't know how it could be an extra charge.  $17 for one (big) breakfast plate and I was not impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Y4Ecd-k2Fdg_sBWw1Bw2uw.text: Food could be good but the cook was smoking in the open kitchen! We had con queso and the chips smelled like cigarette smoke.  So did we by the time we left. Last time for this place.

BSpHlNrOR04os2N5tZZTDw.text: I've never had a bad meal or a bad time here. Seating is limited but that's part of the charm. I prefer a bar stool to watch the magicians at work making meals and I feel that the service is on point since you're pretty much right in front of the staff. If you've never been, familiarize yourself with the menu beforehand BC it can get really busy and this helps you not look like a noob...as well as this expedites getting that piping hot deliciousness in your belly that much more quickly.   Warming: metal serving plates are HOT. They warn you and I've warned you so just don't touch them!  Favorite things about DH:  * They open at 6 am and serve delicious breakfast and lunch options everyday * Bloody Mary's are served with a sidecar of beer, which is how I prefer to make mine at home  * Nice wine list and decent tap selection  * Happy Hour includes tasty bites and $5-6 bevies * Enchiladas. You must have at least one cheese! Chicken, smoked turkey, carnitas are all bomb as well, I prefer the extra Christmas smothering to boot! * Green Chile Stew will burn whatever evil looms from those chilly or soggy rainy AZ days-get it with the egg on top to combat the heat or sissy it up with sour cream like I do when you can't quite hang.  * Atmosphere is more laidback here than the sister restaurants The Rokerij and Richardson's. I personally believe one should never be full on sloppy in public but they won't judge you if you're hungover in your sweat pants and will probably even help cure you! Be sure to check out their aforementioned other restaurants too when you want to enjoy this same NM cuisine love and are feeling more fancy!

kha3xbdTML5qlvlOhiccJQ.text: Excellent post hike lunch. The views are amazing and, alone, justify the slightly higher price you will pay. The food is unbelievable though. It may not sound the greatest from the menu but the Katherine's way is one of the most creative and delicious pizzas I have ever had. We recommend that you try this place if you are in the area.

q52a7Sl7rLImBwo1LCddIQ.text: Dare I say, better than Richardsons? Dark & intimate, perfect place for a tryst with their amazing enchiladas and a glass of Washington State Rose to offset the spiciness. A wonderful treat, highly recommended.

Dd9SqFzjNbnwzrw8dypTBQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Arizona. Whether it's brunch or dinner, this place does not do you wrong!! I usually need hot sauce for just about everything but the flavors are so darn good - you don't need a thing.   Bloody Mary's are also one of my favorites from here unlike most places it's not chunky and gross at the end. Can't beat the brunch drink prices!  Every time I'm here I know I need to come back because there are too many things I've yet to try and look delicious!

XC2sMuQw984tqPRqWk8Grg.text: Hopped off the plane and immediately started my search for breakfast. Headed towards the cemetery, I opened up the Yelpasphere to aid in my search. Dicks Hideaway with 4.5 stars sounded promising. I headed there. It was well hidden. I drove around the parking lot looking for a sign. I followed the GPS for the last 100 feet leading me to the unmarked doors and a couple of menus on the wall. Upon entering I walked into the darkened room and allowed my eyes to adjust from the bright sunlight. I found myself in a bar and that awkward moment creeped in. So I looked around rather dazed and confused before being approached by the bartender. He asked how he could help, I responded, " I am told you have great breakfast her." He was incredibly accommodating and suggested I try his favorite, Green Chile Benedict. I took his suggestion. He offered some tobassco sauce. My meal arrived. My first glance and impressive response was Wowzers. Huge portions. The metal plate was screaming hot. I zapped myself a couple of times. The first bite went well. The eggs were cooked to perfection, atop the pulled pork. The flavor profiles were insanely good. I say that with a caveat only because of the offered hot sauce. In my opinion, the green chilies brought just the right amount of heat to the party in your mouth. It was all I could do to finish this monstrosity. I finally tapped out and cried uncle. Insane place I enjoyed it. Might consider coming back for dinner before flying out. I saw some great specials on the wall.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YdMXFBmGKdhTTRGW2IlwEw.text: The food here is amazing! Everything is cooked in front of you on an old iron stove. The atmosphere is dark and Moody. It has a really interesting story behind it if you go, I recommend asking the staff about it. It's actually pretty small so if you have a big party you might want to call ahead.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2bhwd14eh7EF_3LgHHu8NA.text: My favorite restaurant in Phoenix!  Dark.  Great bar.  Killer food.  Everything on the menu is incredible. Dicks takes New Mexican / Southwestern food to another level.   Carne Adobado - absolutely insane! Falls apart with adobado sauce with bite.   Chile relleno - filled with pork chicken cheese or smoked turkey. Definitely get the pork and smoked turkey!  Expect to leave smelling like smoke - the grill is behind the bar but totally worth it.  Phenomenal place to watch a game when it's hot. I don't know how they do it but the place stays super cool in the summer.   Great place to have an private event in the secret room in the back.

WX2tfIRJ7lVWd0d-n9XXcQ.text: 1 star for this place. 2 words for this place: overpriced and underwhelming. When I say overpriced, I mean WAY overpriced. When I say WAY overpriced I'm taking about the $40 pasta entrees that they have? How and why is it so expensive? It doesn't even seem like they use that good of quality ingredients in their stuff that would justify their prices. My wife and I ordered the carne adovada, beef enchiladas, and we started with the calamari. The calamari....abysmal. If you are going to charge $18 for calamari, almost a $20 dollar appetizer not only should it be delicious but the portion should also be pretty large. Unfortunately, neither one of these things happened. Small portions, probably a store bought sweet and sour sauce. I was shocked when I saw this. The carne adovada that everyone seems to rave about, was not the business. Pretty bland and the beans and rice that they were served with needed some help. I will say that at least the carne adovada was a very big portions and the tortilla that it was served with was good. Same story with the enchiladas. The sauce tasted either burnt or the chilis that they used were way too smokey. Disappointing to say the least. Felt pretty ripped off when we left this place. Crazy and unnecessary prices to match unimpressive food. Not what I'm looking for when going out for a meal.

SUPdikSCeuVckr2HzHBPDw.text: Great place low key and hidden...   food is always good but very heavy...   makes you feel like your in a mountain town.   Always great.

Iu4CTKyuQLOUmgkylxk0Uw.text: This place is a hidden gem!! Great food !! Best eggs Benedict ever!!!  Worth a little drive to get it!  I would have given it 5 stars but unfortunately our last few  (3)visits they have sat us back by the bathroom and the smell of cleaning fluids becomes over powering ( all 3 times).  Don't need Clorox with my breakfast. If you don't get seated in the back it's the best breakfast around !

dmiWlklKNlJ6t4ORiMqhaQ.text: Not a cheap place, but one of my favorite restaurants. Every time we are in town, we stop here, and it never disappoints. Pro tip: the jalapeno appetizer does not have the seeds removed. I like Hot, but I burned out a few clients.

1R09pzEgY31SqI34pxC6dQ.text: Really nice atmosphere. Food tasted great and service was excellent. Can be hard to find for the first time visitors but I suppose that's what the name is all about. Highly recommend it.

5FVMFTksrTAQR1rriQfrdA.text: Love Dick's Hideaway\Rokerij\Richardson's, always sit in the bar luckily there were tables available it's a small narrow bar sometimes it's a challenge, very intimate! We were greeted immediately, all the staff were very kind and personable, our main server seemed uninterested in us but we never needed anything (luckily) thanks to a large bottle of water on the table, two words Pasta Heidi then call my cardiologist. Green chili linguine, grilled chicken and chipotle cream sauce. So delicious back in the day the generous portion was served over a tortilla with melted cheese so kind of gave it a nice bottom crust, today was two folded tortillas on the side like a fajita, not a fan but still fantastic and rich as an understatement. Spicy and an amazing zing to it and all pasta comes with a house salad delicious but basic, lettuce, cheese, red peppers in lieu of tomatoes with ranch dressing. The pasta and salad at least for me is two meals! Decadent but delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salad (included with pasta)
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cocktails
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pasta Heidi

BGjjS1tsPjoc3eE5nlbS3g.text: The food is flawlessly delicious and yummy the meats are fall off the bone tender and the sauces killer good.  The folks are super friendly and helpful.  Honest delicious good!!!!!!! It's a must for Phoenix!!! Yummmmmmmmm

bMk4k1Xo7-7A80SZBxzpmg.text: The food here was amazing. My first time going and I had the enchiladas and eggs off the brunch section. Everything on my plate was perfectly cooked and had amazing flavor to it. Highly recommended and this is somewhere I would go again.

MfQm_x5TuCrdSymzTnk5SA.text: Almost don't want to write this review.  I love everything about this place, please don't go there.  I don't want to have to wait .  We went for breakfast, it was every bit as good as the dinner on my last trip.  I live in Ca, this is one of my must visits when in the area.

nd41IPalES2WbSbATY18bw.text: Service was absolutely terrible. I can't even fathom how incompetent the staff is. How is it not possible to split checks for a small party of 6? If it's not possible, you should insert the disclaimer prior to accepting orders. It's extremely disappointing considering the "raving reviews" and recommendations from close friends. Food was a bit tasteless despite the cost and our server was absolutely absent. I rarely ever post reviews, but this deserves the 1 star rating. Even my friends that referred me and tagged along attested to how horrid the experience was. Maybe it was just an off day? Idk, but rest assured that i will not return. You're better off investing your time and money into FOX Concepts instead. Exceptional service and food quality every time! Sorry, not sorry.

yAX1HNxnMrKPJud24prVWQ.text: Such a unique find in Phoenix! Coming from Napa where all food is sublime, I was so happy here! Heidi's pasta and guac and chips, enough to feed a family! Highly recommend, but don't bring the kids.

7brmXXr_5u87S6pI1FXnEA.text: This place always popped up as a high-rated restaurant on Yelp and after reading all the reviews, I decided to give it a try.  First of all, like everyone says this place is a True hideaway, there are no signs.  It is very small with only a couple tables, with dim lighting and rich wood as the decor.  Second, it is a delicious New Mexican/Tex Mex place.  As soon as you walk in the door, you smell the smoker and all the delicious flavors.  Our waiter was awesome, gave us very helpful tips on the menu and portion size.  The meals are very large, extremely hot and impossible to go finish unless you come on a very empty stomach.  My friend and I both tried the Carne Adovada, which isn't your typical Mexican but it sure was yummy.  The pork is so soft and it is marinated for hours in a rich chili sauce, you can really taste the smoker - it is so overpowering! Let me just say, the beans served with the carne were some of the best beans ever.    This is by far some of the best southwestern cuisine I have ever eaten!  Next time, I would really like to try some other dishes!!
