photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Partially eaten Carne Adovada!!

18oBdQ1y5bDu-zlpO8Kw4g.text: If you ever have the chance, find this place at the corner of Bethany Home and 16th.  They don't have a sign actually says Sunbrite, True hideaway.   The food here is delirious...better than delicious!  Crane Adovada Duck Relleno Chipotle Ribs  I haven't had any dish that has disappointed and the service is great.    Jason is the best!!!  Tony

faSRVYeVh5fqqbuXpnEFmA.text: Dick's Hideaway is one of my favorite spots in the city so naturally for my 21st birthday I decided to visit and have my first drink there (along with some bomb breakfast). Like always the food was amazing and the atmosphere was perfect, unfortunately our waiter was far far below average. When taking our orders he was quite rude, telling me one thing then contradicting it completely in his next sentence. Then that was all we really saw of him. Not once did he ask if our meal was good or if we needed anything (we needed more water), although we saw him multiple times helping guests around us. For some reason he just did not want to help us and ignored us. I had to ask someone else to get my food boxed up to take home. When he gave us our check he did not say anything to us, just set it on the table. When he took our check, again he did not say anything or even make eye contact with us. He somewhat redeemed himself by saying happy birthday as we walked out but it does not make up for an entire meal ignored. I did not use his name for privacy but if someone from the restaurant wanted to reach out I will gladly share his name. And again, I seriously love this place. Just this one guy really ruined the entire experience this time. Maybe he was having a bad day, I'm not sure. Hope he gets help if so! Also I got an Irish Coffee and it was good! I think it was good, I don't have anything to compare it to as it was my first drink but I enjoyed it.

pWhbZSyp4jE2S8hzez5STQ.text: Service a little uppity which was not expected and really disappointing. The food quality is superb as well as the cooking. My main issue was that it was so spicy it made me sick. I like Thai food but this was on a level beyond what is tolerable at least for me. Too bad because you can always add hot but cant take it away. I had the pork abd? benedict btw.

on8C8IZn_WAfeTBQP29SDQ.text: Always consistent!  Great service and food is amazing.  We have been going for years and consider this our 3rd favorite restaurant in the valley. If you like southwest food, it's a must!!

5vQv6QjkSdBB0Mvc-h4vww.text: What an amazing find! Do not be fooled by the fact there is no sign or it looks like a real bar. The food is top notch cuisine. I've been here for breakfast and dinner. Both times did not disappoint. The tamales are authentic and delicious!!! Great happy hour specials as well.

8cBuB8wq2GqrTPNStv_IGA.text: This place is amazing! The breakfast was tasty...trust me you will not leave hungry. We will be back for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Midwestern
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Midwestern with beans

aKz8OJEBRbC80Fh4oVTAzQ.text: Such a cool literal hole in the wall restaurant/bar. You'll never find it unless someone takes you there, and I plan on trying to keep it that way; because that's truly what makes it so one of a kind.

MKchSP6YuvYObyNJE-TSlg.text: I wish I could say I liked it, but not so much; however,  it's an interesting concept.    First of all, it's hard to find (that's why they call it Dick's Hideaway...DUH!).  It's really dim on the inside.  The epitome of Southwestern style.  If you walk in and go to the area on the right, there is a huge table that can fit about 10 people, so you would probably be sitting with some strangers.  I don't mind because I like meeting new people.    Anyways, the plates are not shareable (it says so on the menu that sharing is not allowed), which I don't understand because their plates are huge!  I don't like wasting food.  Also, I had the carne adovada, and it wasn't that awesome.  The portion was huge, the meat was too salty.  I wasn't a fan.    The place just has a nice ambiance to it.   The food, not so much.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne adovada breakfast with eggs, pinto beans, and potatoes

hXOKSyLWpQa39epD_SEzPQ.text: Food was fantastic, service was great, and ambiance was nice.  Had Vic's Meatloaf and eggs with red and green chili mix.  It wasn't very hot at all.  Others had the pasta and French toast and all were very pleased with no complaints.  The notes on Yelp were right that you really have to look for it because it is not marked.

kaKg95KopuY1nE1y8vL8qw.text: This place was great and plentiful.  We had a delicious breakfast. It turns out we could have shared a breakfast and still be full straight through lunchtime.  I highly recommend this place.

Z55yANR9l-Ls1Dl7Xuc7ZQ.text: We had a few hours for dinner in Phoenix on a Friday night before our flight home and after searching for authentic Mexican food online, I found Dick's Hideaway featured on a tourism site under the recommendation of a local chef the site interviewed for suggestions. Turns out the research was very important because I saw pictures of what the unlabeled entrance looked like and thus had an easy time finding it. However, there is no hostess so seat yourself. The various waiters seemed rushed but whenever they stopped by were very friendly. The place was pretty full around 5:30 PM, surprisingly, but emptied out afterwards, so there was plenty of bar seating. Ambience is low-key with slight upscale flair, so not the most authentic. There is more parking in the back of the strip of stores if the front is full.  I had to try the Carne Adovada based on reviews and this was the best pulled pork I have had in my life - that defines the 5-stars in my review. It is defined by its smoky flavor and tender texture. The sides it came with--warm flour tortilla, rice, and pinto beans--were also extremely flavorful. Portion was huge so I had to share with my partner, and even then with one entree each, we could not finish the food. Ceviche appetizer was only 3-stars, and my partner's Grilled shrimp wrapped in bacon was also stellar, though can't compare with the Carne Adovada dish. Their red ale was smooth and not too heavy. Would highly recommend this hidden spot!

gj_HC0Qg5gsTc0uxufVZ4A.text: Good overall.  Avoid the green chili because the back food prepers leave seeds and large pieces of roasted green chili skin in the sauce. If you're ok with skin and seeds then go for it you brave soul.    Update: 1.5.18 green chili was clean. No skin and minimal seeds.  Thank you Dick personnel for listening.  Best French toast I've tasted...I tend to sample French toast from all places I eat.

DQxtCFSjiMab6QUbNafPzA.text: Absolutely love this place. Whether its lunch during the week, brunch on the weekends, or dinner with family and friends, this place always make me feel great. Not to mention the food is absolutely amazing!

0MFBLwdN7iPRwDof3fTbWA.text: I wish I could give this dump zero stars.   I was told this was the place to go, the place to check out. Its a local hidden hotspot. Well Hidden is correct, after a frustrating drive around the shopping center and a couple direct phone calls asking for the location, we found the spot. We had to walk thru what seems to just be a dish washing pit or a normal restaurants kitchen.   The place was so small, I thought if more then three people stood in the room, the place would be full. EXTREMELY CLAUSTROPHOBIC in this tiny one room bar.  The server that first approached our table was an older gentlemen who didn't seem to want to be there today, I don't blame him I wouldn't want to be there either.  after he was gone for what seem like an hour but was in reality only 23 mins, a new server came by to take our order.   The food was sub par if that. A too hot to touch (which shouldn't be put in front of a human without proper oven mitts) metal plate gets put in front of me with a unimaginative plop of red in covered by two eggs is set in front of me. I know most Mexican food looks like slop, but I did expect a higher level then this.   Sadly after a very long frustrating tour of the back of the shopping center it is located in, service with a grimace, and some food a pet roach would be happy to receive, we sadly turned our heels and left.   Utter waste of a perfect brunch day, at least they had some funny signs.

azCGarlflxJAC_QHjFDJGg.text: My pretty wife and I came here for a rep dinner. We were severed a sampling of their dishes so it might not be completely representative of the the restaurant as a whole. Over all the food was just average. I had garlic shrimp and pasta which had way over cooked shrimp and my wife had the same. Others had the smoke pork chop which looked good but I heard them complain it was tough. The service was great for the large crowd. The private room wee were in was a let down. It was cramped and the place was musty and seemed like a old cellar with wine bottles on the walls with a thick layer or dust everywhere. We won't return.

TmVn5bVYokjGV5b0L9xWow.text: Too many favorites!! The vibe here is friendly and chill. It's fairly small so it's ideal to go with a small group. I went with a few girlfriends and we shared several things. The bacon wrapped jalapenos are a must! We also shared the queso, tostadas and the New Mexican platter. I wish I lived here so I could come back and try more! The Bloody Mary is even amazing. Right amount of kick! I'd be a regular if I could!!

29EsbZj7IRLKE5eEQ7x5qw.text: Pretty disappointed!  Not gonna lie!!  The service wasn't great and I was not impressed with the food!!  Since when can you cook chicken breast, shrimp and steak on a skewer at the same time and everything is tender?  Never!!

MFLTBtDEsvo57ZPWCyEEpA.text: Ahhhhh the irony! The gf and I woke up Labor Day, and we were gonna go for it. We were going for the Dick's!  Arrived at 11am, and it was busy, but we still got 2 seats right at the bar. sweet. Ordered Bloody Marys and our bartender gave us 2 little sidecars of DosXX. Wha? "It's all about you, today," and he smiled. So cool. We were tired, hungover, and this was such a nice bright touch to start our day.    Tenderloin Benedict (medium rare) for me, Adovada for the lady. Clean plates: indeed!  I'm really a bitch about a good hollandaise and man, I have got to hand it to them, they do it proper. The adovada was saucy and totally hump-worthy.  What a fantastic way to start off my Fall. This Kitty is a-purring!

ztsdvNHR6gfaFMRu-pOVag.text: Dick's has that special something - the allure of the secret spot, your proximity to food coaxed by open flame, the forced intimacy, the darkness on the edge of visibility... and booze.  It's the food of Richardson's within a speakeasy atmosphere. Quirky rustic  ambiance served with a meaty, habanero kick. Great for an adventurous early date where you want to see if the other person "gets it", and to "get some" later if they do get it. And of course, an old reliable that you suddenly perk up and remember when you think you've run out of options for a great casual meal.  Also, the private room/wine cellar is a great option for smallish family gatherings, company events and holiday parties. The reservation fee completely applies to the tab and the enivronment itself keeps the conversation moving.  Don't ever change Dick's! (does that need a comma somewhere?)

B35Ry_9PYF7wti-zylNqpw.text: I love Dicks.  Uhhhh  By this point, I've probably had everything on the menu twice over. There are so many dishes that are both varied to please everyone, and still consistent with what they are going for which is the New Mexican Cuisine.   Dick's has it all, a quaint and unique atmosphere. It feels like a small eatery you'd find in a downtown of a big city, it's a really fun, dark, kind of sexy place to take a date too. There aren't many better first date locales.  The Pork Chop Chorizo, Roasted Garlic Plate, Red White and Blue Enchiladas, and of course the Carne Adovada are some of the real standouts for me. They serve Chimay on draft, the servers are friendly, and it's got the fun great atmosphere to boot. You owe it to yourself to try it.  I just hate telling people I had Dicks for dinner.

pnMMWke9sjMj_zgyjeRbDQ.text: I was introduced to Dicks one Sunday morning and instantly fell in love. Ehm, um, I meant fell in love with Dick's Hideaway.  Not that there is anything wrong with falling in love with dicks.  Nevermind.  I love Mexican-style food for breakfast.  Why can't eggs be served with beans, tortillas, and green chile sauce?  I have had the Carne Adovado with eggs and the Huevos Ranchers.  Both are excellent.  Served with tortillas, potatoes, beans, and a healthy serving of cheese.  It has always come out piping hot on really cool pewter-type plates.  I love pewter plates!  Makes me feel like a knight or something.  It is not the biggest of places and sitting can be sparse depending on time of week and time of day.  Sundays they offer mimosas.  It is truly a hideaway.  It is hidden on the West side of 16th St in a strip mall, under cover of some viney type plant.  I have used type thing 4 times now.  Anyway, give this place a shot.  It is awesome.

HybG7YoVIsIB-duPQQFtjw.text: We went on a recent Saturday night.  Four of us were racking our brains, trying to think of somewhere different to go to dinner together. We were tired of the same old places near us, so I finally remembered about Dick's Hideaway.  The other couple had never been there. My husband and myself had been there about 4 times before, but not in a long while.   We had always eaten at a table in the bar area, which is so cozy! But, we actually were sat in the private dining room, which we had only been able to peek into before. It was really a treat!    we started with the roasted garlic platter, which we have ordered as an appetizer every time we have been there. It is quite a lot of food for 4 as a starter. It is amazing!! You know that you are going to pay for it  the next day, but we just can't resist!   There were 12 specials that night. three of us decided on a special for our dinners. My girlfriend & I had the fresh sea bass.  First we got a salad included, which was very good, with a house dressing. The portion of fish was very large, and so amazingly delicious. My friend said it was some of the best she has ever had, and I have to agree. The plate is filled to the brim with a medley of fresh vegetables and their special green chili pepper mashed potatoes. My husband had the mixed grill special, which included medallions of pork tenderloin, filet mignon and a couple of lamb chops. The meats were perfect! My girlfriend's husband had the surf and turf from the regular menu, and I figure he liked his as well, since the plate was clean!!     I am always a bit nervous recommending to eat out somewhere that is a bit on the pricey side, but they can't wait to go back! Neither can I !!

V1B0hAf4oG0qksCrAWQZYg.text: I'm ready to move to Phoenix to be closer to my new love, Dick's Hideaway.  Thanks Phoenix yelpers for directing me to the mother of all whole-in-the-walls.  I ordered the first thing I saw on the menu, Pasta Heidi, which is green chile linguine with grilled chicken in a chipotle cream sauce.  It was so good, I'd like to move to Phoenix and get a job at Dick's, just for the employee meal.  I'll have to settle for a few more meals there before we leave town, because my husband thinks I'm being ridiculous.  I blame Dick's.  Can't wait to try their breakfast AND lunch.  See you tomorrow Dick's Hideaway.  Love Mary-Anne

BDTKyL2PyWbwED03PqiDZA.text: Walking into the joint, I thought I was going to love it. The small space (3-4 tables and 7-8 bar seats) and aesthetic of the room screamed "my kind of place!" We grabbed seats at the bar (the only open seats at the room) and immediately ordered a couple beers. Bueno.  The food, however, was no bueno. The chips and guac were disappointing (never a good sign). Chips need to be thick to stand up to guacamole's weight. These were thin and brittle. The guac had a pretty middle of the road flavor - nothing to write home about. My entree was the pork enchiladas and they were just a goopy, greasy mess. The meat tasted pretty fatty and didn't have any real flavor to offer besides oily. The 1:1 ratio with the super oily cheese wasn't helping any. My dad had some kind of fish dish which inspired the dreaded "This tastes weird. Here, taste this. Does it taste weird to you?" exchange. My brother reports that his skewers were also pretty blah.  Maybe we caught them on an off night?

VFesQqzj0vYnopTUu_lG8Q.text: So I went here for lunch today with my dad and my grandma and I thought it was just ok... definitely not as good as everyone made it seem. We had a little trouble finding it, as there is no sign, but it is right next to Luci's market. The set up is a bit weird with a bar and then a couple huge tables in the back. We sat at the really big table with just three of us. I ended up ordering the New Mexican platter that had a chili relleno, tamale, and chicken burro with green sauce and red sauce on the side. I asked or no beans, but I got em anyway, which actually turned out fine because I liked their beans (i usually am not a fan). My dad got the blue, white, and yellow (?) corn enchiladas. His was actually better than mine in my opinion. However, I thought the best item was the tamale... i think it had pork in it, not sure, but it was quite tasty. The relleno wasn't anything special and I actually really did not like the chicken burro... so much so that I only had a few bites of it. The chicken tasted weird... like maybe it was boiled in dirty water or something... not good. at all. So overall it wasn't bad, but I wouldn't want to pay 15$ when 2/3s of the food was meh or less. If I did go back, I think I would stick with the pork, that seemed to be the winning meat at this restaurant... and really, when isn't it?

NAPGnYTpOTBEnBxlyanOBw.text: Dick's Hideaway has become the ritual brunch for a few of us who've taken up running weekend 5K's every few weeks.   Is there any food substance in the state of Arizona that's tastier than the chorizo used to make the breakfast quesadillas here? Maybe a slice of Bianco's Wiseguy pizza. That's about it. As I sat here yesterday for brunch, I remarked to a friend that I couldn't wait until our next brunch here to have that quesadilla again, before the one on my plate was even finished. She felt exactly the same way.   Did I mention the breakfast happy hour special of $5 bloody marys and mimosas? The bloody's come with a free shot of beer.   Best breakfast spot in town, hands down.

O594IwEXy6NODDLw9Paa0g.text: Hidden away it is!  I forgot where it was located (some friends drove me here and I was not paying attention as to how we arrived).  The interior is funky, dark, and small (cool copper counter tops) but that just adds to the character.  I ordered pork enchiladas(?) and shared the sauteed garlic dish (i think that's what it was)?  It was very yummy and left me wanting more.  The only downfall was that the garlic must have gotten into my pores b/c I felt like I smelled of garlic for days!  It was well worth it though and a spot you should certainly check out.

I5jZ6vu-5ev_JC4pmYhx4Q.text: Dick's is one of my top 5 all time favorite restaurants.   The ambiance - intimate, dark, rustic, wood, copper.   Sitting at the bar, watching your food being cooked right in front of you.   The rack of lamb is sublime. The "Taos Combo" or anything on the special board, especially seafood, is always incredible. Their margaritas, cocktails, wine - all great. Bacon wrapped shrimp ftw. They come on a plate with a tortilla on the bottom, rice, beans, and sauce on top, and the bacon wrapped shrimp on top of that. The salad, which comes with many entrees, is awesome. And don't forget the flan, topped with prickly pear syrup. You can't go wrong.   It's a testament to how good this place is that they don't need a sign.

cEuW7qjLe5_WTyoCVa2LJQ.text: You want a fantastic breakfast with a southwestern twist?  You found it.  My favorites are the enchiladas and eggs with pork green chili. Or the green chili meatloaf and eggs.  Or the tenderloin benedict with jalapeno hollandaise!  It's really just hard to go wrong here.  A bit tricky to find as there is no sign but take the time and hunt it down I promise you'll love it!

kOMOlRkaJ15cPlOLhM_L0g.text: LOVE IT!  Too bad its all meat.  Can't go there anymore .  :(  Brunch is awesome, not too busy.  Coffee is great too!  Or you can do a Hoegaarden or Chimay with your eggs.

0939XixcLcCLewjUqUro_w.text: Richardson's burnt to the ground, but Dick's still erect! Well thank god for that, because Dick's has the best brunch menu in town.  The adovada and tenderloin benedict is so amazing it'll make a straight man say that he loves Dick's. The fresh squeezed OJ and ambiance makes this my favorite brunch spot ever.  Just walking through the doors on a Sunday afternoon is almost enough to cure my hangover.. I love Dick's.

VPiLfRqxZ7tlXCWrxqoL6Q.text: Not sure what the hype is all About, way overpriced and the pork chili was way to spicy , also was freezing cold inside, not a great dining experience

clLCyGBW-H7Su-voXXbeKQ.text: If someone hadn't told us exactly where to find Dick's, we would have never known it was there. We were actually in Northern AZ when some tourists mentioned Dick's hideaway. The exterior doesn't even have a sign! Very dimly lit, so at first, I was hesitant. Tiny, tiny eatery. maybe 3 tables, and seating along there bar (we sat at the bar). It was in the middle of a downpour, so our wait was no more than 5 minutes, but every table was full. I can imagine on a regular weekend, the line is probably out the door...the breakfast was fresh, made right in front of you, and I watched as they sprinkled fresh blueberries on my pancakes. Soooo good. The coffee was great and the bacon was out of this world.  My husband has the carne adovada which he LOVED. Charming and eclectic-definitely going back.

fy0IWT2clG1Ny2HqW11paQ.text: We too rented the cellar last week - and what a great dimly-lit little nook that is with the Southwestern fireplace, wine collection and all.  Food was great, and service was OK (The server snapped at me when I questioned about the side salad.  It wasn't clear on the menu whether it came before the entree or with it.)    Anyhow, the Santa Fe chicken was smothered in sauteed mushrooms.  The chicken was a bit too charred but still good nonetheless.  I will go back in the future, but not in a huge hurry.  I've heard of too many good Southwestern places in Phoenix to be in a big rush.

0gTlAWy4v9zXvzCeg0kF8A.text: Owned by the same people behind Richardson's Cuisine of New Mexico just around the corner, Dick's Hideway was a pleaser. It was really busy during Sunday brunch time, the slender bar/restaurant area was packed and I noticed a few customers leave after seeing how packed it was. Our large group reserved the banquet room which is surrounded by racks upon racks of wine and is centered around a unique copper-like dining table.   I ordered one of the enchilada dishes, and asked to have one of them with their red chile and the other with green chile sauce. If you get the enchiladas, I only suggest the green chile, though. Atop them laid an over-easy egg, also served with pinto beans and a cubed potatoe mixture that was quite tasty. This dish was amazing! One of their most popular brunch dishes is the Carne Adovada Burrito, which I constantly hear rave reviews on (come on an empty stomach- its BIG!).  Certainly coming back to try their Bloody Mary's and lunch menu :)

XfHGHUjhCezJWH4K6eoOyQ.text: When I first looked at the menu, my mouth watered, my eyes began to widen...they had Hoegaarden on tap! My fav beer from my days living in Belgium, I just had to have one. Of course, the person I was with promptly ordered three shots of patron, one for each of us and our waitress. You can always spot a kickass place if the wait staff will take a shot with you. Well, we got em and shot em. She did too. Already, this place was up there on my list.  I had the mushroom tamale dinner and it was so good. The rice and beans are perfect, not over cooked like some are. The food was screaming hot when it was dropped which was a good sign it was right off the grill. The open kitchen area made you feel like a part of the restaurant, like you were there cooking right along beside the chefs. The bar has a ton to select from and the cooks are happy to chat with you and hang with you while they're making whatever delicious delight you ordered. Great experience, great company, great food.

Cjmy7pUO9nGAxma0ct_1EA.text: Amazing!!! Fully enjoyed the Spicy Chicken Tostadas and my mister had Carne Advovada.....delish!!! Was pretty hard to find the place......but I guess that's why they call it a hidaway.

GBnpAmTsQ_4lsKo80boP6g.text: This place used to be a staple for my family.  Saturday's we'd wake up and head to Dick's for the Carne Adovada.  But the last few times we've been have been disappointed.  The portions and quality of food and presentation has changed within the last five or six months.    I think it is because they got rid of a lot of the old staff that made that place so awesome.  It was like Cheers, they knew us by name and if not by name at least by face and that is how we were treated...with a smile, great service, and great food.  We are still big fans of Rokerij (which is owned by the same folks as Dick's and Richardsons).  I'd really like to see this place turn back around.  I have many friends who used to frequent this place but not so much anymore.

xVIJOnaDcfv_sx-a3nFw7g.text: Food here is really good.  I am pretty regular to all of the Richardson's restaraunts.  I have to complain about a new sharing policy.  I took my pregnant wife there who couldn't handle eating an entire entree since they are pretty large.  When we requested to share (not split) a meal, they charged us an additional $5.  What kind of policy is this?  As a paying customer, is it reasonable to stick it to me like this?  Disappointing for sure.  I will be frequenting other establishments that appreciate their customers ie. upward projects and LGO.  Dicks lives up to the name

YI6YD4JtH25zIX1VNhUnEQ.text: Food is great, drinks are great, recommend grapefruit mimosa. Very small restaurant, close seating. Nice way to say it would be cozy. Servers are very  accommodating.

3FzqwFqtbvE51s_rGWV45w.text: Before arriving in Phoenix, I did some quick research for an easy satisfying meal when I got there. I found Dick's on Yelp, and hastily made a quick decision to have my fellow out of townees join me for dinner when they picked me up at the airport.  Unsure of what we were in for, I kept my fingers crossed as we pulled up to the strip mall keeping our eyes peeled for this hidden treasure.  We just about gave up after circling the strip a few times... until we found the door marked 6008.  Thank goodness we found it!  We luckily got a table right away just as another party was leaving.  One of the guys reassured us of our choice.  He told us we'd love it, and that he comes here everytime he's in town.  The staff was super friendly, super helpful and super nice--always making sure we had everything we needed and that our margaritas were full.  YOU MUST GET THE MARGARITA!  One of the best I've had, probably because of the fresh squeezed lime juice that you can really taste.  The chips and salsa + guacamole is a must.  So fresh.  I could have eaten just this and would have been satisfied.  The recommended skewers appetizer was just as tasty as the bartender said it would be.  Between the three of us, we could have had just these two items and would have been fine, but we each ordered an enchilada entree that definitely put us over the top.  I got both the red and green sauce, but I would recommend just the green.  If we had more time on our trip, we would have come back for a second visit.  We'll definitely be back on our next trip!

RqoMAbRZNtctrVsw7bD9fQ.text: Small restaurant but very good. The gumbo was excellent as we're the flatbreads. Super service as well.  Dinner here was a highlight of our trip to Scottsdale.

A6AAsHwieVHJWsnny-PJ8A.text: Roasted garlic plate: Orgasmic. Slow-roasted, sweet, smoky, soft spreadable ginormous cloves of stinky heaven, served with an array of mysterious dips and spreads, all warm and covered in melted cheese, ready for the spreadin'.   For the times when I expect to kiss my boyfriend again in the next five days, I forgo the garlicky goodness for veggie quesadillas (not on the menu, people): whatever veggies they have back there (broccolini, beets, Brussels sprouts, carrots, whatevs) folded into a delicious tortilla with just enough cheese. Served on a cutting board with amazing salsa on the side.... Nom nom nom.  No place else like it. Hands down. Eagerly awaiting Richardson's triumphant return....

bjywiHj-1vx7W3bU2gqqtA.text: A must eat spot. Great southwest style and a taste sensation!  Wood fired smoke deliciousness in every bite . We had the simmered pork adovado, the relleno platter with choice of two from beef, pork, cheese or smoked turkey, all with rice and beans and green and red salsa.  Muy delicioso bloody Mary's with a beer back. It's a small place with Bar seating and about four tables for 4 in the front room and three larger tables in the side room.  Very friendly service . Don't miss it.  We went twice in two days.

PcaH_zntOkQuFFZVTbIgIA.text: Minimal seating but awesome atmosphere make this the PERFECT happy hour destination!

pQD3rYoetca0Bg6bUz77tg.text: Love this little spot in Phoenix. Saying you went to Dick's Hideaway is almost like bragging that you know how to get there. It's tucked away in this little strip mall and it has maybe 3 tables and a bar you can sit at. Went for breakfast and we had the huevos rancheros and the meatloaf. We were so full and had food leftover. Nice place to take a gf/bf for brunch.

8Vvwaccg3dl2AWn4fIZnGw.text: I'm not a fan of New Mexican-style food, but Dick's Hideaway isn't your usual New Mexican / American fare.  Not sure what you'll find on the menu?  I highly recommend Sunday brunch.  Try the Huevos Rancheros.  Unlike your usual ranchero-esque experience, these are cooked with blue corn tortillas and smothered in your choice of red or green chile.  I went with the green.  Delicious.  Nice heat.   The order of potatoes and beans rounds out this plate.  The Bar tending staff is friendly, professional and cater's to the customers' needs.  Why not?  This place is about the size of my living room...quaint and perfect for hosting any friend with a hangover.  The ambiance is perfect for the perfect bloody mary.  If you can handle the breakfast menu, don't be ashame not to clean your plate.  Dessert is always something to look forward to after a tasty meal.  If chocolate is your thing (it's not mine), try whatever is on the blackboard.  The chocolate brownie a la mode was on the menu...and it was delicious.   I highly recommend this place for those who don't want to be seen, or for a very private meeting with less than a handful of people.  Dick's Hideaway sets the tone.  Enjoy your meal with a little extra spice. Enjoy your drink.  Enjoy your company.

RgbMB6JDY96XlOQUTuKUOA.text: I went here this past Sunday afternoon after reading a bunch of reviews on Yelp.  The place wasn't terribly crowded when my girlfriend and I arrived, and we had the option of sitting either at the bar or at one of the small tables (we sat at a table).  The two guys who seemed to be running the place were both very nice and friendly.    I ordered the chicken enchiladas and eggs and my girlfriend ordered the turkey rellenos and eggs.  I absolutely loved my dish and thought it was a great value for the price ($12).  I was less enthusiastic about the rellenos, but that is because I'm just not a fan of rellenos generally.  I would generally describe our meals as "brunch with a kick," which is exactly what we were looking for.    The only reason that I might be reluctant to come here again is that I am new to the area and I just like to try different places for the sake of trying different places.  Also, it's about a 20 minute drive from Tempe;  as someone previously living in  DC, i am more used to walking to the places i want to eat.  But if i lived nearby i would probably go every week.

x3QrP8I8xDQehZkB8roBAQ.text: Greasy.  Bland.  Poor service. Flat root beer.  Weak sauce.

x0YedJH28HUS3dJnnzr2MQ.text: I won't rave on and on as you have probably already read everything that I am going to say. This place is awesome! The french toast, sausage, and (drum roll please)the carne adovada are among my favorite dishes. The bloody marys are great too! They actually come with a side of beer. This place is hard to find. Just look for the hardware store in the the plaza and it will be directly to the left of it, and to the right of Luci's!!!

oHaBN3bmqKok2xKzSxcsCw.text: This is one place I can eat dinner every night (and brunch, too).  I have been going here for years and it has never disappointed!

dC_zGy_P2uhhzOrKgygyLQ.text: Food is great.  Slightly expensive for eating at a bar but the food is what brings me back. Can be spicy.  Ask the server for help with that.

mA_sc_1JD2znxBYWSQYl7Q.text: Been eating here, and all their sister properties for years. I'll write more when I'm feeling more verbose, but had to quibble. THIS IS NOT TEX-MEX!!!! Hello Yelp, are you asleep at the switch on this? It's New Mexican, get it right. Calling it Tex-Mex is totally insulting to people from New Mexico. It would be like saying that Japanese and Chinese food is the same because they both use a lot of rice.

D-aFoT7Bg6H1qKMzGnErFQ.text: One of my favorite places to eat. Great ambiance-cozy but friendly and laid back. Food is incredible! I've been coming here for over 6 yrs and never left dissatisfied. If you want quality New Mexican cuisine, or just looking for a small, cool place to eat, find Dick's. It's the brown door without a sign.

FsskvOjk9PrwqK2Qyy7D1A.text: Dick's gets plenty of praise, so I don't have much to add that hasn't already been said below. But I wanted to mention that their pizza is surprisingly good.  My last two visits I've had the #3 pizza (mexican sausage, onions, mozzarella) and it's been great.  My last time there, we actually tried to get a booth at Richardson's--it was full, but the hostess was nice enough to call over to Dick's and get us in at their last free table.

pI9iniCGd1dtX5L1IjD_uw.text: I loved Richardson's and this place is the "same" - same menu, etc...the ambiance is terrific here and the server was very prompt and attentive.  I had a lovely Perrier with lime and ice to start - and ordered the Red River Chile sopa.  Let me just say if you don't enjoy spicy, don't bother with this soup.  It contained, beef, red chile, cheese and beans (dollop of salsa fresca).  Very rich flavor from the red chile and a nice kick.  Next, I had the chicken quesadillas - cheesy, crispy and enjoyable.  It came along with a red salsa and a green tomatillo-based salsa.  Great flavors and very fresh food along with a warm, cozy atmosphere.  I will definitely be back!

UlGvDK9QcDUe67Pd7Q16BA.text: No sign on the door--little bitty tiny eating space--the bar takes up half the teensy space--food is to die for. Yep, we're at Dick's Hideaway!!! We've eaten here several times but have yet to have a bad meal.   Everything is fabulous, it's close to home and it's kind of like our little secret. In fact, I'm kind of scared to write this review because I'm afraid that everybody and his/her dog is gonna want to come here and then I'll NEVER get a table! [not that we've ever gotten one of the three tables, we've always settled for the eat-on bar.]  It's run by the same nice folks who own Richardson's around the corner, so you know you'll always get a great meal.   And if your party runs more than three, you can always reserve the party room next door--it's actually the wine room with a big copper-topped table and lots and lots of ambience.  Let's just put it this way--it's way different than anything else in town, and that's a good thing.

ZZwFYcUFSaiyE2Gbf_mX5w.text: Drove past it 3 times and walked past it twice as I forgot my phone in the hotel room so no GPS. Not sure it would have helped me. Finally a kind sole walked me to the door and said "right there".  Don't look for signage as it is a "Hideout" and there isn't one.   Ambience is quaint, dark, but really cool, was surprised it's a bar with excellent food. Carne Adovada was more than I could finish and fabulous.  Excellent wait staff and service too. Five stars !!

NgJxjkHoZGFneQBMd8C4cg.text: Really good food, great monster portions! Share and appetizer or make one an entree! Cool employees!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Adovado, I think! Lol Great food , great service, really laid back MONSTER portions!

swkpIG8WVrcRuxZmn4prDw.text: omfg!!!!  this place is seriously f****ng amazing!!!  it's hidden, yet... it's in plain sight it's dark it's old it's vintage-y it's cool it's unpretentious  i'm embarrassed to say i've lived here for awhile and just now made it to this place.  don't be me...  go. there. now.  you'll thank me :)

lEhtY7NcNtgLzRCKkgKYFg.text: Wow! The chili relleno plate was so awesome. I can't even begin to tell you how delicious! And the carne adovada (Dick's specialty!) was so tender and tasty! You must try this place. It's small and cozy but perfect. Loved it. Give it a try! You won't be disappointed.

toTSv56g8lghoz5HkQSdZw.text: I eat here all the time, always a great experience. The menu is full of dishes only served at Dick's or sister restaurant Richardson's. Dick's has the best brunch in Phoenix, well priced, large portions with all foods having tons fravor. This place is hidden with no sign but us locals no it's there. I recommend anything on the menu.

hxSnO_XlaZBUFcUMJkGRxQ.text: Sunday brunch was a nice pleasant surprisingly delicious meal. Bloody Marys, huevos rancheros, tenderloin Benedict and even the coffee was great. We will be back. Added to our list of go to places.

FnaT6Esm5nNbsH_eDFhvvg.text: The breakfast burrito is to die for! You could definitely share it or expect leftovers. The service was great. A really small place so not good for groups but they do have a big Community table so you can always sit there and enjoy the great food. Really a unique spot with a great menu

z2gZy57PlA0xhqgVOHbiLg.text: Another neighborhood gem in Phoenix.  This place has been here for years and will be here for many more.    A little warning the food is spicy so be careful how you order it.  Probably some of the best Mexican food I have had in Arizona.    It's always busy here so plan accordingly and expect to wait to be seated.

Ucj6QiC2gs9mrXdUaMOwtQ.text: Everything is awesome! Chipotle Ribs Green chile stew & eggs! Tortilla is amazing!  Awesome spice

q1wJ3ygUpR6rGR3T42kp6w.text: I know, even the name is awesome!   Known for some of the best New Mexican cuisine in the Valley, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The Roasted Garlic plate is the Best in AZ! This is a favorite spot for locals or guys like me looking for a fun and unique place to take friends and enjoy happy hour or for an evening out. Great food, great service and one of my all time fave's in AZ!  You need to try one of my favorite entrees, the Carne Adovada. Just try it and you will know exactly why I mentioned it. Here is what you get: smoked pork roast simmered in red chile, rice, beans, cheese & a flour tortilla. Okay, sounds like you have seen this before right? Not so fast- just look at this photo! Is your mouth watering yet?  Did I tell you Dick's Hideaway had me at GARLIC?! From the fresh ingredients, the smell of wood smoking, the meats, and the chefs putting all of the menu creations on piping hot plates, this is a hot spot for generous portions and inventive entrees.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best New Mexico menu in AZ!
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great Happy Hour
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best Roasted Garlic plate in AZ!

ix_3IpUiRITVmsaHybtoiw.text: Yeah gluten free options!  Excellent food!  Husband had Chimayo chicken that has a red spicier sauce and subbed out asparagus for the potatoes.  He said it's delicious.  Our waitress (Rachel?) was very kind and helpful making modifications to my meal around my food allergy restrictions.  I had 1 smoked turkey enchilada (my favorite) and 1 veggie (very tasty) and had my green sauce on the side as it's very zippy during the summer with New Mexico chilies (their heat varies by season, if I recall correctly hot dry summer makes the peppers hotter).  I also substituted egg whites.  We were checked on no less than 6x which was refreshing and everyone was so nice!  Excellent New Mexico sauces, comparable to what I had in Santa Fe (now I don't have to travel so far lol).  I like sauces!  Christmas sauce is half red and half green but thought it'd be too much for me.  Still we both had that runny nose after eating, my understanding is they can make it as hot as you'd like.  I thought I was looking for a blue door from a photo posted somewhere online. It's not blue but brown wooden slats.  They don't have a big sign, definitely a hidden gem.  Located in same plaza as Luci's Healthy Food (I think South facing) but I think it's East facing.  Easier to park in the back as people park part on the pavement and park on sidewalk not in parking spaces potentially blocking you in.    Fun ambiance southwestern style, copper booth tables, pub style, and cool/dark for those hot days.  The copper table room is pub style sharing tables which was fun because the Soccer Tournament was on, so a lot of chatting amongst the area.  It looked to met like larger dining area to the side for events and dinner.  The bar tables were full when we arrived at 11, so that says something about the delicious food!  I imagine they get really full in the evenings but well worth the effort.

pdeDAbSM1oXF1igx3UKEGg.text: Hard to find, but once you find it. Man is the food good. Well worth the extra effort to find it. A must

iZbsxkk2YgKbMAg1-Kabvg.text: Either this place doesn't exist or it's name is True and well hidden. Google maps had a different address than yelp, but no luck.   The phone number doesn't answer.    Give it up

wZaV77E-1diD3V1goznxnA.text: Hideaway for sure. Don't look for a sign just the number over the door. It was a little dark but the food was hot (temperature) and tasty.

EghmLExIu47dG1MBJV5ggg.text: Great little place,  unmarked but worth the challenge of finding it. We had chipotle ribs that fell off the bone and carne adovado that was a bit salty but delicious none the less... staff was fast and friendly and the food is hot and fresh.

NW7LlzqrrQwi_ZtgWkHOYg.text: Great place.  We have been here many times.  The bar area is always packed with happy goers but we always sit in the quiet room next to it with wonderful ambience dim lighting and wine racks on the wall.  Happy hour selections are plentiful and prices are great.   Try the ribs delicious meat falling off the bones nicely spiced.  Calamari was an excellent choice.  Beer and wine selection very good.  Regular menu is also very good so much to choose from! And the bathroom is not to be missed.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

x7gEKnJ2JC-l1NsUcLwLzw.text: I love Dick's hideaway. Came here today for brunch, ordered enchiladas (chicken and beef) --delicious! The serving was perfect for two people. My sister ordered lamb with dirty rice. Lamb was over cooked, she didn't let the server know--server was too good looking to complain to. Haha! Anyway back to the lamb, lamb didn't have any taste. Overall I loved the vibe, perfect for brunch when you have a hangover because of the dark interior.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast ---5000 stars

6G39XLxtT1pmnIcmpl7XuQ.text: Service was 7/10 hence the 4 of 5 stars. We walked in for dinner and no one greeted us or to seat us and there was only two other small groups in the main bar area.   Besides that, food was great. I got the fish trio and it was perfectly cooked.. All 3 fish.  It was a special and not in the main menu.  this place had great reviews so that's why I wanted to try it but there weren't many pescatarian or veg options.  So the fish trio was a nice surprise!    Will come back for the food eventually!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish trio

HmZs2WDNv0bKGzzrsQ9qQQ.text: Delish!!! We got lucky and waited 20 minutes! When we left there was a big wait list! Definitely recommend this establishment for breakfast!!. Noise level is high but I'm certain a yummy Bloody Mary  would  have resolved the acoustic issue!  We were not drinking but the drinks looked great!!!! Portions are large and flavorful. A funny Sunday morning experience!

HfiMTOBYSkq7BULx1RsWWg.text: I had brunch here maybe back in 2015 and I regret not going back. Their food is unforgettably delicious the enchiladas were phenomenal! Its kind of easy to pass by but if your ever curious enough it will be worth it. At the time the food bar and kitchen was open at the bar where we were seated. No tables from what I remember. If the door didn't stay open the place would be totally dark and their is no sign out front so its easy to miss, but it is a nice little hidden gem. I will definitely be going back soon!

AJW4sKbpL8GebPzZeIGYjA.text: If you can find a place it's well worth the stop. We've been going to Richardson's for years never made the effort to really find this but it's so worth it. Friendly staff always busy always cleaning. Well worth it!

Oh8BFi0mQ3Zi7qFRjN5_8g.text: I have no idea how we've not tried this place before. Maybe because it really is hidden away. After driving past the restaurant 3X we finally found it. We split the skewer plate as an appetizer which was delicious. I had the carne adovada with eggs and my husband had the duck rellanos. Both dishes didn't disappoint and came with plenty of heat.  Dicks will be our new go to brunch spot.

wbpJFY5VeXhRE4MlUOdW_w.text: Like the name suggests this place is a bit hidden. In fact there is no sign other than the 2 bushes I front of the door.  It is next to a natural food store named luci's and well worth hunting for.   Inside the restaurant is a hybrid bar/romantic get a way with a dark atmosphere filled with the smoke from the stove and hardwood tables. Yes it is a place for a date but also it's a place to go get a few drinks (8 am this morning and no less than 4 people were drinking wine at the bar)  As for the food, it's delicious. Heavily spiced though it might be, the food has a Mexican/New Mexican taste to it and the portions are huge. Of special note is the heavenly fresh squeezed OJ (like eating a super sweet orange without the chewing)  If you are looking for a great meal this is your spot, breakfast lunch or dinner.

p6pvwOkYeuZHvWCzIimqzw.text: This is a must visit place. Good food.  Healthy sized servings. The atmosphere is old school and very solid feeling. You'll take home leftovers and enjoy them for lunch the next day.  Always a fun place to go. Recommend.

K9XzqkUbzHrfI6sevft4-w.text: Who doesn't love Dick's hideaway. If you can find this bar, it's a great spot! Breakfast is delicious and the staff is always friendly. Cheers!

YVPDHL4Q-cSbvTsxJfQvvQ.text: Tis place is so great I don't know where to start.  We loved everything we tried.  Staff was great, super friendly and attentive.  Defiantly a secret spot.  Plug into google or apple maps and you will find it no problem.  Margaritas are very tasty!  Prices great too!  This is by no means low fat food. Great salads and great entrees - stay away if you are counting calories. Pasta Heidi is ridiculous!!  Garlic shrimp excellent!  We will be back very soon.  Good decor - Love that Kardashian sign!!

dAhu-8r6mbhwKuY8izIzHg.text: Great staff and service! They always recognize us every time we come in and know us by name, so it's like having a meal at a good friends house! :) Been going here for years and years!! Keeps getting better every year! We especially love the french toast in the morning and the green chile enchiladas in the evening! xoxo

Muh1sRqjszr3FXfavuSp2w.text: Seriously, what a gem! My friend and I had little trouble finding the place but it's called a hideaway for a reason. We came for breakfast and the portions are HUGE. I'd suggest sharing, it was so tasty and yummy. Once you walk in you feel like you've just walked into a vampire dungeon haha I love the darkness so it was a cool experience. If you're in the area, definitely give it a try. I don't even remember what I ordered but my friend got the burrito and it was on point.

Fa_mn2QTuDJUYMGoEiSk4Q.text: Holy shit... Thank you fellow yelpers for turning my head towards this place because honestly if I didn't find this place and tried out their food I would have been very disappointed. Reading other reviews, I found that this place was indeed a hideaway. This place has literally no sign and you basically have to walk by the door to know that it was there. Luckily, I found it with little to no problem. When walking in we just sat at the table that was closest to the door and got our happy hour drink as well as got our orders in.   Almost immediately I was eyeing the Pork Chop Chorizo. Pork Chops stuffed with chorizo?! Come on, this was one of the easiest ones to pick out. My friend was jealous that I was having tamales so for sure I picked an order of their special tamales to go along with my meal as an appetizer. Honestly, I was still sort of full from lunch, but I wasn't going to say no to dinner.   So for appetizers, I ordered the pork tamale, that was really tasty mixed with the green and red chile it just brings it over the top. For the entree, as said before I picked what I was eyeing. The Pork Chop Chorizo. Oh yeah, I thought it was stuffed pork chop with the chorizo inside and what came out was a complete surprise to me. They gave me two pork chops stacked and then the chorizo was sandwiched in between. The pork chop was flavored well too! It had a simple sweet glaze on top and then it was served on top of a green and red chile which then gave the overall dish a slow heat.   Overall, this place is a definite place to visit just for the ambiance, the decor, and the pork chops that I had. The tamale was simple, but the chile and how they prepared it gave that flavor and gave me an idea of how green chile should be prepared. Definitely recommend to check this place out and give a try if you're in looking for neat spots.
