VIeOgtMYVKPkQv68_doxLg.text: My meal was good but the other people I was with did not like theirs. The place is super dark and loud and we were sat at a table that was set up "bar style" facing other people which wasn't very comfortable having to turn sideways to talk. I would go back to the Rokerij but not here.

S6BTMg1O8B6YhI__f87Fvw.text: Always excellent!!! Love sitting at the bar but there is a back room for larger parties or some peace and quiet.

g1UBVPQd4IJSFkQ7xwnMzA.text: This Hideaway was a fantastic hideaway; hidden so well we couldn't find it at first.  Loved that feature and the ambiance and food was amazing. The carnitas and a bloody Maria went down swell after hiking Piestewa Peak. Great start to a day or evening.

yh_XVeJJR6LzmQDyxQ_j7Q.text: It was so dark when we entered before noon on a Saturday...we couldn't see anything but heard a lot of people & barely see the bar!  We were greeted right away and asked to follow server toward the back.  Cute community sitting area with pounded copper table!  The brunch menu was delightful ..we ordered to share (big) the steak rellenos  & eggs.yummm!!  I ordered crispy hash browns...it was perfectly crunchy on top! The mimosa was generous $6.  We will return!

P3ph05DmzTQfp2VO1-8qDg.text: LOVE this place. Would recommend to ask for your food cooked extra crispy or even just extra at all. It can be a little crowded at times but the staff is super helpful and knows just how to make you feel at home.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

k7rJLc_bvR9t0HLcqYy29A.text: I don't often write a review for a restaurant, because I'm generally not impressed or I have nothing to add to a previous Yelp review.. .however, I was in town for a convention and found his hidden gem.  First, there is no sign.  When you arrive, call so they can tell you which door is Dick's.  Be prepared when you enter, because it's pretty dark and takes a minute to adjust to the dark.  Next pay attention to the server's recommendations, because they know their food.  I had the Richardsons Combo, which was my best restaurant meal of the year.  I love to cook and eat out when I'm on the road (I travel a fair amount) so I have an appreciation of good food.  The jalapeno hollandaise benedict was flavorful with a thick "smoked" canadian bacon.  It was so thick, I could hardly bite it with my teeth (what a treat!).  The asparagus was perfectly steamed and provided a perfect compliment to the benedict.  As good as the benedict and asparagus, I was amazed that the enchiladas with a mix of red and green sauce were even better.  It was so good I ate ever bite.  I tried to go back for another meal, but my schedule didn't permit.  Don't skip this place for a great meal.

dMTzrEcOojMu0oXvlpfUEA.text: Only stopped in for a couple of drinks and got the happy hour quesadilla du jour and was genuinely impressed. The menu is amazing and I'm so excited to come back and try more of it! I had a bloody and a mimosa and they were some of the best I've ever had. Highly recommend - must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5fUvYIaSUFqrU6fM6qVfhA.text: 1st time at Dicks hideaway. Loved it had the chorizo stuffed porkchop WOW. Definitely a must go to spot (dont take kids) great for a date night.

URl0tlscznKdX6Rdrc9OAw.text: Dick's is a must when I visit Phoenix. It should be for you, too. From the extremely friendly staff, the bevy of welcoming regulars, to the OUTSTANDING food, you cannot go wrong.  Personally, I have never eaten at a restaurant that I have told others about more than Dick's. If I lived in Phoenix, however, I would tell no one because I wouldn't want the competition for a seat! So, whether you prefer red or green chili, slow roasted chicken, or carnitas adovada (this is killer); I promise you that you'll crow about the experience.  Just in case you'd like something else, try Richardson's.  It is close by, larger, and owned by the same family. ENJOY!!  (Green chili eggs Benedict pictured)

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

X0lPFozlbuM7N5wlOx-Egg.text: Been here twice with my wife - both times for a weekend brunch.  Finding the entrance takes a second - it's like they're going for a speakeasy vibe and making it less well labeled. Didn't take long to get seated. They have a number of larger tables that you'll be seated next to other diners, but not a big deal for us and we sat at those both times.  Your placemats act as your menu with a few specials on blackboards spaced in different parts of the restaurant. First thing I'll mention is it is pricier than I typically spend on brunch, but the portions are generous and the food is well done. I've gotten both the carne adovada + eggs as well as a tamale breakfast special, both of which they managed to get some great flavor out of the adovada preparation and came with some great sides. Nothing particularly special about the cocktails one way or the other.  Haven't been for dinner but it seems even more overpriced.   Service was so-so. First visit was standard, but second visit they never checked in with us even when our drinks were empty (loss for them - we'd have ordered a second set) and my wife actually got the wrong benedict. She didn't initially notice/comment until I asked where her sauce was (she had ordered the carne adovada one, got some kind of ham benedict), and didn't get an opportunity to mention it until after she'd already eaten half the plate (again - the server never checked in). The server did give us a half plate of the correct one to take home, but did give us a bit of an accusatory attitude when we mentioned it.  Regardless, it's certainly worth a try.

ym-HBg77eA1cwOl14IwdBg.text: Wellll let's start out by saying that if you are a first timer to Dick's Hideaway, prepared to be taken to the wrong location by GPS lol If it wasn't for my fellow yelp reviewers and the picture of the front door I don't know if I would of found it.... hints *hideway*   After finding this hidden gem, it was like stepping into a dark, sultry lounge. I ordered the waffle with scrambled eggs and man it was HUGE!!!! Although I was convinced I wasn't going to finish it, it was SO good I finished it all! The service was standard and chill, nothing over the top to rave about but the food was top notch!  Thank you Dick's Hideaway staff!  xx Paola R.

Dc7WYHvtZKe0bPHpBHwHNA.text: It's simple people....  If you're in Phoenix, this is the place you must visit.  You won't regret it. Fantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Correction, this is the Carne Adovada e Eggs.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tenderloin Benediction.....
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Adovada e Eggs....

Qbd1Q1EKLZIO7b8MpneIqw.text: Had seared scallops and the short ribs as appetizers!  great stuff!

dru2qgP2G6Def66IQR2Glw.text: Excellent brunch and excellent service! This is going to be short and sweet, if you can make it out for brunch, get the carne adovada benedict and enjoy!

5qJ-fiJdrDD87COXyJQD6Q.text: I want this review to reflect heavily on the food at Dick's Hideaway! The atmosphere was fantastic, and exactly what I like...but oh my did Richardson's do one hell of a job in the kitchen. I really didn't even know just how much I adored New Mexican style food until I ate here.   I went here for breakfast and got the carne adovada and my girlfriend went with the chile rellenos. The adovada was through the roof delicious! Smokey, spicy, salty and prefectly tender! It was some of the best adovada that I've experienced, period. Fast forward to me getting around to trying the rellenos and you would have seen me with my lower jaw hitting the table (after chewing and swallowing of course). They were incredible; like, seriously incredible! My girlfriend won the battle of, "Whose cuisine will reign supreme?" hands down! I must eat those again! The last part of the meal that I feel needs recognition is the grapefruit juice. Sounds silly, but it was also amazing. It was so fresh that I'm surprised I didn't find some of the peel in it!  Dick's Hideaway is a must try! Richardson'st impressed the hell out of me, and I can't wait to go and eat more of their delicious food!

z65355qIEE-j2vTcfbe9mw.text: Delicious. Walked in and it's a small tavern style place with about 20 seats. Fantastic food!!

eHxSLYMT2K2nM9Xdb4O4FA.text: I absolutely love this place. Even more, I love bringing people here for the first time. The experience of eating here begins before you even step foot in the restaurant. You have to know where to go since there is no outside sign. Once you are in, it is probably unlike any restaurant you've been to - feels much more like a dive bar (in a good way!). I always choose to sit along the bar so I can watch the food being prepared. The dishes are huge and packed with flavor. If you haven't been before, definitely make sure to try it. And if you have an out of town guest, this is the perfect place to bring them.

Ax7RHZwMscUo8A2UseIY0w.text: In all the years i have been eating here i have never once experienced a bad meal or service.  I absolutely love the vibe of this place and it really is the only place in town that i would stand outside for more than an hour to get into.  Sure, if it's packed you can just get in your car and drive a couple miles north to Rokery J or Richardsons and i highly suggest you do so i can get a seat faster.  I really love the food and the people that work here top off the experience.  Sitting there today and watching the chef prepare meals was like watching a great musician play his or her instrument.  It was so fun to watch in fact that i was moved to write this long overdue review.  Thank you Dick's hideaway.  If you weren't here i don't know what i would do.

wdVx4FD-RrH36bFANxdcmA.text: Hoo-boy, did I feel like an idiot.  I've been wanting to try Dick's Hideaway for some time now, being a lover of New Mexican cuisine.  My main stumbling block was not knowing where the hell it is.  After circling the intersection several times and cursing my GPS I finally decided to park and wander around.  It's a good thing I did!  After walking past the unassuming doors a few times (hence the idiot feelings) I finally saw the tiny menu stuck next to the storefront.  I cautiously went in.  The interior is small to the extreme, but very cozy and well appointed.  The bar area was completely full so I stood by the door in the hopes of finding a hostess or server.  Ten minutes passed and again I felt like an idiot.  Finally a kind server took pity on me and seated me at the public table.  From here on out everything went smooth as butter.  The menu was full of enticing food.  I ordered the Huevos Rancheros Christmas style (red and green sauce).  The food was delivered quickly, and it was amazing.  The eggs were cooked to perfection and the beans were well flavored.  I didn't intend on eating the seasoned red potatoes, really I didn't.  They were so perfectly cooked that I couldn't resist.  The red and green sauces were exactly what I was craving, perfectly spiced.  Maybe there's a trick to Dick's Hideaway, a perfect time to come or a way to sneak a seat at the bar.  If I can solve the riddle you can bet I'll be back again and again.

ZLXNWFnSB2Xf0X0y9BNV1Q.text: We almost gave up looking for this place after driving up and down the street!! I am SO glad we kept looking! We probably drove past this restaurant 5 times before finding it. This place is in a plaza--same plaza as Lucy's healthy marketplace (right next door). It is a small restaurant so it gets pretty cozy in there. For dinner, I ordered Pasta Heidi and it was delicious!! It is a must try if you are in the mood for pasta!

EJdOxO7deewr1A0OkClkfA.text: I finally went to this place after hearing so much about it.  Thanks to all the Yelp reviewers on how to find this place, because it is definitely a "hideaway".  It's very easy to pass up if you don't know it's there (which is right next to Luci's Market).    The food at Dick's is so deliciously good!  But if definitely has kick, so if you don't like spicy foods, you might want to mention it to them.  The rice and beans alone, which are just sides to the main dish, are incredibly good.  And the enchiladas were perfectly cooked (other than maybe a little heavy handed on the cheese).  I definitely want to go back and try different items on the menu.  The staff is also very welcoming and warm, which is always appreciated.

oVIIeiOBFV9K6rbnmSOkkA.text: Best breakfast and Bloody Mary I have ever had. Bar none! Service was superior and although the ambiance is subjective, it's right up my alley. If I could give more stars I would. Try the eggs and enchiladas!

WF0D0nroqPNeAXARdapdKw.text: We were searching for a spot for lunch during a training. We chose Dick's On fellow yelpers suggestions. The atmosphere was funny and cozy. The menu is full of delicious southwestern fare. I ordered a specially created (by me) hamburger and fries. It was fresh and delicious. My friends also enjoyed their food. The enchiladas were particularly tasty. This is definitely a great place to try. They have some great daily specials.

AW91mqESTsLHFpmF7aTf_A.text: I was tipped off about this place by a co-worker.  We made a last minute decision to eat dinner here, instead of the Vig on Easter Sunday night.  So glad we did!  The food was awesome.  The Skewers were great and the BBQ flatbread pizza was huge.    We drove around a bit for fear of parking in a spot that wasn't the Hideaway's...but when we got inside there is a sign that says you can park ANYWHERE in the lot and not get towed.  Just an FYI.  I thought the two guys that were tag-team bartending/serving were very attentive.  And I'm a server so my standards are kind high.

m1AcX6Qeu8haMIoUno8evQ.text: This is a gem!  A bit difficult to find, but if you locate the address, your in.  Great breakfast drinks and amazing food!  Cocktail prices are very reasonable; $5 for a Bloody Mary and a beer chaser.

GobVTJlDiBDGIzXrrzHIGA.text: Let me start off by saying my husband and I absolutely love this place. In fact it is one of our most favorite spots in phoenix. The happy hour here is phenomenal. Love the cheese dip, shrimp scampi and the chile rellenos. Definitely authentic mouth watering New Mexican cuisine. So why am I giving this four stars? Only because it is such a small restaurant and most of the time the back room is being rented out by private parties. Also definitely not a kid friendly place which is a total bummer for us because we have a newborn and no babysitter to leave our little one behind with which means no more dicks hideaway :(...however this will be our first stop when we get a night out.

iq1eBUKJuxL_gAUP3_mkyg.text: Everything was fantastic. Bacon wrapped shrimp were huge. Try happy hour dining: reasonable prices for apps and delicious drinks

rty7-DumKXM1IzMRur0aPA.text: My first bite of carne adovada literally made me interrupt the woman sitting next to me at the bar with an "Oh my GOD" it was so delicious.  I came in for lunch so I didn't have to suffer the long waits this place seems to always have, clearly because their food is so excellent.  Every bite was just wonderful.  A bit pricey and the bar stools were pretty uncomfortable.  I guess they do that so they can turn the table more quickly?

nWCHnaYfyXSJnRzaBb1uvw.text: Went to Dick's on the recommendation of the New Times Best of Phoenix issue. It's a little hard to find, but I guess it lives up to its name. It's cozy; it's little more than a long bar, a kitchen and a few tables. However, this small restaurant delivered some big flavors. I had a burrito dish that the bartender said was the place's signature dish. The pulled pork inside the burrito was delicious, and it was topped with cheese and a bold, spicy red pepper sauce.  There are no frills here. The sole TV was small and playing a Spanish soccer match when I went. With a lack of distraction and close quarters, you'd better have a good conversationalist when you go.

MIYK9lAtG-JGBpQtDWNKAw.text: Make whatever jokes you want about the name as if you're a homophobic 7th grade boy, but Dick's Hideaway has really got a great menu of American food.   Might not be a burger, fry, and shake diner, but New Mexican cuisine is American all the way, and as a matter of fact, among their many southwestern tinged dishes, they've got a superb thick, juicy burger, grilled up on an open flame right in front of you as you sit at the bar, with some great fries AND a nice full plate of dark green salad for somewhere around 11 bucks-ish (last I was aware).

lW2c0tg69vCK5OuJZXWDZg.text: You need to try the pork. Adovada style.

rdSBBG7UHKvodTr19RCeww.text: Great little place that is VERY hard to find. Look for the sign on the door and you may have a fighting chance.  We had a large party and got a table easy but that was probably just luck. The food was excellent. One person got the roasted garlic app- it was huge. The Quesidilla was great. The beans were not the best but everything was good.

lmVjBvKn7AXPt8HqZ9YoHw.text: Came for lunch with some coworkers. First of all, there's no sign outside so had I been the one driving or looking for the place I never would have found it! Go inside and right off the bat it looks like you just walked into a dark dive bar. As you turn to the right you realize there is a dining room with a few tables, with a big community table in the middle. That's where we sat. The menus are the placemats which is convenient. I got the New Mexico Enchiladas. 3 of your choice so I did cheese, pork and shrimp. You also get a choice of green or red sauce.  The food comes pretty quickly and its piping hot.  All 3 enchiladas were very good. Gooey and cheesey and spicy, and I got the green sauce.  There's a warning on their menu, basically you order it you own it so be careful of the sauce you choose. The rice was plump and delicious and the tortilla was fresh. The portion was good sized and I could only eat half.  The place has personality. Almost looks like it used to be a residence of some sort but I'm not sure how that could be in a strip mall. Has a fireplace and a bathroom with a shower!  I'd definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New Mexico Enchiladas

P8kEwUazwxbjss0LcHt5ZQ.text: What a quaint hidden gem. Just the place and decor is worth the visit.  The food was just ok though. I had the side salad and the chipotle ribs and it was uneventful.  I'll have to go back to try other dishes.  Fun fact. There's a shower in the bathroom (puzzle face)

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yVZMk8FRsCjU-2vmEvyKTQ.text: For my wife and I, this was a two-star experience at best, but you may enjoy it more, IF (capital letters):  1.  You don't mind sitting in a small crowded area on torn stools and quite possibly waiting in line for it (it's open seating and pretty much no reservations).  To be fair, you might find a place in the dining area up the steps, but it only has one very large table and two or three small ones.  The bar area also seats about 20 to 25.  At Sunday brunch it was very crowded. 2.  You aren't really concerned about erratic service so long as it is polite. 3.  You like very spicy food.  I personally like some spice in my food (I order medium heat when given a choice) but this goes way beyond that.  I also like spicy-flavorful, but this was spicy-overwhelm the flavor. 4.  You are not value concious, because prices are a bit steep here.  Obviously I will not be back so why do I think you might enjoy it?  Well, it's different -   A.  The food gets high marks for creativity and you might enjoy it if you can take the heat. B.  It's clean -- a hole-in-the-wall but a clean one.  You might enjoy the "quirky" ambiance.

LBMJ5aOU6Bwn4dLlg0BK2g.text: I swear, I hear about this place all the time and I'm not sure why.   The ambiance is that of an old dive bar, which I don't mind, but nothing special. I felt the service was pretty good, although people were slightly confused by who had what bar tab. The drinks were good, but the selection of draft beers was small.  Oh my, now the food.... It was not impressive. My chicken tasted like it was cooked while still frozen, The chicken had no flavor and an undesirable texture of a rubber tire. We tried the scallops as well, and they were yummy, but nothing special. The enchiladas were decent, but again, not anything special. Overall not an experience I would want to have again. And let me just add that walking through the kitchen to use the bathroom is just not appetizing to me...

bIMsK2tEsnbC1Wz0b5Z_QQ.text: This is THE breakfast place in town. Hands down the best. Everything I've gotten has been excellent! My favorite are the beef tenderloin rellenos. This is the place you tal out of towners. Highly recommended!!!

vy6qSPoHNo12gofaDWn7ww.text: Absolutely incredible!!! To die for. My mouth waters just thinking about the food. Don't let the outside scare you away.  Probably the best food I've had my entire life.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prime Rib and Halibut

XEqdKv5R4jlEBtCzLLLgjw.text: On vacation with my husband, it was a recommendation from his friends. Great place. You will have to wait but the food is worth it. Mimosas are delicious and. Eat here 2x's during our stay and did not regret it once.

Ko7sJCVW92tdaX50m12ZdQ.text: Not as good as the high reviews. Pleasant enough service, great hours, pretty nice inside. No complaints at all just thought the food was average.  Carne adovada - most popular dish here. Well smoked with good sauce. Sauce however doesn't put the whole dish together. Rice, beans and tortilla come with it, just really heavy and you really just get one flavor with this meal. Not overly impressed.  Pretty pricy for the area as well.

WIfkM_urxHCfwXkgUP3u8g.text: Some of the best food in AZ..hands down..closest thing to traditional home cooked food..

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XP76_c6ts7vovM7JTuZpjA.text: As if the name didn't say it all. This tiny hidden spot instantly pulls you in, with their amazing aromas flowing out the front door. Simply charming, and felt so intimate I could of relaxed here all night. With that being said, Dick's Hideaway is a very small establishment, seating is limited, but so worth the tight squeeze and wait. The "GCP" is to die for. I could of just ordered a dozen of them and sat on my couch all night. Their dinner salad is shockingly good. The dressing was pure heaven. I look forward to trying their other restaurants in the neighborhood and have high hopes they will be as equally amazing.

UX54ToFf2IYoE05xDYjRww.text: I definitely had a hard time finding this place, hence the name. I actually drove around twice thinking I missed it since I didnt see a sign.  We sat at the bar since all tables taken. I had the garlic plate, which is always my favorite at richardsons. We also tried the scallops which we'd recommend. Friendly staff and overall inviting atmosphere. Try out the bathrooms- located thru the kitchen... kind of interesting and unique. Will come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Christmas is coming early this year.

aKfK6STQxLeeME1ln34ldg.text: Went yesterday and had the enchiladas for brunch and I'm never disappointed. The right mix of tenderness and spice. My husband had the pork advodavo and it was smoky, flavorful, and tender. Kudos.

PDCrJrUd9RtUZgQua2ctpQ.text: Heck of a time finding this place but worth the confusion. I got two small plates and a house margarita during happy hour. The blue crab empanadas and the queso dip + chips were truly filling and delicious. I will be back during my next visit in Phoenix.  The lighting is dim, so if you struggle to see in dimmed lighting, use your phone to help read the menu. I saw another couple do that but I felt the lighting was just enough. Also don't expect overly friendly staff; not a knock or suggesting anyone was rude. My fiance and I both felt our server was just about doing the job sans any effort on rapport or charisma. Better than lousy service or slow service granted, but it'd be nice to feel like he was into having us as guests.

z8kmh-jaapyzQZmTR-MCVw.text: Omg I love this place!   I got a Bloody Mary that comes with a beer chaser. Such a good combo. For lunch I got the spiced burger and fries. Their portions are huge, served on huge plates. Definitely could share if needed. The burger was super tasty. My friend ordered the enchiladas and those were incredible.   I'm convinced anything on the menu is a hit.   New favorite place.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spiced burger. So yummy!
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thank you.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody Marys with a beer chaser.

ADp7PDcb_t0o5Wlh0v9WUA.text: Delicious food if you can find it.  Dick's Hideaway is located in a small shopping center behind an unadvertised door.  There isn't any main signage to look for, so just follow the addresses.  We came in for brunch and everything was great.  I had the Carne Adovada & eggs.  The plate included large portions of food.  Seriously, I could have made this two meals, but I didn't.  I was so stuffed.  The service was also good.  Our waiter was able to help us make good choices since it was our first visit.    Dick's Hideaway is definitely worth a return visit the next time I am in the Phoenix area.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Adovada &amp; Eggs

mKHdJKne86HYLY6vxsm32Q.text: Love this place! The food is simply amazing and it is a True hidden gem...a little hard to find. The breakfast was fantastic and we went there for dinner too. The meal portions are large too.

NQGMTAKrNHJjqqMWLAqfCw.text: Great location, very eclectic. Don't look for a sign to find it - they don't have one.  The food was good and the service was friendly. Worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

V7_19hCVUrCtqrGiwUmwlQ.text: Awsome! !!!!!!!!!  Everything about this place is great  My new favorite  Had bloody Mary's, frinch tost and  chorizo omelette the plates are huge servings I love this place

YKjLQHIK5ybe_khAplGbOg.text: Unfortunately the review I am writing is a little late and i can't remember the name of the chicken dish I had when I went in with my friend for lunch, we went to the basement level and it was fantastic. The restraunt was beautiful and the food was amazing I would make it a point to check out this unique and delicious gem in Phoenix.

5-cDlF22bgoE6LyEyvUmuQ.text: It took us a while to find this place. We circled around three times before deciding to park and walk around to find it, but man am I glad we found it! My wife and I ordered the tenderloin benedict with hash browns and the carne adovada benedict with hash browns. Both plates were great, but the carne adovada takes the trophy for the best meal during our four-day getaway. I had no idea what adovada was until I ate it here. It's definitely spicy, but coming from someone who orders everything mild, I'd still order this plate and not request it mild (not sure if that's an option) in fear that the flavors may change. Not sure when we'll make it back to Phoenix, but whenever that is, I know I'll be eating adovada from here again.

3cCdGkpSwReCZq_Q7Se2nA.text: Best place ever. I have not had anything here that I wouldn't recommend to someone. Honestly, the worst part about come ng here is having to decide what to have. The rellenos are out of this world. The enchiladas are fantastic. Carne adovada is to die for. You can't go wrong here.

MtavCQwCurAevg12VEb4TA.text: We were very pleased & surprised by this place.  A little hard to find at first lol, but that's part of the charm.  We went for brunch & the servings were piled in huge quantity on unique plates.  My bloody Mary was quite tasty.  Staff was cheerful & helpful.

W8oJxcG0rvq3G4vAN1wbZw.text: Great food in a local "dive bar" atmosphere. Super small, very friendly great place!

x5t6ictF098q-Fu0vIVCtg.text: If I didnt have google maps, I would have missed this place. It truly is "hidden away", even though it faces out towards the street. Its clearly a local watering hole and it was a bit smaller than I thought it would be. The atmosphere is intimate, warm, with a south western flare. Half the kitchen is exposed to whoever sits at the bar, so its coll watching them make meals. They have an OK selection of beers on draft, but they certainly lean more towards the wine department.   For their happy hour menu, they shorten some entrees to a more tapas style plate. I really enjoyed this option, since I could taste a little of everything.   Duck Rellenos were quite interesting. Piping hot, just the right amount of spice, the gaminess and smoke of the duck gives it a robust feel, and the cheese blends everything together.   Carne Adovada Sliders were delicious. Good size, good bread, and tasty meat. The southwest flavors in the meat really bloom here.   Grilled Shrimp were actually worth getting here. Its pricey, but if that doesnt bother you, then go for it. The sauces surrounding the shrimp almost didnt seem like the designated dipping sauces. The cheesy sauce was my favorite. The rice and beans were ok, but nothing to pig out on.

695TeN4gnbf3JTqj-97omA.text: This is oldschool Arizona.  Nice and dark inside, great atmosphere, great food.  How do you beat it?  You can't.  The hideaway is next to luci's.  You have look for it because it really is hidden without signs.  Similar menu to the Richardsons roquieri (sp) up the street.  Small tight quarters great for breakfast before work or a relaxing drink with friends after.  This is tied to Richardsons that name stands on its own. Stop by get some and enjoy!  It's awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Adobada benedict
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast menu
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pour over cemex coffee

-7tqdvIZMXJSsYj6TMsneQ.text: Stopped for breakfast. Not too hard to find - the vines growing around the door make it stand out in the strip mall. It is a darkish three room place with great music from the bar area and muted TVs showing sports throughout. Seating is community table style. It had a great vibe and menu.   The dishes featuring chilis are truthfully advertised as "smothered" in chili sauce. I dug out my huevos rancheros, but when I return, will ask for the chili sauce on the side so I can control the volume.   Coffee from ROC2 was out of this world. While the restaurant has their own blend, I recommend going out to Cave Creek to tour the roastery and pick up coffee. Unfortunately it is not open on Sundays and the Whole Foods we visited was sold out so I will have to order from the website.

MSlYGgOgLsk_bJpIxpAj4g.text: I'm giving them a one star for IGNORANCE. I didn't even get to eat here because the young hostess was ignorant. I came in there On a Sunday morning with my son and bf to eat. The young man hosting sees me and my bf standing there with my 1yr old and tells us 20-15min wait. We say okay and stand by the door. After standing there for 15mins he tells us our table is ready. A bar table by the door with two seats. I say we need a high chair. He proceeds to tell me they do not have any or booster seats. Why would you not make that clear to us when you saw us walk in with an infant? Then he shrugs it off like it's no big deal. Ridiculously rude. Won't even be bothering to try this place out when I officially move here. Distasteful.

56OACEWkq8fBXpZbSf77AQ.text: Stopped in for brunch .. gotta say worth a trip just for the experience.  Pretty unmarked walk in and think you are in someplace you might should not be.. long bar and mostly communal tables but it is very busy on a weekday at 11am. Look behind the bar and see a guy loading wood into a wood fired grill and plates going everywhere. Numerous items and they all look good. Friendly young waitress ask if I  wanted to do a communal table or the bar so I decided to get a bar seat so I could watch what I later learned was the whole kitchen .  Watching these guys work and put out the dishes and amount of food was impressive , the service was friendly and great .: I settled on the carne adovada with eggs and hash browns which comes with beans and tortillas .. numerous pictures on yelp. It was very good not the best I have had but solid and a large portion ..  a funky experience , good food , great service , and large portions price a little high ($21) but portion enough for two. Worth a stop to try.

02IsLZfQ29kcoG0TkB5oOQ.text: Dropped off the wife's lease at BMW today and asked the lady there where a good restaurant was at, she directed us to this place.  DAMN IT WAS GOOD! The menu had such unique choices with a New Mexico flare. The staff were very friendly and inviting. Our waitress was Lauren and she was so cool and very informative about what we ordered. Had a great conversation with her. We will definitely be putting this place on our list for return.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New York strip with a chipotle dipping sauce.

qMbdfXNfSB4W5gcf21W93g.text: This place was amazing. Perfect place for chasing away a bad hangover. It's dark, has a huge drink selection, and the large breakfasts are sure to drive away any sins from the night before. My visit was nothing short of great. 10/10

037Gmb1igauJPe3dbfYoGQ.text: Second time here, and just as good as I remembered it. I got three enchiladas (pork, beef, and shrimp), a chile relleno a la carte, chipotle ribs, queso+chorizo dip, and green chile burger. All were exceptional, and different from one another. Would re-do the exact same thing again (and may very well do that next time I'm in town).

vMTVWJR_-QG0RmnszH4Lrg.text: The wife has been trying to get me here for the past two years! Finally went for my birthday dinner last night. This place is super cool.  It's def a hideout place. Very low key, chill, quiet, and overall very nice. I heard they have great bunch specials too.  The food was tasty and decent selection.  Service was on par. Seating was comfortable and presentation was on point.  Overall pretty neat place that I would recommend. I want to go another couple times so I can see if I would go 1  up or down.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackened salmon w/ tequila sauce. Really really good!

rwQSEmjUq7jX9yTBs3ZmRQ.text: Had brunch here Sunday, again. Food was terrific, again. Great flavors, great value. Service (Lauren) was excellent. Love coming to a place you can't find unless you already know where it is. Will be back.

ixaEHtTj3ridbdlriI2eog.text: We had been wanting to check out Dick's for a long time. The atmosphere seemed unique, and I love New Mexican style food. Our experience at Dick's was OK, but we probably won't go back anytime soon.  The Carne Adovada was pretty good, though I'm not one for large portion sizes. The portions at Dick's are LARGE. Great if that's your thing, but its not mine.   Besides the food, we weren't really impressed with the service. We were sitting at the bar, and there were plenty of bar tenders/servers walking past us the whole time, so it was surprising that the service was so slow. After we finished eating, we sat for 20 minutes waiting for someone to run our check. I'm sure this isn't everyone's experience, but we were rather annoyed by the time we left.  If the food or service had been amazing, I would have given Dick's another star, but we left feeling kind of, meh.

q_QcAElQQA3Elmdtznw19w.text: The best New Mexican Mexican Food this side of New Mexico. These guys make you feel at home the minute you walk in the door. I had the enchiladas and the portions were sized so I had enough left over for the next day's feast. The green and red chile were killer. They have a short but excellent(i recommend the Modern Times IPA that was available that day)beer list. The wines were reasonably priced and the list was large enough to satisfy every palate. For dinner, we had the New Mexican Enchilada plate, the Chicken Solano, two Grey Gooses on the Rocks and Two Modern Times IPA, and with the tip the meal came to 88.00 dinero. To emphasize again this was no doubt one of the best meals I have had since moving to Phoenix this summer. Funky neighborhood too.

7jCvd2rPriFyFimvC75cog.text: My favorite "serious need food" breakfast spot. More food than I could possible eat in one setting and just as good as leftovers. Mimosas & bloody Mary's are awesom. A perfect spot after hiking Camelback.

JIOPY7gwv1C3WPPLMeLSFg.text: I can not emphasize enough just how kick-ass this hidden gem really is.  First off, this joint isn't called Dick's Hideaway for no reason. Upon arrival you learn rather quickly how the name and location tie in together so effortlessly. And if you've found yourself here, you've already won half the battle.   Secondly, you've got to be okay with ignoring the menu and your instincts by trying their Carne Adovada Benedict. I say ignore because not everyone is a fan of spiciness (which this place is infamous for) or dabbling with unfamiliarity. But I am not even kidding, you can NOT go to this place and disregard the plate that their most known for.  Now I can be quite the weenie when it comes to spicy foods but this particular skillet had me craving it twice in one weekend. In fact, I seriously contemplated on whether or not I should miss my early flight back home (The Bay Area) just to have one more plate. Needless to say, I chose wrong and have been regretting it everyday since.  Don't be a prick and go to Dick's!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. It legit is a hideaway.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tenderloin benedict w. hash browns.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Adovada benedict w. hash browns.

V1WPaxl5_Fd7BE6DOGed_Q.text: The food was good. The favorite was the jalapeno poppers. The best ever. The place was crowded that day so we had to sit at the community table. We had a good time and we're chatting with some other people we met. But once the server noticed we were just chatting and taking up space he let us know that we should leave since there were others waiting outside to get in. I get it but damn we just spent quite a bit of money there and I guess it was just the way he said it. Basically it was a huge turn off. We felt like we literally got kicked out. So yeah. That put a damper on the whole experience. Overall - buzzKill

kMojmBujZpXq6CzwDbHr3w.text: Food was amazing.  Definite hole in the wall type of feel.   A new must on any trip to the area

6_9osD9_5gspnUHbkAuURw.text: This review will reveal itself in...  5....  4....  3...  2...  1...  Consider finding this review the equivalent of finding the front door to Dick's Hideaway. This restaurant definitely lives up to its name. Everything about it is hidden! The front door? Don't look for a sign. The True regulars know what door leads them to Dick's. The back entrance? Don't expect direction. Those who need to know where the back entrance do, and those who don't will walk around aimlessly until they find the front door. How about the bathroom lock? Don't worry, you won't have to go with an unlocked door, but it will take you time to find it...hint: it looks like a metal rod that's a part of the door.   One thing Dick's doesn't hide from you is the quality of their food. Completely delicious. I don't think you can go wrong with anything you order here. The enchiladas melt in your mouth, the chips and guac are good (ask for the flour chips-- thanks Aileen!) I went for the New Mexico Platter and all I can say is how! I was given a rellenao, chicken burro and tamale to try. Yes, it all kind of blended together but only because every bite was just as delicious as the next. It's spicy, it's cheesy, it's creamy, it's sassy (yes, I said sassy!)...it's just delicious. I tried my hardest to finish the meal but I only got maybe half way through (maybe less). It's a LOT of food and you could easily share.   Now be warned before you visit, this is a hideaway and that means, it's not big. Originally, there used to be maybe room for 15 people total. But now they have a room that fits about 30 more and it's perfect for a large group, but be sure to make a reservation!

9PK1_42Grqor5hGUH2TDSA.text: I wish I had known about this place years ago!!!!  Just returned from Albuquerque and miss the green chili everything.   Found Dick's on Yelp and went for breakfast.  My buddy ordered the breakfast burrito and I ordered Huevos Rancheros.  We sat at the bar and the cook was phenomenal to watch, my mouth was watering when I saw the green chili sauce poured on my eggs.  The beans, the potatoes and my eggs were cooked perfectly, the flavor of the green chili had just the perfect kick too.  I had a taste of the breakfast burrito and it was full of the best flavor.  Even my cup of coffee was tasty...which I don't expect anymore, so it was a great surprise and start to the day.    Atmosphere: quaint and inviting, and very clean Chef: Entertaining and spot on with everything, couldn't wait to get my plate Server: A little slow, but she seemed super busy, didn't see anyone helping her Food: A++ for Flavor, presentation, and texture!! I can't wait to go back!!!

gtzpWKp8sN_ltJfpenS67Q.text: This place was highly recommended by a Seattle friend who had lived in Phoenix for years. I was desperately looking for a weekend breakfast place after a month living in the valley.   WHY GO THERE? My friend's exact words were: "I'm about to change your life. Tomorrow go to Dick's Hideaway on 16th and Bethany Home. And it doesn't stand for what you think it does. There's no sign so look up the address. Be prepared to wait or eat at the bar. No bullshit the best breakfast place if not restaurant in the world."  He wasn't  kidding when he said no business sign out the building. We almost missed the place, but it's worth the second drive around the block.  WHATCHAGOT? I got the Tenderloin Benedict, which is not cheap for a breakfast entree, but all worth it. My companion had the Huevos Rancheros. I love protein in my breakfast. Remember when they say breakfast is the most important meal of the day? At Dick's Hideaway, it's the truth!  YOU GOT SERVED. Service is quick and friendly. Water is brought out as soon as you're seated. The food is hot, and so is the metal plate it's on.   I'm glad to find this hidden gem. Dick, whoever you are, you can come out of hiding.

PvhU3m2OhwX4EF07PsVKCg.text: Thanks to the tips from other Yelpers, we rolled right up to the unmarked double doors. Hidden next to a coffee bar is little gem of a restaurant...and I mean little. My boyfriend and I got there around 7 on a Saturday night and shared a large table with another group.  We loved the ambiance, and their no nonsense attitude, and the food does not disappoint! We started with a bowl of posole, then I got the sea bass special, and he got the gumbo. It would seem that everything on the menu is ridiculously fabulous! We will definitely make this a regular spot for us.

55V1ciJeDXxm6HeiLC7wCw.text: I went in for brunch, while waiting for the rest of my party to arrive I got to meet one of the cooks, Spencer.  He was great, and funny. He ended up taking my order, and coming back to check in. My food was amazing and I was so impressed with this cooks dedication. I cant remember our servers name, but she was fantastic as well. The menu was exceptional.  We all had a wonderful time and can't wait to come back Thank you so much!

CGw6l9Mk-NPXVAThVJN28g.text: Love coming here every time I get to Phoenix.  Great New Mexican food in this little gastropub.  Dinner or breakfast on the weekend is awesome.  Big portions and even bigger flavor.  Finding it with no sign out front is the key.

yHxKmyNylAa_kHXFoY60hg.text: My wife and I had breakfast this morning. She had the carne adovada and it was amazing. I had the meatloaf and eggs in red and green sauce. My meatloaf was so badly burnt it had a crust that could not be bitten through. We spotted a waiter and told him it was burnt and then turned over the meatloaf and it was solid black thick crust. The server shrugged and took the plate. On the way out he asked if I wanted anything else I said no. Our main server then avoided our table like the black plague had been seated with us. When the bill came she dropped off the tab and quickly scooted out to the back of the house. No apology, no comment she just tossed it on the table and left. We paid and left. While in the car on the way home we rode in silence, totally speechless at what a poor job they did of handling this situation. 25 years in the service industry and I have never seen a situation that was so poorly handled. After swearing off RIchardson's for over a year due to a horrible experience there we are now adding this one to the black list of places we will not return to under any circumstance.

yGFoiH-Mx4aZSMWlC1mT-Q.text: This is probably my favorite place in Phoenix. When me and my husband need a quiet night out we go here and find a quiet place at the bar. We love being able to watch them cook and they have a great wine list. If you go, you will smell like smoke when you leave, but i love that woodfired smell and don't mind it at all. It's a seat yourself place, so if you see a seat grab it and don't be picky. You can't go wrong with the carne adovada but you can go wrong with the salads. Stick with the good stuff, this isn't the place to eat healthy.

Rem9BdDs6FnivF8S_CTdVA.text: When I mentioned to my friend that I wanted to try "Southwestern food," this is where she took me. The hidden location - literally, it does not have a sign! - was cool and well-air conditioned. I had the carne adovada, and it was moist and flavorful. The food was tasty, and I appreciated the friendly service. Also, maybe it's just the fact that I'm used to NYC prices, but the bill (~$85 for four people, which includes drinks, tax, and tip) seemed quite reasonable for the size and quality of the portions. Overall a winner. :)

Qboiqglw-qPvuKRDlZ8fnw.text: Classic! Good wine, food AND they show sports! Best of all it is walking distance from home.

vELB3tKmABXN9oQX_JLpcA.text: Amazing atmosphere, great food, and big portions! This restaurant quickly became one of my Phoenix favorites! I can't wait to go back

JQsJv3yirxt4ic5x3JqUnw.text: Awesome service and the house margs were yummy. Ordered the roasted garlic app, loved the sauce and the peppers, the garlic was very large and easily spreadable, however no garlic taste. I prefer smaller garlic that is more potent as I love garlic! Ordered the  adovada and it was superb, my husband ordered the pork mole and he liked it. A little pricey but the adovada was worth it. Would not order the garlic again unless they use smaller, more pungent garlic.

8k04ffd21-L4rh8KQy8tFw.text: Fabulous. Had brunch here. The Adovada with anything and the Chile Verde are delicious with a heft of spice. Highly recommended.

hPzDO1aj7ObMwNIfd0ratA.text: Nothing in Phoenix compares to Dick's. Although it might be too small to be called intimate, there is nothing small about their cooking skills. Big League!    The New Mexican menu is authentic and the flavors indescribable. Their daily specials are not to be ignored. They have a rotating assortment of craft beer, killer Bloody Marys, and a good wine list.  The bartenders are great too.  Brunch, Happy Hour, special dinner plans, Dick's Hideaway is a triple threat treat.

k43AYD77oqQFGAlKJsl57g.text: I am shocked and amazed to find that I did not write a review for Dick's Hideaway.  This place is so good I had three meals in a row here, and I would gladly do it again.  Not only are they open for my odd hours with incredible food, but if memory serves, they have actual draft rootbeer.    When in town, highly recommend ya drop by... if you can find the door... :)

yuMz0nLHIgIT-VLcsLGwFg.text: This hidden gem is possibly the best restaurant is Phoenix.

WnSlW9PKZtm4BI1nqmHWDA.text: Don't get me wrong the food is great! And great portions! We went as a Easter brunch date and the bar was packed which was okay the bartender offered us a drink right away which was great, there was a little spot that was opening up soon so we stood and waited when the spot opened we walked towards the seating and another more appealing table opened up and a man directed us and said that the tables were seating only for 3 or more people. While watching a couple of "2" get up from the table, we were very confused, we didn't understand the seating arrangement was he going to make us stand until a 2 seating space opens? But yet some staff directed us to a huge table in the back seating 15 but we can sit there. Over all I would love to go back, and hopefully have a spot at the bar top. but I will have to get over that service,

3iEPvWhbvGRtqAdOK_BaRg.text: My friend and I seriously had a hard time finding this place! We drove around in circles twice before we decided to park and eat at another restaurant around the corner. At this other restaurant, we ordered water, ordered food, felt like failures, canceled our orders, got up and left and finally found this place! It was worth it. ATTENTION: It literally has no sign on the outside!  On to the food... The jalapeno eggs benedict I had was almost fantastic. My only gripe was that it was more of just eggs benedict without any jalapeno, but I'll live. Other than that, it was still tasty. The service was fast and cordial.  The price was definitely more expensive than I had imagined but after putting so much effort into finding this hideaway, I couldn't care less about what it cost to put their food in my mouth.

mSWNHzAsYD5nnDdqTjQrdA.text: A friend and I came here today because she knows I am always looking for a good New Mexico Mexican place to eat. We split the Carne Adovada and the Chili Relleno platter. They were both so good! I want to come back for breakfast because that also looked amazing!

rKe3IQjUdG-AeBzXpBqHUw.text: I've now tried this place several times.    I want to like it, and I rarely write bad reviews, but, UGH!   The cost versus what you get is so out of whack that I'm compelled to write.     The food is very HEAVY/greasy, it's expensive ($100.00 for 3 people) for what you get, and the preparation is poor at best.   My friends had the steak and the carne adobada, I the rellenos.   We had the garlic dish, which sadly didn't come before the meal but, rather with it.    But, even that is that wasn't a big deal.     However, sadly, all of us pretty much confirmed that the meals, had we made them at home, we would have tossed and taken the family out.   People seem to want to compare this place with Richardson's due to similar DNA, unfortunately the place is not anywhere near as good as Richardson's was and I can't really put a finger on why.  If you like heavy, greasy, premium priced food, then this place is for you.

KTRFZwJCoAmmaQwNbG5JyQ.text: OMG! Been trying to come here for a couple of years and we finally did! Look close as it's hard to find (thus the "hideaway")-it's cozy so expect a wait, but worth it. Great selection of Mexican breakfast options, an awesome Mary and obviously a favorite for locals too! Could have chilled all day in this dark hideaway!

X-SeJQVWE0mf4EPXuDN4Vg.text: My favorite food in the world is New Mexican, which is not to be confused with any other variation of Mexican.  NewMex is unique and in my humble opinion, is much more sophisticated than its spurious cousins.  I used to live in northern New Mexico and I got hooked to it the first day I lived there.  It is one of my life quests (this sounds awful, right?) to find the best New Mexican places to eat in the US.  Meal:  I went with the green chile meatloaf with medium eggs.  I also went with the beans and the potatoes.  To drink,  I went with two different beers, but I can't remember which ones.  Taste:  Holy shit! The meatloaf was the best meatloaf I have ever had.  The eggs were complimented the meal extremely well and the green chile is spicy.  But it wasn't that it was just "hot" but it had great seasonings.  The only let down was the tortilla.  It wasn't homemade fresh.  Had it been served with my meal, this place would be a perfect 10.  8 out of 10.  Value:  Outside of saying its above average but not great, I don't know what else to really say.  The portions are healthy size and you will be bound to have a little leftover.  4 out of 5.  Service/Cleanliness:   Our waitress was attentive, funny, a smartass (but in a good way) and made great recommendations.  We got to sit down quickly and the food was served pretty darn quick.  9 out of 10.  Atmosphere: The fiance and I sat at the big copper table where multiple parties can sit at.  At first, I was a little hesitant but at the end, I thought it was one of the coolest dining experiences.  We spoke to a bunch of random people and got great ideas of where to eat it.  We celebrated another person's birthday.  It was incredibly fun! 5 out of 5.  Overall:  Dick's is one of my favorite places to eat in Phoenix.  I am a sucker for great New Mexican food and Dick's is of no short supply of it.  27 out of 30 points, 5 out of 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VITH4NB1dPWIJfl8I7Ufug.text: Wow! This place is fucking amazing! I didn't expect to eat some bomb ass  green chile verde stew w eggs and home made ass tortillas like I did here! They never left my 30 glass of ice tea drinkn ass empty and the food tastes like your eating at ur MexicAn grandmas house in the 80s.  Outside of the amazing ass food, the vibe is wonderful, the decor and feel is clean and welcoming. This shit should be a chain. As many shitty spots I've been to in my life, this week has been good to me.    Do yourself a favor and go eat brunch here. Seriously, or Go fuck yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

g13ht0gDP7mAYL6uW_wXqA.text: I was skeptical about a place I couldn't find. My cuzzin told us we had to try this place. I guess it's a old club of some sort back in the Prohibition days. Ok cool I'm game. I was driving and couldn't find it. I knew we would have to look for it. My wife phoned in a Togo order so we just had to pick it up. Kinda exciting. We finally found the place and walked in. Kinda cool the inside. My wife spoke with a lady at the bar and paid. my wife handed me the receipt and said please give it back to her. The lady handed me the food and I responded I gave the final receipt to the bar guy. Also can I have utensils. She replies sure. I followed her through the restaurant so she didn't have to walk back. I was kinda excited and said we drove all the way from Vegas. The lady replies yea give me one sec. I was like wtf I wasn't rushing you. Rude!! Then after she gave the utensils I said thank you she said yea and walked away. Smh!!! The food was amazing!! I hate that the food was good. I wish I could tell y'all not to go but the food was amazing!!! We order the carne Asada Benedict and the shrimp with bacon and beans and rice. The food had all type of  flavors. I would go back just for the food. If the lady was nicer I would have gave more stars.

0GI2QCfqOykZY_b3YelQYQ.text: Delicious food! Got the fish trio! So amazing, I'm not a meat eater really so I wasn't sure if this place would have good fish options but the fish were all cooked perfectly and the sauces on top were fantastic! The service was mediocre (hence, 4 stars) even when it wasn't really busy but sat near the bar on the high top tables.  The food and the small dark atmosphere made up for it though!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish trio in front, and the pork mole further away. Believe both were amazingly delicious, although I didn&#39;t eat the pork dish!

7Ty9QF9ypHGH10X9dadFpg.text: Food was "ok"...drinks during happy hour didn't make me too happy (limited selection)... And to top it all off... They attempted to overcharge me for food items by charging me twice.  Simple mistake perhaps?   Wouldn't be my first choice... But I guess that's why they hide-away.

TECC0YbjXsSnSK-bPZpoZA.text: The food was delicious! The service was great. The atmosphere was cozy. I ordered the green chile plate. The portions led to lovely leftovers! Cannot wait to try the brunch here- Eggs Benedict is my jam!

iguYO1R3MvqQA8sZYiv0Gw.text: The restroom was clean and the paper towels were super absorbent.    The food was okay for what I ordered.  The French toast was awesome however.

YXFXP2Cpu2wopoF0tGm5eg.text: You'll never find this place on the first try- but that's part of the fun.  The funky vibe, weird seating at the copper topped tables and zesty New-Mexico inspired cuisine in huge portions is the rest of it.  A random Tuesday at 2 pm and the place was pretty full, so that's a recommendation, as is the fact that there's daily brunch until 4 pm!  The salsa is zesty- ask for a sample if you're not sure.  The service wasn't speedy, but we were there to kick back until our flight home, so it suited us just fine.  Our drinks were continually topped up, the food was delicious and the service was super-nice- they gave us a clean menu with the date and our selection in the check register as a momento, just because!  I'll go back-if you can find it, you should too.  Tip- look for the number at the bottom of the glass door between the shrubs.  And plan to circle the parking area at least twice as you try to see it from the car.  They take the name seriously.

nPqNiMuQrL41CStexzX7ZA.text: Really awesome portions and delicious food! It's a bit pricey but it's totally worth it

uUUWgzG-ZtSN4P3wy43J9Q.text: My son and I went to Dick's Hideaway for breakfast last Sunday and it was marvelous!  We started out with wonderful Bloody Mary which had an asparagus stick rather than a celery stick.  Very cool!  My meal was the Tomatillo Toast - yum!  Had a great kick to it!  There were quite a few patrons, but the staff was great, attentive at the right time.  If I lived in Phoenix, it would be my "go to" place.

JWkNq2Q52MJ2jCmXUT6s0g.text: Santa Fe chicken is succulently amazing !! This palace is very unique and the margaritas are awesome. My mother had the Carne adobada and she was so happy that wants to come back again. My bf got the Pasta Heidi , creamy spicy and delicious ! Great place to eat if you are looking for New Mexican style .

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IoIn3xNQVzVnfovShEiZsg.text: One of my favorite spots in Phoenix. I always come here if I don't know where else to go! My favorite dish is the chicken cordon bleu but everything I've tried is amazing as well! I usually sit at the bar and my service is always great!

KwkOKKM29UowKrWokuDDSg.text: Chili rellenos were exceptional, the green chili and eggs were magnificent, average Bloody Mary. The atmosphere and devote make for a memorable meal.

_89E-oK_rwdbkOIoP23gyA.text: Had the adobada, ain't gonna lie, twas bomb. Bloody mary's were tasty as well. Food was priced right and friendly staff. Definitely a must each time i'm in Phoenix.

mHL6DobZHEjEvahKoVhFhA.text: Expensive. Should definitely be 3 dollar sign. Majority of menu is expensive and above 20 dollars. Only thing worth it here is the burger. Place was super small and food was just alright but not worth the price.

IVt_RqDUG5DllAWuf45ytw.text: I don't want to be too redundant but the food here is spectacular. It's literally a hidden gem of Phoenix, they don't even have a sign on the entrance. The service was exceptional and the food was outstanding. I ordered the Carne Adovada and I highly recommend. The pork was rich and hearty, when you eat them with the eggs it's a party in the mouth.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Succulent pork from the Carne Adovada and Eggs.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled shrimp cooked to perfection.

4AjiJAqtFcKcUQCZOO-Cag.text: This place is super good for New Mexico style Mexican food. They have some great spicy meals, like the enchiladas and great accompanying drinks.  Very small and warm setting.

Giw_CxFFcr7NN7wbkQ9Iow.text: It took awhile to find the place, circled the building three times; it is definitely a hideaway!  Yet it was so worth it.  Best green chile enchiladas I ever had.  We tried the queso and it was fabulous.  I think the best word to describe the food is flavorful.  Everyone in our party loved the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enchiladas = Magic

arC-bzIYpm_jIHMNLBdkDA.text: Fabulousness in a dish! I had the huevos rancheros with green, red chiles. It was spicy but I'm a little tame when it comes to spices.  The blue corn tortillas were delicious! You have to look for the sign next door at the hardware store, there's not a sign on the restaurant. It's set up like a bar on one side and a wine room with a family style table. Worth the trip & finding the secret door for amazing food!

_2UpBh5Q936U_iJddL0-UQ.text: Had brunch. One of the best ever. Pancakes and French toast won over the kids. I had the Eggs Benedict Jalapeno. Very very good.

bs15Z7uphmKHRkEyvnFYtg.text: After reading many reviews and being told this was some of the best New Mexican food outside of NM I decided to take the plunge this AM with some friends in town who too enjoy NM cuisine.   I ordered the Juevos Rancheros with a side of Carne Adovada, which came out cooked exceptionally well and had some amazing flavor and the right amount of heat just like it is done in new Mexico.   I will return for the food only as the service was not lacking, but had a feel that we were a bother. We were seated before two other groups yet had our order taken last even though we were obviously ready and in turn had our food out just about the time one (who seated after us) table was paying the tab and exiting.   Perhaps this was just an off morning, but maybe not. In regards to the food it is top notch, but service is lacking. On my next trip To I will again hope for a better all around experience and perhaps up the stars.    Food - 5 Service - 2

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Juevos Rancheros &amp; side of Carne Adovada

CUNmJwVpb2y8zazPF7TEZA.text: P McCullough: Wow...what a cool place and the food is outstanding.  Like many other reviews...unless you are playing Inspector Clouseau, you will never find this place.  There is a sign in front that says "Additional Parking in The Rear" right above the portal in.  Happy hunting.  Bistro setting for food and bar.  Sit at the bar, it's more entertaining.  Had a couple margaritas, hand crafted and shaken (nice).  A little on the sweet side for my likening.  Food is fantastic.  They have a wood fired grill which imparts a beautiful smokey flavor to all foods that hit it.  I had the New Mexico enchiladas that were smothered in green chili. Man U felt like I was back in Santa Fe (but with better food).  Just go if you can find.  You will not be disappointed. .

YY2bWT0VqKVmg9_uLpeSng.text: I LOVE DICK'S HIDEAWAY. I have never eaten anything here that wasn't amazing! I daydream about their chile all the time. Chile relleno, enchiladas, green chile stew, carne adovada--all of them have been absolutely wonderful. I love that it's hard to find and whenever I take people here, they are always impressed.   The service is hit or miss and the inside is a little strange: dark, cold, crowded. That's fine. I'm not there for anything else except for the New Mexican food!

JVc8nYiKMeNgbiZpwk5J0Q.text: So many things  have been said that are very True. This place is truly a diamond in the rough. I read so many reviews about the Carne Adovada that I had to try it.  I ordered the shrimp scampi and the Adovada Sliders. The shrimp scampi was good... it sat on a bed of seasoned rice. Some of the rice was a tad dried out and hard but the flavor of the dish made it easy to ignore. The sliders were out right orgasmic...I don't even smoke and I would have said yes to a cigarette when I'm finished. There's not much more to say... if you like meat, you like pork ( I'm not normally a huge pork fan)and you can tolerate a little heat you'd be crazy not to try it.  The place is tiny but service is quick and pretty efficient. Plus I went during happy hour... Definitely got my money's worth.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Adovada sliders
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp scampi over rice

OX_6gxczlKOVmW0END9-Ng.text: This review would be best served by a story. Imagine you're a cowboy in the old west. Think Clint Eastwood in High Plains Drifter. But you have a cook that travels with you in a chuck wagon. This cook is trained in all things amazingly tasty & secretly, he's trying to kill you - slowly. What I had at this place is what he feeds you every day.  Eggs Benedict Adovada. It is the most amazing decadent irresistible thing I've ever eaten. So as the cowboy, you'd eat it every day & after a few weeks you're too fat to get on your horse, your gun belt no longer fits & your chest hurts intermittently. And so one day, as an overweight, unarmed coronary walking the plains, you're shot by vaqueros & the cook smiles. YOU MUST GO HERE.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The glorious bacon wrapped shrimp &amp; Adovado sliders. Death by fat.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OG16KQSyzt1ZFoTtCQQ-pw.text: cozy, warm, inviting space -I like my Bloody Mary quite spicy and they delivered. -I savored the pork adovado benedict. -My breakfast potatoes had a wonderful level of crispness. -My fiance enjoyed the breakfast burrito. -The beans were tasty and not too heavy. -Service was attentive without being intrusive.

lVxG1sAkTp57M5vhAAML3Q.text: By far, some of the Best Southwestern cuisine you will ever eat. Guaranteed! Everything except the Cheesesteak sandwich is Out of This World. But then again, you shouldn't be ordering a cheesesteak sandwich from this place.   My favorite dish is 3 Shrimp Enchiladas with the Rice and Beans. The Red Chili's here can be spicy, and the portions are huge. Almost impossible to get through.   Highly Recommended....If you can find it ;)

kNuqVikXKBNOjuYKl4QGEQ.text: The food is 4 star, maybe 4.5.  Really good food.  Quality and tasty.  I am not a fan of the "schtick": purposely hard to find (no signage, so you just have to find it using the address), and kind of a "f-off" vibe in the restaurant.  I can see how some would find that really cool, but it's just not my thing.

nArGUS9MxSHls2NBUa6ukw.text: Hideaway is right.  You either know where it is - intending to arrive there for food - or you'll completely miss it.  Seating is interesting - bar area was full - big copper top table for 8 is open - and you share your meal time and conversation with others sitting at the same table.  Not really a problem, common in other cities - but new-ish to me here.  That aside - great service - and I loved my New Mexican Platter - Tamale, relleno, green burro, rice and beans, with combo green and red chile.  On the spicy/hot side - but expected that knowing the other Richardsons's menus.  All components were solid - but didn't make me stand and shout that I can't wait to go back.  Other diners were less pleased with their meals - one indicated his chicken was rather dry and flavorless... I'll encourage him to write a review.  I'd go back... but there are still a lot of Mexican/New Mexican places I'd like to try first...

tF5w7tq0NrHXYLs65uZ7hw.text: not what I expected, love their place in NM,, wish it were the same menu.. Nice place but pricey,  drinks good,  best thing we had was the ribs. other than that  not so pleased.

ZfyURmWmbImRMgX2HMdNxA.text: Go to place for great food. Great drinks. Great atmosphere. Great service. The quarters are a bit tight but I also like that as well. The menu always offering brunch til 4, small plates, and the food tastes great.

MgOh1NGy2AZRHVx1uZEd7g.text: Best Enchiladas I tried in Phoenix, better than gadzooks that according to yelp, they are ranked number 1! Going back to Dick's, the sauce is authentic New Mexican flavor, but what made it for me was that they use Blue Corn tortillas!  That's going above and beyond!  Service is awesome, the cooks are awesome, nice Mexican gentleman and a white guy that seem to make a great duo! Love the mimosas nice and strong!  Great Bar, great place for our community!  Need more bars, restaurants like these!  Bring on the Happiness!

Z7QFSAbpSNbnfS4gV9eZKQ.text: Dick's hideaway is such a great gem to stumble across.  Food is awesome, drinks are delish and the decor/inside is so dark and fun.  As a night nurse we often discuss where we should go in the AM and have a morning cocktail to shake the night off, Dick's is always our first choice.  I love that they're open early and totally get it.. a group of us will walk in and they always know we want mimosas and they take the time to chat and joke with us. Love this place!

bhN9IU1jHXPMjkQZBuXfzg.text: Im new to Phoenix and have yet to come out for Sunday brunch. Yesterday my fiance took me to the fabulous Dick's Hideaway. Being from San Francisco, he thought I would be impressed by their non-corporatism and lack of advertising (Dick's has no sign on the door)..  WE were offered a seat next to the fire place. It was cozy but we were sharing a table with another couple who came in behind us who we didn't know. That's fine, but they got up and left and our waitress informed us, 'they didnt belong here anyway'..  ok  My finance and I are not the richest couple in the land, however, we are highly attractive and generous tippers. The food came out very quickly. Not sure if that is a good thing.  Asked if I could sample the green chile sauce. I was charged $2.  My finance got up to use the restroom and the waitress snapped at me, 'Where did he go?' ..as if he was trying to escape without paying.  My fiance did not like his Bloody Mary, but waitress did not care to entice him with anything else.  We paid the bill with a card, left a cash tip and walked out the door only to have waitress run after us and ask us if we took a glass from the table.   I looked at her like she was a kook.  Bye Dicks.

32Ut2lTOkfaHqhJmxfc7YQ.text: Dicks is a really cool place. We flew into Phoenix that morning for my sister's bachelorette weekend and wanted to start off with a good brunch with great mimosas. Dicks delivered both!  After finding it (the door isn't marked, it's a hideaway after all), we walked into a dark and busy-looking atmosphere that made you feel like you were a world away.  Our waiter was really awesome (I accidentally left his name on my menu but it started with a 'Th' and was quite different) and he gave us several good recommendations and top-notch customer service.  Food was really good and the mimosas were fizzy and perfect!  It really was a great find!

KNjCqRwicqAc4QAuo_mL1w.text: The service is great. Attentive and friendly. I liked the beer selection. Tiny, but cozy and not too loud. The food was really good- New Mexico style Mexican.  If you are not a spicy person, ask about what you are ordering.  It really is a hideaway, but worth the search.

Rl5MDgnt-KVRipeIOEljvg.text: Great happy hour!  We ordered too much food but it was all excellent. Waiter a bit cranky but the food and drinks made up for it.  Recommend it!

9fkfq8dk75XMM3Gzf5kGIw.text: A week ago I came here on a date. I've always heard of this place yet never seemed to know where the heck it was. So we arrived, it was a tuesday night so it was pretty slow.  The interior is small, cozy. Sorta dive bar-ish. Which is pretty cool. The prices aren't so dive bar-ish but the food was INCREDIBLE. Sooooo I guess you really do get what you pay for.   All in all this is a great place for dinner, and I even hear that breakfast here is amazing. Although I do hope breakfast is cheaper. Dinner for 2 adults, one beer and one glass of wine with run you close to $50.

-ujMwOWfb0qkcawyepHfkg.text: Only one word to describe this place and that's wow!  I like the hidden vibe and how it's hard to find because there's no sign on the door. We went for brunch on our recent trip to Phoenix for spring training. The food was amazing!  Be sure to come with an appetite as the portions are huge.  Definitely a spot I will visit again when traveling to Phoenix.

6EEoXF8GRFTyXpT15s6Y6Q.text: Huge portion that was awesome off the grill and great the next day.  I had the special which was a fusion of classic American and Mexican food breakfast.  It looks and feels like a secret spot, but it is too good not to talk about.  It did not hurt that I was eating with someone I think is enchanting.

ticzHSkz8d3nAbiin3zWzQ.text: Such a great spot, one of my faves ever. If I lived in the 'hood, I would be here every night. I came tonight with one of my best friends Sam G. We have been chowing down here for almost 20 years. The place is awesome, just go.
