tyNufcDxIZTdw_XEdBXXPg.text: So hidden away couldn't find it. Was looking forward to trying it but gave up on the treasure hunt and ate close by. Wish the directions were more helpful. Probably out of business.

Q4VGZZ9xPQN3eWzrQDY3QA.text: Today was my second visit and I was pleased with the atmosphere, cleanliness, staff attitude, service and food.   This is a fun whimsical place with a humorous atmosphere. It has many fun signs.   The service and food was good and they were very accommodating to my special dietary requirements.   From the Kids Menu, I will assume they want to discourage too many children patronizing their restaurant. LOL

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GnHXS_in6ZxpEg7IP8_6Yg.text: We were so surprised.  This place is truly spectacular.  Best enchiladas I've ever had.  I don't live in the area, but we'll definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZdZWz9odibL9qocOGss4bg.text: I have dined in all three Richardson's restaurants (Richardson's, Dick's Hideaway and Rokerij) and unfortunately I don't get the hype around all three. The ambiance itself is lovely, which makes it a great place for late night drinks. I wish I could say the same about the food.  We came in on a weekday for late night happy hour (from 3-6 pm and 9 pm to close). The happy hour menu is still pretty pricey. I ordered Skewers ($15) and found them to be dry and under seasoned. I have also had the Midwestern for brunch one time and was not impressed despite them using my favorite sausage (Schreiner's). My boyfriend has had the shrimp enchiladas numerous times and swears it's one of the best enchiladas he has ever had.   I will keep dining here as most people I know are big fans; I personally would rather spend my money elsewhere.

1liq6bKfJbNUbuGmhkeSrQ.text: This place was awesome- atmosphere, food, service, everything.  The lighting is really dim and the vibe is intimate... Although I will warn that it seemed a lot of tables were large and communal. My party of 4 lucked out and got a private nook table that afforded us privacy and was tucked away by our own TV in the front room. I noticed though, that the parties at the communal table seemed to all be laughing and affable and talking with each other, which was nice!   The menus are heavily Tex Mex themed.  All the dishes feature beans/tortilla/green chiles, etc... even the steaks carry the theme. But the food was very hearty and, while a bit pricey, it was truly delicious! My friend ordered off the specials menu (check the blackboard!) and got a steak with scallops, which he said was amazing. The Carne Adovada (smoked pork roast simmered in red chile, with cheese, rice, beans & a flour tortilla) featured fall-off-the-bone tender meat that had been simmered in a heavy chile sauce. Everyone enjoyed it but it was a tad spicy for me (i'm a wuss). I opted for the Seafood Linguine (jumbo shrimp and scallops over fresh pasta, white wine sauce, tomatoes, spinach and parmesan). It was surprisingly light for a pasta dish! No heavy creamy sauce, but a nice light white wine sauce and some tomatoes/spinach thrown in for color and brightness. The shrimp and scallops were huge and really well seasoned. I loved it, and had leftovers for lunch the next day.   A must order is the Roasted Garlic Plate appetizer (with green chile, roasted peppers, cheese & dipping sauces). The plate was HUGEEEE and the elephant garlic was equally gigantic and soft as could be. Amazing to spread over toasted bread with a bit of the peppers and melted cheese. A huge hit, but beware your breath after...   All in all, really enjoyed this hidden gem and would definitely recommend it if you're willing to drop a few extra $ for dinner one night!   Parking was easy outside in the little strip mall.

sm5j2wvimHsC1h26pTWBkA.text: I love this place! Authentic NM delicious green chili, great back room atmosphere! A great treat!!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green Chili Breakfast Burrito

m2dP0FXraiEbCasjLaELew.text: Couldn't find the place the place first time I tried.  Went last night, parked the car and hunted for it and found it.  A really nice small crowded place.  Pretty good selection of beers on tap.  Take that back, maybe 8 or 10 on tap but had one I liked so it was good for me.  I ordered carne adovada because I am in search of some tasting as good as I used to get in Albuquerque.  This was pretty tasty but I would not order it if you don't like to be surprised by a big glob of fat.  Several of them in there but hey, that is where the flavor is.  Anyway I could only eat about half of the giant portion until I cried uncle.  The staff was really great.  Every single one asked if I needed anything, checked in about every five minutes or so   All very pleasant.  It is a small place so you are kind of elbow to elbow but very much worth going.

74hJ8b2vUGufT4xrJ2M_bw.text: If you are in Pheonix don't waste your time going anywhere else.    Simply outstanding.  Wine selection....had a bottle of 2017 Prisoner Red Blend....appitzer the barbecued Shrimp, main entree...the Mahi Special.  Crowd was great, good looking people, waitresses super service and super cliente!      Worth the wait!

q-8CAp3CZ8QCpyzxZ7ochA.text: Aside from the delicious New Mexican menu and drinks, Dicks Hideaway is a unique dining space in all of the right ways. Intimate, dimly lit, open kitchen bar counter is where it's at. 2 dining rooms w 4-5 tables each one convertible to private dining room.   The food is awesome. Carne Adovada or Mole with tortilla beans and rice are my two favorite dishes. The meat is cooked juicy and they bring New Mexican inspired flavors spices to their recipes.   As a disclaimer, The food is spicy. Be forewarned. But they always have awesome market selections for beef and fish on the chalk board if you want to go off the traditional menu items.   This is one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix.

FhxpvBNKvoTQfF1sIxjcZg.text: One of the best places in Phoenix.   Love the food, the ambience and the service  Will always be a go to favorite spot

oGWJeojeKmQamAQUlueYJQ.text: Wow.  Absolutely love this place !!  Going out with friends from out of town and was tasked with picking a Southwestern local eatery.  Yelp to the rescue once again.  Amazing ambiance.  Literally a hidden gem in an otherwise ordinary strip mall.  No signs on the outside other than the "Sorry, We're Open" sign very low on the door.  Just a set of double doors between two bushes separate the outside world from this cavern-like bar with intimate seating nooks.  Our group of 5 had a blast the entire night.  This is most definitely one of the best local places for entertaining guests and eating a fantastic meal.  I chose the Enchilada plate and had several options.  Went with one green chile pork, one smoked turkey, and one shrimp enchilada.  Serving size was huge and it was served on a large cast iron plate.  Will spread the word about this place and will definitely be back with friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing three enchilada plate.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu doubles as a placemat.

vMrEoe34q-QTT-H570cc9A.text: There is literally nothing bad you could possibly say about this amazing tucked away spot in Phoenix. The atmosphere is fun but not over ran. Great music but not too loud, so you can still hear yourself think and hear your conversation. They have an open concept kitchen where you can see it all happening and although the staff are doing a million things at once there was not a single moment where we felt forgotten, they were attentive from the moment we walked in. Now, to talk about the food... First off, we got a chicken quesadilla which was every bit as cheesy and delicious as it was filled with tender chicken and came with sides of fresh red salsa and spicy green salsa. Then came our crispy and yummy Cesar salad which comes with our entree of the New Mexican Surf and Turf. So, this entree.. Where to start... The tenderloin was cook exactly to the perfect juicy medium rare, that was topped with flawlessly grilled shrimp which was wrapped in crisp bacon, I recommend savoring every bite because although large shrimp..they disappear from your plate too soon! Last but not least, the chorizo enchiladas, which they do almost like a tostada actually...Some background about me, I've been eating chorizo since I was 5, all kinds and it's hit or miss... This was a bullseye hit, the absolute best Chorizo I've ever had in my entire 26 years of life. Incredible flavor, tender and melts away with the accompaniment of a delicious cheesy black bean tortilla. I want to bring everyone I love here.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Quesadillas
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cesar Salad
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. *New Mexican Surf And Turf

U897pE0HguVw86n5m8dX2A.text: Okay, so you're not kidding when you say it's a Hideaway. I had so much trouble locating this place - it's right next to Luci's on the corner of Bethany Home Road and 16th Street. Now I know for next time. It's snug and warm and homey in here, with a nice bar selection and friendly service. We had breakfast and were not disappointed. My french toast was crisped and golden, cooked through and served with real maple syrup. My pal's tamale and eggs were quite good as well. Roasted pork, a bit spicy in savory masa with a couple of fried eggs on top. I love the aroma breezing throughout of freshly charred meat. Really nice breakfast, and I'd revisit for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dick&#39;s for Breakfast!!!

ucZd3kpVO00FMWw2BWy60w.text: It's not New Mexico but it's a 10 minute drive instead of a five hour drive! The vibe is dark and cozy the carne adovada with eggs plate massive and tasty, and a good selection of craft beers on tap. I try to get here every few weeks for breakfast and it's always good. The coffee  is fine, but it's not like pinon coffee. The staff is terrific, Adam and Jason are always attentive without getting in the way. The adovada uses smoked red chiles which aren't so much my style but it's hearty and solid nonetheless. Fine selection of tequila but not as good as Maria's in santa fe. Such a great place. Back here after a long hike the day before and Dick's always aims to please.  Update 11 Nov 2018: early morning, Sunday. Food is great as always. Blonde lady behind bar seems uninterested in being attentive unless she knows the bar patron. Great way to ruin a nice plate of carne adovada and eggs. Have to keep asking for coffee refill, mentioned to her the coffee was cold, she said "hey, it's cold here too", I guess meaning the kitchen side of bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Well stocked bar, intimate seating, kitchen in full view. Nice little spot. Will see how the carne adovada turns out!

97YV9jAKJtK6z7jv_NLAAw.text: My wife and I went here for breakfast today for the first time and it was amazing food and ambiance.  Our family has recommended it for the couple years. I had the huevos ranchero.  Ton of food and very good.  Ask for a few more corn tortillas.  My wife had the bacon wrapped shrimp (can't lie, I stole one).  It was very good.  Service was great!  We will be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QWFbWh6Xs5SgL8WTW2rlgg.text: Used to be good - not anymore.  Quality went down - staff are lazy and food gets worse but the prices continue to increase.  Poor selection of wines and the glasses are super dirty with water spots and dried food.  The ratings are most likely from regulars.  I used to go here every week since 2004, now I pass it up.  I prefer not to spend $$$$ on an unpleasant experience with less than mediocre food that has cross-contamination.

liY-BMWQ0hae69Uf8dH1rg.text: This place definitely is hidden away.  We had to call them on the phone when were in the parking lot to figure out where they were (between Sola and Luci's), since there is no street number and no outside signage, other than a copy of the menu near the front door.  After we figured that out, we had to leave after about 30 seconds, since there was so much cooking smoke inside the restaurant that it triggered my wife's asthma.  Oh well, you can't please everyone.

Jq_tOIV7yzJh5pXgZThMEg.text: Hidden Gem!  Been here twice and can't wait to go back.  Cool vibe inside and eclectic menu.  Everything we've had to eat was superb and the margaritas are tasty.  Tough place to find but well worth it.

mPGAteDaRCfGChE5YRtNcA.text: What an absolute gem of a breakfast spot. No sign at all outside even indicating it exists.   We saw that this place had great reviews on Yelp and wanted to give it a try. The inside is really cozy and charming. They cook the food on a wood - burning grill which you can see from your seats. I ordered the Carne Avodavo with eggs sunny - side up, hash browns and added some level 2 green sauce on the side for some kick. The portion was massive and I could barely eat half of it but it was delicious.   I saw others at the restaurant drinking mimosas which looked incredible (all the juices are fresh-squeezed apparently)  The bar looks really cool and I'd love to try the dinner place next door, which is surrounded by wine racks and has a large wooden table in the middle great for groups.   I will definitely be back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs Carne Avodavo

a1aASMMOd9-54r3pOXPgYg.text: Delicious tenderloin benedict! Meat was cooked on the wood fired stove and very tender. I also got the orange juice which tasted fresh squeezed. I would highly recommend the $6 for the OJ which will get you two glasses. I definitely plan on coming back next time I am in the area.

07IIf1AxUWcbLSQvmxarYQ.text: Disappointing after reading other reviews.  Had bacon wrapped shrimp as an appetizer.  Bacon was burnt.  Had New Mexico chicken and shrimp enchiladas as entree.  It was OK.  A little spicier than I like, but that is more my issue.  Most would probably find them fine.

lUY1AJmeuuwmMUq-_GlCbw.text: This place is hard to find, but holly  cow Amazing! Super friendly service amazing food. The restaurant is small but offers the best of everything. I have never been here before but I'm coming back next time I'm in Phoenix.

jc7yNs87-Ytblm9CeLbgIA.text: This place is kind of hidden, but it's pretty cute inside. The portion sizes are huge. I ordered the jalepeno eggs benedict and I was only able to finish half of it. My friend got the carndovada eggs benedict, and it tasted so good. My only complaint is that they charge $2 for sauce.

vhhIcIRxvceCnhV3WjPrhw.text: We came for breakfast today. The food is always amazing. This is our favorite place for breakfast and drinks. They use fresh grapefruit juice for the greyhounds. Lauren is always very friendly and attentive. Just wish they didn't get rid of the tenderloin bene.

gzjwRcw1xoc9y6z34N6wbA.text: Very cool place. Is hidden. Food is great but definitely spicy. We got the hedi (forgot the name) pasta and it was amazing! We also got the veggie enchiladas which was a bit spicy for me. Service was great. Beers were chilled and smooth. We will definitely be back here.

nF61hqhLxOkKnF2uwPvZmQ.text: Hidden gem for sure. Service was amazing and food was delicious. Best mimosas I've ever had! We had the carne adovada with eggs, so good, flavor was amazing! Can't wait to to come back!

9i9URXt3LvPvTmoThPphig.text: Love. This. Place. Lots of character, great food, and drinks. I was in town for business and came across this place by luck. Went for dinner and brunch. Bloody Mary was very good and served with a side car. Win. Win.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hidden treasure! Great vibe. Delicious food. Super service.

Vi17FyQJWZGwHf9lEQM3tg.text: Cool, so very cool.    We were visiting Phoenix and thought we'd take a shot and look for a New Mexican restaurant.   I stumbled upon Dick's thanks to Yelp.  Based on other reviews we knew we'd have to "look" for it.  We got to the area and I did something other reviewers evidently did not think of - I called.  The guy who answered the phone was super helpful and guided me in.  The ambiance is really cool - and cool.  Dark inside and great AC.  We sat at the back of the place,  the area was really interesting,  great view of the rest of the place and very well laid out.   The staff were extremely attentive,  knowledgeable,  and just great people to be around.  Food,  please note that my husband is from ABQ so the bar is a bit higher for restaurants that serve New Mexican food.  The menu has great twists on traditional N.M. fare.  They elevated the typical and blew me away with other really great choices.  We happen to make it during happy hour - which the food and drink options are fantastic.   It was Sunday so I was happily surprised that they even offered happy hour.  We started off with the garlic platter and BBQ pork sliders - sorry I cannot remember the exact name but they were super.  The platter was huge,  garlic roasted perfectly along with the peppers.  The green chili sauce was fantastic.  HUGE portions!  The sliders were very, very good.    My friends had the surf and turf and my husband had the chicken cordon blue.  WOW!  The steak was cooked perfectly and so tender.  Thanks Brian for sharing. The cordon blue was nontraditional and spectacular.  Open face with topped with the most wonderful creamy green chili sauce.  The portions for the appetizers were so big I did not order an entree.  Thank God!  My husband and friends could not finish their dinners although they tried.  I am really shocked at some of the reviews - maybe they were expecting typical NM food?  I really love this place.  When I am visiting Phoenix I will do my best to work in Dicks.  To the serves/tenders - guys you are fantastic.  Just keep doing what you do.

hpLUZ93kSoI765NORwsJfw.text: Thank goodness for Yelp, or we wouldn't have found this place. And when we did find it, it really is tiny like a hideaway as the name suggests. The brunch food was really good but super heavy and saucy. I had one of the benedicts with the smokey red chile sauce...it was good but i felt like i had lead in my stomach and i only got into about a quarter of the meal. My daughter's french toast was top notch -- legit crusty leftover bread made into pain perdu. YUM. One complaint and I know that they don't cater to the child-variety crowd but it would have been nice to order her something smaller, their french toast was Andre the Giant sized. I'd definitely be back but splitting an entree and drinking alot because if i recall they had a pretty rad brunch drink special.

2cwJKCwGg6w8__4MIVNAeg.text: Had the Tenderlion Benedict w/ out beans and it was delicious! The boyfriend had blueberry pancakes w/ bacon and eggs and it was a lot of food! Food was nice and hot, huge servings, we ate at a huge table with people we didn't know and it was pretty awesome! I love how unique this place is! I honestly feel like there is nothing in Arizona like it!

YDDhitAaYbLWa3YHLEDMdA.text: Amazing culinary experience!  Worth the effort to find it, you will not be disappointed!  Amazing food with fast and friendly wait staff! Be forewarned there isn't a sign hanging over the place, but it is a must find. Probably the best meal we had on our visit to Phoenix!!   Great beer and drink selection, you will not be disappointed!

6qOvxBmeh-KzKIJusGVByA.text: I am a visitor to Arizona and on my many trips here have been in search of great Mexican food - to no avail.    My sister and I ate at Dick's Hideaway (related to Richards Northern New Mexican Cuisine - just down the street).  We ate from the bar menu - a scaled down version of the regular menu and ordered the New Mexican Queso Dip, Rich's Skewer, and the Duck Relleno.  We also got a small sample of the Carne Adovada - the particular item that is Dick's Hideaway most favored dish.  Okay, there is great - along with good, and a few hits and misses.  The very best thing we ate was the queso.  Delicious!  Cohito cheese, onion, spinach, and chorizo with chips.  I've not had any queso like this anywhere and I am FROM Northern New Mexico.    (I found out that the owner of the restraunt lived in Santa Fe for awhile - which explains the "twists" on all his traditional NORTHERN New Mexican dishes.)  FYI - northern New Mexico food is very different from Mexico, California, Arizona, Texas, and southern New Mexican food.  Next we had the skewer - four meats on a skewer with; pork, beef, sausage, and shrimp.  All the meats were very good but the four sauces served with this meal made the dish a stand out.  The onion sauce and jalapeno hollandaise sauce were good but the Chipotle and tomatillo sauces were mouth watering!  Oh, and the New Mexican sausage was really good.  I really recommend it.  We ordered the Duck Relleno with Christmas (both red AND green chili sauces.)  Now here are some of the misses.    First strike was that the Relleno was breaded in panko crumbs and deep fried - big chili Relleno no no!  A Relleno should be dipped in egg white then pan-fried.  Many, many New Mexicans make this mistake too.  It's very hard to find a good Relleno in New Mexico too.   The duck tasted like turkey and after it came out of the fryer I couldn't tell it had any breading on it at all.  Although the green chili was delicious, the red chili was over salted and bitter - not good by anyone's description.  And lastly, the thing I looked forward to most was the Carne Adovada.  The Adovada had a smokey flavor (they smoke the meat) and it was sweet.  The smoke flavor was interesting but I just couldn't get past the sweet.  I can't like it.  New Mexican Adovada should be very rich in chili flavor and with a lingering bite to it.    The menu states the chili policy: You order it...you own it.  I found it very mild and anyone should be able to take the heat.  All in all, okay with some major misses.  Still looking for great Mexican food in Arizona.  Suggestions anyone?

qknGeNFIcvqKE-aHnYn2_Q.text: Carne Adovada Benedict & Bloody Mary's are delicious! They serve you a shot of beer with your Bloody Mary. Very small, Mom & Pop shop, great food.

DdKjdLQfSKP5bALd5MLcXg.text: Went for brunch on Sunday. The food was amazing. The vibe is very chill. Definitely want to try dinner!!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
