MBvKXm0rP2ZZiXxj2mU43g.text: Stopped by when in Tempe with someone who's been there a few times before, that's how we found it. Looks like a little hole in the wall but the food was amazing.  Got the New Mexican platter Christmas style to try a little bit of everything. The food was delicious and that platter was huge.  Washed it down with a few beers. Suggestion is to get there early for dinner because it will get packed and no seating quick.

MEzFSVXLK_Ia0nG8WMIuMA.text: It's been about a year since I've been here but it still stays very fresh in my mind.   The food is what stands out the most. It was unbelievably delicious. All the food i had was amazing but the Carne adovada was truly the best I've ever had. I will come back every time I'm near phoenix for this alone.   The service was friendly and quick.   The atmosphere is comfortable but only seats a small amount of people. the bar is where both drinks and food are made so there is always something to see.  just don't let the lack of a sign outside fool you.

HBJReqOFTKljqgQMTk9gaA.text: This place is awesome! The service was fabulous. Everyone was on point!! Can't wait to come back! Thanks for the wonderful experience!!!

wdL7-aWyapljJsn3ZmMgPA.text: New mexico chicken enchiladas. Maybe my favorite dinner of all time. Have a few ipas on draft. Trio of fish is also amazing.  Cozy dark environment. Perfect for not being seen!

iBTuIMApFs2r3_FZGNfEbw.text: 400th person to review this amazing establishment. Hat's off to the owner, the crew that works here and the amazing food!  I had the ever-so popular Carne Adovada Benedict. Words can't describe this dish. They've perfected it for sure. On point on key! MUST TRY!  I also was brave enough to order the Green Chile Cheese sliders. Brave I say because all this food I was prepared to take down. The C.A.B was enough but to add this was madness. (Mind you I ordered all this at the beginning). Those sliders definitely had a nip to them. 7/10 for those. But the C.A.B  was definitely a 9.5/10.  Go here, be amazed.   Cheers!

vZtEEAqg76UKy6iNqe7efQ.text: Tiny, hidden restaurant that delivers some top notch New Mexican cuisine.    Now I lived in New Mexico for 2 years and ate a ton of quality New Mexican food. It's been quite awhile since I had the good stuff, but then I stumbled in to Dick's hideaway and remembered what I'd been missing. Our table shared a bunch of different appetizers, each of which was delicious.   I went with the signature dish - Carne Adovada and was not disappointed. Way too much food for one person to eat, but I didn't mind trying.  If you love carnitas (Pork) you'll likely love this.  Additionally we got to sit in the side room that looks like a large wine cellar because we had a big party.  One thing to note, none of the bottles in the room are actually drinkable wines. They're just there for show and apparently left overs from when the original restaurant had a fire.   Service was good and attentive.  Overall cool atmosphere and quality food makes for a restaurant you should definitely visit when in the Phoenix area.

X34-bAM46eHn9QIw2Mun7A.text: A spot you can't really stumble upon without some prior planning, since it has no sign and is anonymously tucked behind a tiny entryway (copper doors with bars). So its pretty appropriate that you would need to do some research before arriving. Beyond just finding the place, you ought to be prepared (mentally, physically) and strategic about ordering.   My takeaways: The real draw are the appetizers here, which on their own are enough to feed a hungry crowd. 5 of us were stuffed after sharing two seriously awesome appetizers: The queso is swimming with fresh spinach and spicy pork sausage, and the garlic appetizer was a meal unto its own with garlic roasted to a smooth pulp, meant to be spread on bread and smothered with the platters-worth of roasted veggies, onions and melted cheese. Then comes the rest of the food, each person's order served basically on a similarly humongous tray lined with a toasted tortilla, and then loaded up with PILES of whatever the dish entailed, e.g. seemingly the whole side of a pig, lovingly braised but far too much for one person to even look at, plus a pint of beans, and equal amount of rice, eggs, potatoes, more tortilla, etc.  Whether you choose to prepare yourself accordingly, know this: no matter what you will probably still trundle away in a happy food coma for the next several hours.

TZW8FBkUYPfkwchnNvSeWw.text: Most amazing brunch i've ever had. There was a couple here who said best in AZ and they have been coming here for 20+ years.   Well they started us off on high expectations and DH delivered. Delivered completely.   The bartender/server here was very friendly and knowledgeable about their menu. Like the ins and outs of the menu. We asked for some recommendations and he said anything with the carne adovada is great. This was True.  My wife got the carne adovada benedict. I got the rellenos and eggs with red and green sauce. both of these dishes were amazing. My rellenos were/are perfect eggs were cooked amazingly. We watched the chef prepare our dishes and wow it was filled with anticipation of: "is that what i ordered? that looks soo good".  The carne adovada, like the server said was amazing. It was tender, delicious and delicious and delicious. I don't know how else to describe it. The meat was juicy, not dried out which lots of places have dry meat. the Egg to the benedict was perfect and runny. I've had some benedicts recently where they served it basically soft boiled and swear thats how its supposed to be.  Also the hollandaise was delicious. it was a perfect fit on this benedict. Really well made, even smooth texture. Yet  still rich (which is what you want).  This place is DARK! so older people be aware and sit somewhere with a light so you can see your menu. The room with the tables would be best for more lighting. I loved how dark it was. It really gave the place an old time feel. When you walk in your hit with a burst of a nice smokey smell from their wood fire grill. There is the bartop with a few high tops to sit at as well.  The backroom has three large tables which could accomodate a group of people. Definitely not a child friendly place if it was to be packed. I am not sure how crowded it gets, but by the taste of their brunch I am sure they get really packed. We went on a Thursday morning and there were only a handful of people there. It was a little bit busier by the time we left.   My recommendation. Sit at the bar/hightop area, its a better experience. Ask the server for his/her recommendations. sit back and relax.

vLdupGwmhf_90tzeQyhnTg.text: My standard question as a first timer in a new eatery - 'Is there anything on the menu that will change my life?'  At Dick's I can proudly say yes.   We went early on a Saturday - arrived at 7:30 am. We grabbed a table in the back room.  Nice, relaxed morning service. Great orange juice.  Carne Adovada burrito with 2 eggs over medium on top. So delicious!!  I will be back and will order the same for breakfast. My only caution is for those cautious of spicy food - ask for a taste before ordering. Loved it!

IAhBkOeTZoZYP38jVIpOaA.text: Dick's Hideaway is a True gem.  Located in a trendy mid town Phoenix location, this place offers a True dive vibe with exceptional food.  Going there on a Sunday early afternoon with a couple buddies, I was eager to see what this place was all about.    I'm pretty sure Jimmy Hoffa's body is easier to locate than this place, but once you do find it you're in for a treat.    It's small, but luckily we were able to get an open table right away.  The beer selection could be better, but I wasnt complaining.  I ordered a chorizo breakfast burrito with red chili sauce which was great in size and taste.  For only $5, was a gonga of a deal.    Highly recommend so get over there now!

5MvlBwEJUy1EFfA_aaI7Kg.text: Oh my Hidden away friend Dick's... You have halted my visitations to Richardson's and kept my mouth and gullet happy with your outstanding foodstuffs and tasty maragritas.  It's hard to explain the menu. A marriage of southern mexican, seafood, pizzas and quality.  The place is small, nay, cozy. with great music always playing.  and if you need a private party, the back room is a great bet.  I'd like to say I wish Dick's would stay hidden, because it is a gem, but it's too great not to share.

EQzFXuUA9mPTCDDSahR3DA.text: really liked this little gem in the middle of a seemingly" ghetto" strip mall...would have never found it if we weren't looking.  Went on a Fri nite- place was packed..and by place i mean they have 3 sit down tables and probably 8 spots at the bar.  Tiny Tiny Tiny..and rather loud- but great ambience.  Food was OUT OF THIS WORLD. I had the Taos Combo( special)- steak quesidilla, grilled shrimp and sausage....i know it sounds boring- but clearly i cannot remember all the wonderful details or it would sound a lot better..just know it tasted great.  We also ordered the Trio( chile relleno, tamale and chicken burro)- delicious..rice and beans also to die for.  Took half of it home as portion sizes were huge  - Very extensive and decent-priced wine selections also

XkUYMcDhXGfBIjReCK_Kbg.text: Yup, I came again on the eve of leaving Phoenix.  This time, we split the GRILLED SHRIMP (six bacon wrapped jumbo shrimp and four dipping sauces - very very tasty).  I ordered the MIXED GRILL (grilled tenderloin, lamb chops, and pork chops - the tenderloin and chops were cooked nicely, the pork chops were slightly over cooked, but the flavors were there).  To conclude, I had the FLAN which was light and tasty.

jJyDU64K4n8_0OCY905hHQ.text: DELICIOUS !!!  Very cool atmosphere, casual yet upscale, fun but not stuffy.  WONDERFUL food.  You have to try it.

HkhsHc1x7XHOHKtG68hGuQ.text: Hidaway is right!!!  Had to call to make sure "additional parking in the rear" was really the door. Asked my husband if he wanted to go in?   Was a little scary for the moment had a sign posted for a liquor license. We were both blown away by the aroma as we entered and time warped to the middle of Montana 1960's, maybe.  We sat at the bar and had an amazing appetizer dinner.  Was planning on getting a little something before we met our son for dinner at Houston's (sorry Houston's my husband ate all of his 6 scallops)  Yes, I said 6 blackened scallops which blows Eddie V's out of the water!  I can't wait to get back to Phoenix just to eat here!!!

sPAc7Z50I0JvFkcLmN3L6A.text: Overpriced, stuffy, smoky, and small.  I had the New Mexico Platter and wasns't at all impressed.  The chicken in the burrito was nasty and the only thing on the plate (out of five things) worth eating were the beans.  About sums up my opinion of the place

SqyPGcLb1aX0S08TKM63FQ.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said?   They weren't lying when they named it a hideaway.  I never would have known about it had an old roommate not taken me for lunch one day.  And now, it's my boyfriend's and my go-to spot.  My favorite is the chile rellenos (duck and pork with green sauce), although my boyfriend gets something different every time and is never disappointed.  The chiles are always spicy which I LOVE because nothing is ever spicy to me and this is one of the few places that has been able to make me reach for a glass of water.   It's a cozy place that almost reminds me of the inside of a hunting cabin that's been decorated up for fine dining.  They have a decent selection of wines and other bar items.  As far as seating goes, expect to wait for a bit unless you get lucky because it's a tiny "dining room".   All I can say is, "Go eat there!"  It's really amazing food and a really unique atmosphere.  Definitely worth the hunt.

HztmE7u3DFkiDD_6uWclig.text: Great place for weekend breakfast! The food is always delicious and I LOVE the smell of the wood oven.

Otmr8gElYTS_iTkO9IfnYw.text: i have been going to this place for years! and i love it.  not only is the food and atmospher amazing but the SERVERS are.    if it were not for servers like Amy, Sal, John, and Adam i probably would not be a regular.  these 4 remember your favorite drink and make dinning out great!   I was dissapointed to find out Amy was no longer with the hideaway back in april. :(  and WTF  i've watch a new hire(s) come and go since Amy left... and all i have to say is; what is managment thinking?   you are not hiring anyone who can compete with amy!   i feel personality is priceless and i'd rather be waited on by someone with a warm smile who is sincere versus someone who just needs a job because the economy is bad and they are desperate enough to wait tables.  Come on!   i really hope dicks hideaway starts seeing how amazing their staff is now and over time continues to maintain that quality.    as for now i will continue to to keep dicks hidaway my #1 place to eat and have a drink but if Sal, John, and Adam are gone... i guess i'll go find the new place they are working at.

MDlWzdMu8LH1KbZES-CoHA.text: What a great find!  A fantastic local hangout for a business lunch or to have an intimate dinner.  The atmosphere is perfect for escaping from the day to day routine.  It is truly a hideaway.    The, the food.  I love the carne asada with the spicy rice and beans with tortillas.  This is my favorite dish.  The meat is cooked perfectly each time with generous portions.  So far, everything I've tried has been very good and very welcome in the desert!

Xk-zsnjZHBCImR6YtwnLkw.text: I adore Dick's for breakfast/brunch. Oh!

afEkgVuA4Tbz5mUPleCY0g.text: I'm already craving Dick's Hideaway...and I had it less than a week ago!   The wait'll probably be long cuz this place is tiny, but it's so worth it. The ambience is kind of rustic but cool and the clientele is friendly, and you can always grab a drink while you're waiting. I tried the prickly pear margarita, which was just sweet enough and had a nice salty kick to it.   You'll expend your recommended caloric intake for the month, but it's so worth it.I had a special platter that included a mushroom tamale, smoked turkey relleno, carne adovado burrito and rice and beans. It easily could've fed three, but it was so delicious that I wanted it all for myself. Each item had a wonderful spicy kick to it, and my faves were the smoked turkey relleno (a lighter take on its cheese-filled cousin, and ten times more flavorful) and the carne adovado (tender pork studding a meaty, hearty sauce). I even liked the beans...and I HATE beans!   You'll ingest all kinds of carcinogens, but it's so worth it. I had some bites of the special mixed grill, which featured pork loin, steak and lamb chops. Each piece of meat was of good quality and was expertly prepared -- the lean yet juicy pork loin was my surprise favorite of the night. I never thought you could get an excellent burrito and excellent grilled meat in one place, but Dick's proved me wrong!  You'll start pheening for it as soon as you leave the parking lot, but it's so worth it. I would totally drive myself to LAX in traffic, buy a ticket to Phoenix, wait in the security line, sit through a flight, rent a car and drive to Dick's right now to have it for dinner...cuz it's SO WORTH IT!

xd576UXpOn-qhFujl8LGrw.text: Not my extreme favorite, but this place is good for a nice date or even a first date... Food was good...  I was there for a get together birthday party, I found it rather small for that type of event... but otherwise...good

rYBQc6P07oaGZdu7BQYh4g.text: This is the best breakfast in Phoenix and probably in the southwest! The filet mignon eggs Benedict is to die for. The rellenos are beyond perfect. U have to eat here!

O6Tv7UKRCD620YHeEj8DCg.text: This restaurant has some very tasty items, none of which contain its red, spicy sauce.  My boyfriend and I tried this place randomly since I moved to a new neighborhood.  We did take out and were glad when we some the small, crowded and warm interior.  It was dark and very tight.  Which is fine if that's your thing!  As a vegetarian, my options were limited, but that has never stopped me before.  I ordered the mushroom tamales.  They might be good with a different sauce, but apparently there are two options: meat, and really freaking spicy.  I couldn't even eat it.  It wasn't the tastes-good-underneath-the-pain kind of spicy, it tasted like some spice (paprika?) that just tasted like crap and pain.  I rarely dislike food, and almost never don't eat things, but those tamales were not happening.    We also ordered an order of toasted garlic, which was really, really good.  It came with way more bread than we could hope to eat.  Seriously amazing sauce, vegetables, garlic and I don't know what all else.    My boyfriend got the tomatillo toast, which sounded and looked amazing.  He said it was delicious, and we both want to give this place another try.  I am just staying far, far away from anything red and or spicy.

RqQE941ZQ74B_Baw3NIWrQ.text: The carne adovada was pretty good, as well as the chicken quesadilla.  No signs on the door, must find by street number which is clearly displayed.

7-wVkEGknfSOxRwJx9D1XA.text: Love this place.  Great drinks, both beer selection and wine list, and great happy hour.  Food was delicious, service fine, and very cool/small space.

U5nt9cbicO9Sx4KYtgNuvQ.text: We went on a Tuesday night and my friend and I shared the entire restaurant with two other people. Huge wine rack on one wall, candles on the tables and pillows on the booth seats. Portions were large and food was hot off the stove. I can see how the limited seating can fill up quickly though.

GwT10I4N7UQ4r05ZSxBvmQ.text: This place has amazing food! I have been so satisfied with my breakfast visits! Get the Carne Adovada and eggs it is the best!

R4QoIEMzwRZbs3ZF5in6YQ.text: This place is seriously ... hidden away. It took a while for me to figure out where it is (just park in the lot and go from there). Arrived here late on a Friday night and we were able to be seated immediately (it was like 11pm). I chose the place because of the high reviews, unique menu and late kitchen hours, and it did NOT disappoint. HUGE portion sizes. Shared a queso, tomatillo toast and I think a relleno platter. My fave was the queso. The ambiance was fantastic, there was even a huge private room that made me wish I lived in the area so I could have a big birthday bash here. Recommend!

Vbm40EqPIaYotSF_K7pAyQ.text: This is the best New Mexican cuisine in Phoenix.  If you've never tried New Mexican, you must try Dick's.  If you love New Mexican and you have not tried Dick's, you must!  It's that good, trust me!

r9FzsBow_7kgupSbFDpUVA.text: On a scale of 1 to 10 let's give them an 11. We've been coming here for about 6 years. Too many great menu items to mention. Try to avoid Saturday evening. Very busy.

HoSI7GDwQkCYae52t10ILg.text: Traveled to Phoenix on a work trip last month and a work colleague highly recommended I give Dick's a try.  Took a bit of searching to find the place - no sign (get it, hideaway).  Once we made it in it was well worth the effort.  Started with a spicy pepper appetizer and went with the Enchilada platter for my main course.  The mix of sauces allowed you to pick from mild to wild and I opted for wild.  Dish was great and selection of cold beers took experience over the top.  Looking forward to my next visit.

J5yILMJN-dgloCE_9UxtSw.text: Great little gem! Super friendly staff, food is fantastic. They make you feel very welcomed, good place to visit!

3-9b8-WUb1xkRjFWfUiZzQ.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant. I go in often (at least once a week) and I always order the New Mexican platter- all of their food is AMAZING. I've brought friends, colleagues, family, and we have never ordered anything we don't LOVE. The service is awesome too- Doug took care of me today but every time I come in they are on point. This place is THE place. Thanks Dick's Hideaway and thank you Doug :)

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Heaven in your mouth anyone?
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CQug14FjT-_uH3651vE8fA.text: This place is not only super cool but the food... It was all incredible! Bacon wrapped shrimp was delish, enchiladas were amazing, and whatever pork thing my husband had was Smokey and yumm! Thought not getting any chips and salsa was odd, but once you get your meal you don't care any more. Big portions which is good because it is a little pricey. Well worth the money though!

7qjaGM0y2vkI6n4jdnZE5Q.text: Oh my happy hour in the morning after my long night shift . This warm, friendly neighborhood bar/restaurant always makes me feel better.Food is so delicious and service attentive. Always take my out of town friends here!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xRWUvJxgQuqDNzSBSxdYPg.text: Fantastic ambiance... Hidden gem to say the least... Fabulous food. Great service...

N5FJ5nJI7gJsW6IFsxlzAQ.text: In Phoenix when a restaurant markets its name with recipes of New Mexico certain comforts are expected. Especially if its competition is around every corner. My party patiently waited on warm fresh chips and crafted salsa to be delivered but never arrived. You get what you ordered and the experience is over. We have experienced better in Phoenix because there is.

S0iKrHZJBzmuRVV6x5z4_Q.text: I actually look for reasons to be in this area of town to have an excuse to go eat here.  Love all of the Benedict's!   The wood fired grill makes the tenderloin amazing and the Adovada is the best I've ever had.

hHVr6m1GabDkwZo4L3jerw.text: This place lives up to its name in trying to find it.  But I called and was given specific directions.  No lighted sign out front.   Once we found it we were able to pick seats and were promptly served by a nice gentleman named Joel.  The drinks were great, but the food was AMAZING.   And reasonably priced.  Not cheap, but not much more than chain restaurants.  I highly recommend for a great night out with family, friends, or date night.

OtagDfjaAfC439Fd14uC9g.text: I have been coming here for years, and it has stayed consistent with food and service! The ambiance is something really special. They have so many wonderful choices for food. LOVE this place!!

4euyTLCaPdr2wGspGknuRQ.text: The food here is amazing!  The service has never been an issue for me either!  They have a great list of wine and beer to choose from as well.  Breakfast lunch and dinner are al equally as good. If I think their appetizers are good. Would recommend for a date or something intimate with your close friends.

cBCGT8IAmhxbJoVpsxxCfA.text: Probably my favorite place in Phoenix. The adobada is absolutely to die for. Seriously, they hand carve it fresh everyday and I have never been disappointed. They have this half price happy hour thing on the weekends from 3-6 that makes it all worth it. I bring every visitor that has ever come to town here. Plus!!!! It's a secret! No sign outside makes it that much better.

Zj2K3yKjRZ3katRiUuoFXw.text: Seriously my favorite restaurant in phoenix and I've lived here for a decade. Great food, cool culture, great service and fun people.   I seriously recommend going here if you like Southwestern food and don't have kids. Not a great place for kids, too small and it's more adult atmosphere.

cB-SzLev1rq-SdDcr1enUQ.text: We decided to try this place out after reading all the great brunch reviews. The food was great- we had the Tenderloin Benedict and Carne Avodaba (sp?) Benedict. Both were great. I will say I'm not a big meat and potatoes person and there weren't many options I wanted, but I did enjoy the dish I had even though it wasn't what I typically would order. Anyway, the food was good and the service was okay. Our waitress was super nice but the food took about an hour to come out, which was annoying.   The weird part was, I had to go to the bathroom, which was located inside the kitchen- they only have one bathroom and you have to walk through the kitchen to get to it. So, I was walking back and I see and hear the owner literally full-on rage screaming at a group of employees. He was walking toward the same end of the kitchen I was going to and he was yelling "NOBODY F*CKING LISTENS TO ME!" Literally veins popping out of his neck and yelling SO loud. He definitely saw me and I felt super uncomfortable because of how loud and aggressively he was yelling at these workers. I felt so bad for them.   Anyway, the end of the meal comes and our waitress informs us the owner has taken care of our food and drinks. She doesn't give us a reason why- I mean, obviously it was because I saw him behaving that way. It would have been okay if he had come out and apologized, said he was taking care of our food, etc. but he did not make an appearance outside of the kitchen for the rest of the time we were there. So, it feels like he tried to pay us off or something- just a sketchy vibe. We won't be back- I definitely am not going to support a business where the owner treats his employees that way.

zvj25gsRbeuO7dJAZezgbA.text: I've always thought the world of this place, almost entirely because of the staff. However, walked in earlier this week and not one regular bartender or waitress.  New people, did not know the menu etc.  To make it worse I see one of those people at a place in Scottsdale before a spring training game. She says she got let go, and misses all of her regulars etc.. not surprising, she was super busy and waiting on a lot of people.  So, no need to go back there.  I don't think I could tell you the name of a manager or owner, I certainly wouldn't recognize them, but I sure do know the people that made that place great, can't imagine who would let a bunch of them go. Food was still pretty darn good, but the atmosphere was bad, service even worse.  On to one of the 300 new restaurants in this town, sorry to see Dicks go...

-O8YrEuPLGsfib0hgA-YkQ.text: As New Mexicans we are constantly on the hunt for good red and green chile.  Dick's did not disappoint.  Oh, and the tortillas...  So good.  The communal seating seemed weird at first but turned out to be delightful.  We'll definitely be back!

RqeS-5BsQys3wGIp5SU5hg.text: Great food and great fun sitting at the bar watching it be made. Its a popular and the wait is long, but still worth the strong drinks and delicious food.

QSYT6mHs4EkX0ACty3Gl7A.text: Great Sunday brunch in the north dining room  looks like a wine cellar with big community table , a booth & long table by beehive fireplace . Everyone loved the New Mexican style Benedict's & combos I had a great burger & fries called Rokerij Smoked in Dutch with bacon & more. The Bloody Mary was good too. Doug our server & staff very professional , friendly thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dicks hideaway
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cozy fire rare in phoenix
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rokerij burger

tYxtOMwhWqO65iWuw7DQ-Q.text: I've lived in the valley for a couple of years now, and have a couple of locals I trust to give me good advice on where to find great food with a cool atmosphere.    They didn't steer me wrong on this one.    Hidden in the middle of plain sight;  This is the place.   We tried the happy hour menu.   Really good food,  and a selection of spirits that would appeal to any taste.      The New Mexican Con Queso was on point as an appetizer.  Even the house tacos were good.   The food was great.    It was an indication of what they'd bring out as an entree.      I don't get the vibe that dicks is trying to the appeal to the masses;   they're just trying to appeal to the right person.     I'm a fan.   I'll be back.

YqwxmoN2VANr3Sv-LNRCtA.text: What do you do when your early Sunday spin class gets canceled? DICK'S!!!  Breakfast was in a word....EPICurean  Huge portions (Midwestern / Burrito)....perfectly prepared...REAL Hash Browns...killer meats (bacon, sausage, ham steak)...and the greatest 70s chill rock playlist.   If I was boozin - full bar available.   And to make it 5 stars...GREAT service from pros who manage the tight quarters with calm and coolness.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast Burrito / Has Browns / Bloody Mary
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Midwestern / Hash Browns

tsAKc5R5lj60ZsamV_GzoA.text: I have to give a poor review for Dick's this last time we went and it's sad given the last two times we went to Rokerij and enjoyed our time there. First some of the positive notes of our dining experience:   Good happy hour with 6 dollar good wine pours that were very generous.   Good ambiance and mood in that it's not overly loud so you can hear your company.   Nice seating area in the partition of the restaurant where you can have a large group gathering or be in a half circle booth of four guests amidst adobe style walls and lit candles.   The calamari is always excellent (minus the sweet and sour which doesn't complement) and prob one of the best I've had in Arizona.   The wait staff is responsive and friendly.   Then the reason for my less positive review is...we had really bad stomach issues after last eating there. We weren't sure what we had but we suspect it was the red chili pork sliders that weren't on the menu but that the waiter recommended (which were quite expensive by the way ) when we asked for a recommendation for something with NM red chili. They weren't particularly spicy but they were way too salty and lacked much other distinct flavor. We didn't event finish all three sliders but think we had bad pork or else something that was dirty because we had a horrible evening and morning.   While the waiter was nice he seemed a bit detached or distracted from the experience and didn't seem all too confident on making a recommendation when we asked. Nor was very informative when asked other questions about the wine and spirits.   We knew about the menu and the steep prices from being at Rokerij but before we never really tried any of the main dishes or meats and this time we had hoped to be wowed by something with red chili or green chili but unfortunately we are now very wary of going back.

qNNZs6VBVkovgJf-WP2d8Q.text: My go to place Restaurant when I am in Phoenix.  I love all three of their restaurants.  The others are close by. Simulate menus.  But this is where I feel totally at home. Awesome ambiance all day and night.  Dim lights and good music piped in. I had the calamari and ribs,  It is my all time favorite calamari.  The tenderloin and brie toast points are so darn delicious too.  So many brunch items and the portion are as amazing as the taste.  That speaks volumes in my book!

Vu26Juq7c2tGoY8j5UUosQ.text: Parking is available in the front and there's more in the back. There's no sign, but there are menus with their signature coyote hanging on them. Enter the door right next to the menu.  The restaurant is pretty small and all I saw were couples there. I was with family and we felt a bit out of place so maybe take a date here.  The restrooms are straight down all the way in the back of the restaurant. The restaurant feels more like a hallway then anything else.  There are funny signs and sayings throughout so have fun looking for them, one is, "No Kardashians Allowed."  As for the food, fantastic! We ordered the Pasta Heidi which was al dente linguine with grilled chicken and a very generous amount of chipotle cream sauce. I asked the waiter if this was owned by Rokerij since I remember them having the same signature coyote and he said Richardson's which is right next to Rokerij owns Rokerij and Dick's Hideaway. I also asked if they share the same menu and he said Richardson's and Dick's Hideaway actually serve the same dishes but Rokerij has a unique menu.  You can also rent half of the restaurant for an event just make sure to call ahead of time to reserve it.  Neat place for a date. Dim, almost dark with just candle light. A cute little spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The menu, great humor.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The entrance.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Pasta Heidi - chipotle cream sauce, grilled chicken, and linguine.

vxIz9qkcsUdQ6_OwV_Ir8g.text: Amazing brunch! The Carne Adovada Eggs Benedict was outstanding. It had a jalapeno hollandaise sauce on top. Each entree had enough food for at least two meals! Best New Mexican food around.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Adovada Eggs Benedict

CKF7dDs4vu-wQhVT5zORMw.text: House made Bloodies with baby beers for $6 bucks. Need I write anything else to justify the 5stars? Have been 3 times for breakfast/brunch... Everything is delicious. The Vic's meatloaf and eggs is a good pic. The Richardson combo made us realize we really love the chicken enchiladas! Finally, I suggest the green chili stew... you can ask for corn tortillas on the side instead of the standard flour if you are gluten free.

rSrSEqxd6zrM4dT11feU1g.text: This place is amazing love the atmosphere and decor , stopped by  a Few days ago to have the carne adovada Benedict was amazing a huge portions , still trying to find a place like this in Vegas with the New Mexican cuisine have a few places like this in Phoenix/ East Valley  region.

Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing image better flavor

J2lNhgWO195dAeTXoYt1xg.text: I was excited to give this place a try when a friend of mine recommended it to me. Upon getting there, we were able to sit down right away. However, after receiving menus and water, (the water cups smelled really bad, like they had not been cleaned properly.) our waitress never came back to take our orders. She continued to talk to some people at the bar and walk past us. This place is small, so it's easy to spot when menus have been on a table for a long time. After waiting for about thirty minutes we decided to get food elsewhere.   I'm only basing my rating off of service since we weren't able to try the food.

hAh4NcXDZ46cd4kU7wtCaQ.text: Well played Dick!  We didn't find you this time but we think we know where you are.  No sign except for "additional parking in rear", and next to the hippie restaurant.  We will be back!

mwQKDs2sHoX6bNm1L5MPMA.text: I tried out the place given all the highly rated reviews. The ambiance was good, service was good since it wasn't very busy. My eggs benedict was a good dish until I saw a cockroach crawling around my plate. I completely lost my appetite after. I don't think I will be back there. I would check their health code ratings before visiting.

xsfZhRwSCFIBD_5kThrkXg.text: Awesome Bloody Mary. The menu looks delicious. Can't wait to come back and try some food. Great open atmosphere

ttHXVCPKAKRxD-6m0I7j8g.text: Not only is this restaurant somewhat difficult to find, it also leaves a lot to be desired. We came in at around 4pm on a Saturday, the place had this dark moody lighting which would have been nice for an intimate setting but most of the seating was cramped or communal. The candles situated through out the establishment were a lovely touch but the bombardment of flies and gnats took away from the mood they created.  We were basically told to sit wherever we could find seating so ended up sitting in the back near a large group who were uncomfortably sitting in an L shaped booth which allowed almost zero communication between them.  Serves didnt really seem to have established tables, as we were served by three different people during our visit. All were nice is a bit flustered. We both ordered local beers they had on tap which were nice and cold and the food came out hot but thats about all I could say of it.  For $15 a plate, we definitely expected more. The food ranged from bland and tasteless to just unappealing, even for New Mexican style dishes I expected more. The insects wanted our plates more than we did. We ended up barely eating half our plates and just throwing the rest away.  I would say this place could be nice to stop in for a drink and a small meal, as we saw a couple clearly enjoying their date. And apparently their steak is quite good from what a fellow patron said. But all in all we will not be returning.

Y01X-rj7ZwhwM_3AQtd9WA.text: Love this place. It's right down the street from me so I need not drive far. Love that their hours, opened at 7am bright and early serving their usual lunch/dinner menu and their awesome breakfast plates til 4pm. Food is always spectacular. Tastes as good as it smells. It's awesome to see the cooks cook/prepare your meal in front of you if you choose to dine at the bar. Pricey, but the portion sizes are substantial and you do get what you pay for in terms of quality and taste. Big selection on wines too. My only complaint is that the serving staff/bartenders are very warm and chatty with regulars, which I don't mind or think that's a bad thing. It's just that people who frequent the place will see delays in service such as wait longer for requests or even for their check. I'm never in a rush when I come here simply its expected. Which that itself is not a good thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The rokerj burger with o-rings
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuesday morning mimosa on a day rain stormy day off :)

_e_IwxcpwVW98h6Pc23vSw.text: Came on Tuesday night for the first time.  Our in-laws were in town from Texas and wanted good Mexican Food.  The place is small and does not make reservations.  Luckily we arrived at a good time and did not have to wait.   Ordered the shrimp app and stuffed jalepeno app.  Beware the jalepeno is spicy!! The shrimp was very good.    Where it went South was the fact that none of us ate what we originally ordered.  My husband and I shared the Chile Relleno.  It's definitely on the greasy side.  You get a choice of green or red sauce.  Our waitress did not warn us that the red sauce very spicy.  Had we known we would have stuck to green sauce.  You get choice of two so I ordered the cheese and my husband ordered the beef.  My mother and sister n law also shared the chile relleno.  One got duck and the other got Pork.  I do not eat meat.  When we first received our meals, my mother n law asked the waitress if she had the wrong meal because hers just had cheese inside.  The waitress insisted that there was meat inside it was just surrounded by the cheese.  The waitress while nice, was overly cocky in the sense that we were wrong and she was right.  Finally my mother n law told her, there is no meat in hers.  I then noticed that there was meat at the end of mine.  I had been picking just the cheese and thought that the meat was a spillover from my fiances.  The waitress argued back and forth with me that what I was eating was the beef.  I know what beef looks like.  Either way the fact is she mixed up our meals.  Regardless, I had been eating the duck, my fiance the pork, and my mother n law had no meat.  No one was eating what they had ordered! The one most mortified was myself as I do not eat duck or pork EVER! The waitress apologized and asked if she could get us a new order. At this point we had eaten enough and had all lost our appetites.  Our entire meal was all trying to figure out who had what because nothing looked right.     Pretty disappointing that the waitress did nothing to compensate our meal, we paid over $100 full price for all meals we did not order nor wanted.   We don't plan on returning again.

WfMhZ7Iov1I2JPGybHj7Tw.text: You actually enter the restaurant through unmarked doors. The only clue that you are entering the right place are a couple of menus posted on the wall next to the door.  Although this place is extremely small and hidden, it's conveniently located on Bethany home Road and 16th St. - Dicks hideaway offers an authentic New Mexican dining experience.   Last night was a business function for 23 guests. I was amazed they all found their way to this restaurant. Immediately upon opening the front door, there was another secret door to the right. That was our private room. Nicely decorated with copper table tops and old wine bottles as decoration,  our room was small but extremely comfortable. We even had our own  private lavatory.    We ordered up some appetizers and the staff served the group beer, wine and cocktails to get this function going.Foodies in the group appreciated the fresh bold flavors of New Mexican appetizers. The main course platters were huge. I had the pork chop stuffed with chorizo sausage.  It was served on a bed of assorted vegetables. Even for the large group, there were numerous choices of sumptuous entrees on the menu. The staff and our server get a 10 out of 10 rating. Outstanding! The woman that served us knew our names and our drinks and she made the group feel like we were her personal friends - or even better yet, guests in her home.  For attentive service in an intimate setting with high quality New Mexican cuisine, this is a wonderful secret spot for a unique group dinner event - a  total hit!  Salute!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chops with chorizo sausage
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scallops as an appetizer or a main course
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tenderloin steak

heavO1XO28Cc_Z0mX5G-fg.text: FREAKING AWESOME!!!  Was in town for 4 nights, ate dinner here twice.  Come Hungry. Order anything that is smothered in green or red chili. Pork Adovado and Green Chile Mole Pork...wow...melt in your mouth flavor bomb! Great burger covered in a roasted hatch green chili and cheese.  A chicken, cheese, green chili and ham (wow this ham) appetizer that was enough for 3 people. Damn! Dani and Lauren behind the bar run the show, be nice to them!  =)  And let them make you an Old Fashioned to go along with their beer and wine. One of the best examples of a "Dive Bar" with killer food I have encountered in 25 years of travel and grub. Just go!

m0jnceLzjVZPyLMg-cN1Yw.text: Tried Dick's Hideaway this evening with my son And hubby.  Didn't earn 5 stars this evening due to not great service. Our waiter was not attentive and didn't go over the specials and menu. Be prepared to spend a few big bucks here, a bit on the spendy side!  The Roasted Garlic Plate was ginormous, for $16.00, It will definitely feed a large party. For our little party of three, it was too much, it actually filled me up, and I couldn't eat my dinner. No self control when it comes to yummy roasted elephant garlic, cheesy roasted peppers, and grilled bread! It was delicious. I asked our waiter for a side of balsamic, he nodded, and I never saw him again, until he delivered our entree's, another miss by our waiter. We also ordered the bacon wrapped jalapeno, it was awesome, but be aware it's spicy, which I love, so that was a good thing, however if you're not a spice lover, this one is HOT!  I ordered the Burger, it looked delicious, I seriously couldn't take one bite, the appetizers did me in. My hubby got the Sandia Chicken, the chicken was great, but the green chili linguini that accompanied the dish, was not good. It tasted like raw flour and had s weird texture. My son order the garlic shrimp pasta, he enjoyed it, but the pasta was off in this dish too. For $31.00, it could be a lot better.  We didn't order wine this evening, but their wine list is phenomenal! On our way out, we saw a glimpse of the dining area with the wine cellar, it would of been nice to sit in there!  I will most likely be back, especially for the appetizers and wine!, I'm still put off with the service, and being seated next to a loud party, in the upper level, the sitting arrangement is a bit tight and awkward. With the "steakhouse" menu prices, I was hoping for better service and dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BjuaA1tNSYGs9CwpFW2LPg.text: We really like this place and are regulars.  We went today with two other friends. Our waitress was really rude when I asked her to split the bill. She said she can not do that because they are really busy, in a very unpleasant tone. Our friends thought we are crazy to accept that kind of service and kept going back. It was awkward since we kept telling them how good this place is.   Th waitress mixed up our orders before. We didn't think it was a big deal. However, today was a new record of how rude she was.

hG8G2OCLNq-m7v_49VQHGA.text: This place really is a hideaway! Hard to find and with no sign, just a menu posted next to a door. Best kept secret in Phoenix. Been here several times now, and love it more every visit. It is small, dark and cozy inside...with some of the most amazing southwest and New Mexico style food. They have a full bar, happy hour food and drink specials, and open late! I always get the New Mexico Enchiladas, and the Carne Adovada. INCREDIBLE! Their red and green sauce are to die for! Daily specials also available...just check the board. I can't say enough good things about it. Give it a try and you'll see what I mean. The place is small, so get there early, and parking is ample...located in a small strip mall. See you there! :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New Mexico Enchiladas - one shrimp, carne adovada, and smoked turkey, covered in red and green sauce  Amazing!!

7rVc7gP2XaJwVy5Qhl3rag.text: I am imagining that there is a great chef behind the scenes due to the number of specials and caliber of the food and combinations.  I had salmon with the awesome mix of asparagus, corn and wonderful sauce.  It was so delicious.  The platter had tons of asparagus, and the salmon portion was large, so no skimping here!  I will definitely go back when in town.  Tiny place, but packs a punch!  I went here with some friends on a Sat night and somehow the wait was only about 15 mins??  There is really no place to wait, so we stood in the doorway and had our drinks.  It worked out.  Anyway, the menu was mostly seafood and there were tons of specials for the evening.   Ambiance is on the dark side and pretty loud.

tB7DqRzDNZKi0YlxzLPaDg.text: If you can find it this place is amazing.  Love their breakfast and dinner are amazing.  Shawn is an awesome server and dealt well with our large drunk group! Love this place!

LZ6infjJ6UVWQHjxftTYVA.text: Probably my favorite breakfast spot. Depending on my mood, this is how it's done, eggs are either over easy or poached: Shrimp enchiladas -- red and green chile Huevos Rancheros  -- red and green chile Carne Adovada  -- red only   Lately, it's been a lot of enchilada, though I feel the huevos rancheros starting a resurgence!  Breakfast entrees are about $10 -12 and worth every penny.

oNAzWs_E4kKf2Ng9n6d9tw.text: Very cool place! Cozy, laid back. Excellent food! Friendly patrons and super sweet staff! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

v3A5pRJ7yup-xeEyL0gIpA.text: We had trouble finding this place, but man was it worth it. Talk about a mans-man kind of spot. There is no sign, there's a random wooden door with a joke about stray children on it. When you walk in, a waft of smoked meat hits you. You see the grill, the full prohibition style bar, the huge bar level bucket of ice containing bottles of beer, it was a lot to take in.   The food--excellent. It was hardy, large portions, perfect for taking men out for brunch and having them feel full. It's a meat-driven menu, but there is a lot of options including scrambled eggs and pancakes for the less adventurous. Definitely a locals only spot we infiltrated.   We sat at the bar since there were only 4 tables in the bar area, which only improved the experience. We talked with the owner, saw the meat turn and met strangers over mimosas. Great joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bar

9v9VZnaiC_wGqsO-xTowRg.text: Food is amazing.  Very small hole in the wall restaurant.  Can't wait to go back.

M7F72dKSdf4PzK5eyQWilg.text: This has to be one of my favorite restaurants in the valley. If you haven't gone, grab your car keys and go! (You can look at the menu in all good time, but trust me just order the roasted garlic plate as soon as you sit down. It's amazing!)  I've moved out of the neighborhood, so now this is a rare treat reserved for when I'm in the area. Oh happy day! A meeting in the general proximity so I called in a lunch order. George is an expected part of my visits, so seeing him felt like everything was right in the world. :) I grab my to go order, cruise the 20 minutes back to my office just to find my much anticipated Chimayo Chicken with a green chili pepper are no where to be found. I am sure maybe the Sante Fe chicken is amazing fresh from the kitchen, But by the time I had it, it was cold fries and broken hollandaise. That's hard to come back from. Everything there is amazing so if you like sort of a plain Jane menu pick, I bet this is totally an acceptable option.  Feeling bad for calling at 12:15 (and apologizing for the terrible timing) but worse about my lack of lunch satisfaction I let them know there was a mix up and that I'm in no position to come back. The gal on the phone said the order got rung in correctly but the kitchen made it wrong. She was super apologetic and said they'd waive the charge on my card. So while I'm still bummed because that Chimayo chicken is so amazing, and I'm totally jonesing for it, they tried to do what they could. I thought maybe an offer of a free desert to entice me to come back was the most I could expect (assuming they even have desert?). I'll be back, baby! Thanks for handling it so graciously. I would also recommend any of their salad specials, Tomatillo Toast, Eggs Benedict, turkey relleno and carne adovada. Some think their food is hot, I think it's just right. :) Their wine by the glass is fantastically priced for the selection they offer.  Mmm did you remember about the garlic plate??

HtZmTVefKvOm2wZj_bh9Lg.text: This place is so great! I love that it really is "hidden". The ambience was great, the service was great, I could go on and on. The worst part of my experience? Having to choose what to order because everything looked amazing on the menu! We were there for brunch and it was absolutely delicious! I highly recommend this place!

SBQZC_EO_QqUr43tXrQ0hQ.text: Went here with a friend and it's the tiniest little place and so adorable. Not a lot of arm room or seats available but my friend and I got lucky and for some reason there wasn't a wait and it wasn't busy at all.  We got in, ordered our delicious Mexican food and sat and talked for hours without being kicked out.  The only down side is I got something pretty simple and our bill was really expensive.  Good food but I'm not sure I'll frequent this place that often, maybe a few times a year if even that.

xVbzbg6z1P0LibyjZuTYNA.text: This was such a pleasant surprise. Amazing service and fabulous happy hour deals made it a great experience. Lots of places have happy hours that have all these exceptions and are still expensive, but the deals are real good here. You can get a burger with fries and a craft beer for $10 - I've been other places recently and paid $7 for the same exact beer. Loved the ambiance at Dick's Hideaway as well and will definitely be back. It seems like a pretty small place so I'm curious tonsure how busy it gets during brunch times.

mEHc4IGsBwkqy9sR03CCxA.text: The place is very very small, food was okay but definitely overpriced. They don't even separate checks here so it was quite the hassle at my table.. I wouldn't come back.

irg3yNyHnVrEWXg2HBLYgQ.text: Simply delicious. I have been wanting to try this place for quite a while and I am happy I finally did. It's easy to miss this restaurant as there is no signage on the outside, the interior is pretty dark, and there are about 3 tables and a small bar to sit at. However, the staff is great and the food is amazing. I ordered the carne adovada, Christmas style w/ fried eggs. It was divine. My wife ordered the swordfish special and it was also delicious. We both ate about 1/2 of our meals because of the humongous serving size. This place is now permanently bookmarked for me. It's awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Swordfish special, delicious
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Adovado w/ fried egg, Christmas Style

SHyOvFIkjDKvp5MjSiaCrg.text: I had the grilled shrimp, the enchiladas, and the sliders. Nothing really blew me away and although I asked for spicy, it wasn't. The shrimp was the best.   It was also really hard to find and was not on the corner like the directions said.

9FaiQTVfj-VuAQWIKY2mxw.text: One of my favorite places for Brunch. Excellent food...really fun to sit and eat  at the bar overlooking the grills where all the food is prepared. It's dark inside and a small area but quite cozy and comfortable. It really does feel like a "hideaway".

3FLKZr69q9w3rprQJWNV5g.text: The place has no sign, was absolutely full of customers, has a respectable wine and beer list, serves fantastic enchiladas, and the staff KNOW service! Both thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4EgivQ1gPBA9MSjCLfvKHA.text: A True hole in the wall restaurant with some of the best Southwestern fare you can get in the Valley.  You'd be doing yourself a disservice if you didn't at least try this place once!  There's something to be said about the parking and spacing in the restaurant, but on purely a food basis, it's a winner.   I could write an encyclopedia raving about this place, but I'll let you all be the judge of that.  Instead, I'll list a few things of importance (to me), and therefore probably should be to you as well:  - It smells really good in here. As in, you will leave the place smelling like cedar and smoked meat, and want to eat your own arm  - Get anything with adovada...the meat that's marinated in this stuff sits forever and, stewed up, makes me want to cry   - Vic's meatloaf with green and red chili  - Fantastic Bloody Mary's and a shot of ale to balance it out (it's got a kick)

qeR7tkYX3a6aGf4_8AIztw.text: The name says it all, it is a hideaway for sure but worth it to find. No signs what so ever, just look for the busy parking lot. The food portions are huge and delicious. Try the Bloody Mary!

UiojqLmfD7-QziVFyYWa1w.text: Really good carne adovada but the restroom had water all over the floor and my dad slipped and fell which resulted in a badly bruised up knee. So watch yourself going through their kitchen into a slippery bathroom.

Yyz3aq2pk9foe4F9ZU8QiQ.text: Great food. They cook in front of you using peacon wood for a superb taste. Great wine list too. Service is good.

Sb_8Xja-IQe36CHd7SHHtw.text: Smoke pork is awesome, great breaktfast and happy hour menu, very friendly staff...GO!

9MT-t3tDbyIBT46DbWhWyw.text: What can I say that hasn't been said.  We tried this place based on Yelp reviews.  It was so good we came back the next day for happy hour.  First breakfast:  I had the chile rellenos platter.  You have a choice of fillings.  I chose cheese and the a choice of red or green chile sauce.  I chose both.  Loved them both for different flavors.  Hubby had huevos rancheros.  Also excellent.  I ordered a Bloody Mary which was seasoned perfectly and it came with a beer back which I've never had before but they fit together perfectly.  We came back the next day for happy hour (7 days a week) and had the small plates.  Very tasty and easy on the wallet.  The bartenders are very nice, make you feel welcome and take care of your every need.  This  place is not for everyone.  It really is hidden away ( no exterior sign).  Inside is dark and kinda seedy looking but I think it adds to its charm.  On second thought, don't go here.  I want to make sure there's room for me on the bar stool.

bZCRyTdjGW91bV1YYyZrXA.text: The major 'issue' with Dick's Hideaway/Richardson's is that no matter what you order, you're missing out on what you didn't order!! You're screwed regardless. So what to do?? My best answer is to keep going back each day/weekend/whatever, and ordering something different each time. "YOU CAN'T GET IT WRONG!!" My daughter and I just had Sunday brunch with drinks. After going insane trying to figure what dish to have, I chose the french toast, egg and sausage meal. She had the steak and egg meal, i.e. poached egg. Both meals, to die for ... The staff was, as always, very courteous. Though still full from the meal, as I write this review, I'm salivating about what (different) I'll be ordering next Sunday/weekend/whatever.

E40MMHZFOlCVxMy1gEbAIw.text: Customer service makes or breaks a business!  I cant help but create a yelp account because of the service we received tonight.  Our server (short blonde lady) treated us like we never exusted.  Took our order...i ordered a diet coke and burrito with no beans...she gave me regular coke and my burrito was floating in beans.  I was dying of thirst but no one ever came to ask if i needed a refill.  She didnt come back to our table until she probably saw we were done with our food!  By then, you can barely appreciate the food youre eating and ruins your impression of this place rated at 4.5 stars. Place is pretty pricey for burritos and enchiladas...i dont mind the price...willing to pay for more if the service and if pehaps the food was to my taste...we still gave her 20% tip but please, fire that lady.  I just wrote a review on tripadvisor and read obe other comment where customer also complained about nothing else but the service!

jIK1kVh0IMZr_l-EP8mLTA.text: I will start this review by saying the name is very appropriate. This place is hidden. There is no sign on anything. After circling the parking lot a few times we finally called and we found it it was right next to the ace harware. As we walked in, I was instantly impressed. A very small spot where the bar doubles as the kitchen. The wood fired grill makes the whole place smell good and gives it the cozy vibe. They play great music, make strong drinks and have amazing food. I have ordered a bunch of different items and they all are great. I reccomend going with enchiladas  or pretty much anything on the menu. Beware though as the food always comes out extremely hot. Also, get there early as this place is tiny and fills up fast. The food is worth the wait for sure though. It also appears that they have a pretty good happy hour.

B3apx0yVoSbzER0KW1KkJg.text: It's hidden away indeed! When we finally found Dick's Hideaway, I wished I would have done so YEARS AGO. I've been missing out all these years, on absolute GOODNESS. The "Pasta Heidi" is a dish that will likely NEVER be knocked from my "top 10 favorite foods list". It is MY-OH-MY GOOD! The ambiance is absolute perfection. Rustic yet polished. YES, it is teeny-tiny BUT we were there early on a weeknight & sat in the bar area and there were still tables available long after we arrived. Photos & more here: monkeywonderland.com/blo...

zDWDvnSW7g5RGbc-1isqFQ.text: I gave this place 2 stars here's why service WAS HORRIBLE. It was our first time here and I can say I'm not impressed. Our waiter was not personable at all. He didn't great us with a smile or even tell us his name. I felt like he was miserable and did not want to be here. We also felt very rushed when ordering. We asked about the chile because there is a "caution"on the menu pertaining to how hot it is. All he said was "what ever you prefer" didn't even mention the taste or how spicy they were.... Once we order we never saw him again. He walked by us Numerous times never asked us how anything was or even if we needed anything (which we did) We had to ask two other servers for drinks and our check. The place was nice very different decor. Just a bunch of random pictures all over and stuff. We sat in the bar area so I can't speak for the dinning area. The food was good but I wasn't blown away by it. The portions are huge here. Which is something I don't really like personally. I feel like it's just a waste of food (and also part of the reason why Americans are so obese. Definitely no reason for any place to give huge portion sizes... Sorry about my personal note hehe) it's also very dark in this place when I walked out side I was blinded by the sun like. (Bugs life: "don't look into the light!!!"). The orange juice was my favorite part about this place. It was great fresh squeezed! Anyways we won't be going back to this place.

kiVmbjJFlNm4kU6OcXlxWQ.text: I go to Dicks Hideaway every so often, and absolutely love the atmosphere (yummy smell of pecan wood smoke in the air). But best of all? The service and the food! I always always always get the Carne Adovada (in one of the pictures on Yelp) with over easy eggs, yummy beans, and potatoes. I recommend getting it with their blue corn tortillas, super yummy. Very much worth the money. Some might think it's a pricey breakfast spot, but those people don't know good quality when they see it!

AKHTAnpTlrhOHkzn_JeYKg.text: Brought a foodie friend here for brunch. I had the Benedict Combo and my friend had (upon recommendation from a brand new waitress - apparently it was her first day - I'll forgive her mispronouncing adovada as avadova as she was very sweet, but please get to know the menu!) Vic's Green Chile Meatloaf and Eggs. The meatloaf was ok, but she said she wished she had ordered Rellenos or the Carne Adovada instead, and she raved about the jalapeno hollandaise and the tenderness of the beef tenderloin that the perfect eggs Benedict sat upon (I always share). Still loved the ambiance and the service was lovely.

48ONrf3nGQd4EPfssRzrCw.text: It took me a while finding Dick's Hideaway.  It's nestled between some smaller businesses across the way from a strip mall, and I didn't see a sign over the door until I decided to get out of the car and find it on foot.  The doors were nothing fancy, and there wasn't an outdoor menu to check out, but I later figured after I had eaten my meal that if Dick's cared to advertise, there'd ultimately be lines down the block of people waiting for a seat at their three tables, or their bar.  Whether waiting for the good drinks, the cozy atmosphere, the amazing food, the kind service, or a chance to watch your meal being made over a fresh draught beer, there'd be people waiting.  I am thankful that Dick's is such a hard place to find, and even happier knowing it's certainly worth the search.  Dick's menu is strictly American.  Good American.  They only have one burger stowed away on three menu pages bristling with bacon-wrapped grilled shrimp, roasted chicken and cheese steak sandwiches.  Just one burger, and yet I'd not want another to take the place of every other delicious option you'll find.  In fact, if there's anything wrong with the menu at Dick's, it's that there are too many amazing plates to choose from.  I ended up having half my drink before I found what I wanted, but the service was quick, attentive, and ready when I pointed out the cheese steak and watched it made fresh.  Sure, there are only three tables.  You can order food at the bar, if you're lucky enough to score a stool.  But I can't dock Dick a star for being a hard-to-get treat.  If there were more tables it'd feel too big.  It'd be louder, full of people who take the place for granted.  No, Dick -- keep it small.  It's quaint, personable, and OHMYGOD delicious.  If I was made to wait half an hour for a chance to enjoy a meal at Dick's, it'd be well worth it.

E3udA5UjcwjRDxyfmvFi4g.text: My friend took me there about a year ago. I had the Jalapeno Benedict served with a giant hunk of ham on top. After one bite, I was hooked. All I do is crave Dicks now! The Enchiladas and Eggs are awesome as well. Yummy Dicks!

ZOnGc1vGOkCeXix1W7kJRw.text: Whatever you do do not eat breakfast here on the weekends.  I have a hard enough time finding a seat at the bar without you taking up valuable space.  This place has a great meatloaf and eggs, and their take on eggs Benedict is awesome - the pork is like Canadian bacon on steroids.  Not literally on steroids, I am sure it is free range pig - but really thick, lean slices of good pork.  Add a bloody Mary, and you truly have the breakfast of champions.  Or at least breakfast for someone with a mild hangover that wants to get the day going.  Happy hour is also great, I think they still run the $5 wine specials and a free appetizer is sometimes served at the bar top.  Overall one of my favorite bars in the area.

CWg2h9ISddpr8Ftc8rP4PA.text: Hard time finding it, worth the effort.  A great find, I hope to go back next time I am in Phoenix.

TQKcbh8GBjG6aqSRft8YkA.text: We were looking for Richardson's, and parked where it used to be.  I know they reopened after burning down a few years ago, and I've been looking forward to the garlic plate for a long time.  Turns out Richardson's was about 3-4 blocks up on 16th street, not at the corner in the strip where it used to be.  We ended up just going into Dick's, since it's all owned by the same family.  And parking is tough there, we didn't want to move from the parking spot we were lucky enough to score!  I've never been inside before but it was perfect for us, very cozy and intimate.  We were just stopping in for a light lunch on our way to our staycation.  We got the half garlic plate and the skewers.  It's not a lot of food but oh my God, how delicious it is.  I wish we got the full garlic plate.  The elephant cloves were smooth and creamy and the perfect base to the peppers and cheese that we piled on to our baguette bread slices.  The skewers were delish--they came with a shrimp, a sausage, a beef and a chicken (I think?) and the salsas and sauces all complemented them very well.  Not a cheap place but very much worth it for a special occasion.

qCgCi6T50YZaZTpH-NsDZQ.text: Very cool place with more character than seats.   The staff was very efficient with managing the Sunday after St Paddy's day brunch crowd and ensuring everyone was being taken care of as soon as possible.  The french toast was toasty and cooked perfectly with the faint hint of cinnamon that kept you wanting just one more bite when you knew you should have just taken the leftovers home.  My girlfriend got the french toast and a cup of coffee which she was given before we even were able to get a seat at the bar.   The staff made sure the water and coffees were always full, really a nice job.   I got a well made bloody as it seemed fit to have such a drink on Mar 18th at 9 am.  The combo of jalapeno Benedict, two chicken enchiladas and perfectly cooked asparagus were a treat as well and I would love to go back again tomorrow if I could but have to leave town so until next time DH.....keep up the good work and keep this place hidden!

hb7SWoWLyZDpX5SyZVrbXw.text: I loved the fact that there is no sign above the door.  It's like Hollister!  Actually, I see this an impediment, but I guess it is unique.  I have dined here for dinner and for brunch.  I had some delicious Enchiladas for dinner and a Mexican Meatloaf for brunch.  Both came with rice and beans.  I honestly don't remember either dish tasting differently from each other.  That's sometimes my problem with Mexican food.  Far too often, it all tastes exactly the same.  The beans were also over cooked.  This is not to say that both meals weren't filling or tasty, but I am hesitant to go back because I know I can get equally tasty and filling meals for 6 dollars less.  That being said, the small interior is very intimate and would make a great place to take a date.

yGl45lsJRvMX7PZ4ZRbCrg.text: The name "Dick's Hideaway" is an understatement! This is as hidden as a restaurant can get. Hole in the wall? Yes!   I was Yelping around on Saturday morning looking for somewhere to eat in AZ that wasn't a chain. Challenging task, I know. I needed something that reminded me of home. Something with character and culture. This is when my prayers were answered and I stumbled upon rave reviews of this adequately named establishment. Chile Adovada on their brunch menu? Surely I wasn't in Scottsdale anymore... this sounded like heaven to me! I could hardly contain my excitement when we finally entered this humble abode of brunch delight! At last- I found a joint that didn't resemble a Denny's or Ihop. I was delighted to say the very least. My boyfriend had the breakfast burrito and I of course had to get the Chile Adovada. It was pure bliss. The plate was large enough to feed 2 but I was starving. Every bite was out of this world! I could talk about the food for hours but let me move on to the ambiance. It was about as cool as the food. I felt like I was part of a club or something of that nature. There are no signs on the door advertising the place so it felt a little secretive. Pretty cool huh! The staff was super friendly and inviting. I topped off my weekend brunch with a small glass of jalapeno infused tequila. Careful if you don't like spicy flavors! If you like heat as much I do though, you will love it!  I will definitely be back at Dick's again soon!  Ciao!

DDF54P-yOsg4V2n72bF2Ug.text: Been a fan but was very put off by a recent experience.  Wife and I spent some early happy hour time there.  After enjoying several drinks and 3 of the "Small Plate" offerings we settled our check and asked for a box to take home 1 fish taco and one spicy chicken tostada.  We were informed by the bar tender that the owners' policy was NOT to let customers take "Small Plate" leftovers home to keep patrons from trying to dine on the cheap!  I could see his point if we had only ordered $15 bucks worth of food and a glass of water- but we dropped more than $50 bucks on drinks alone!  Either way- what's the difference?  You would rather throw food away than keep a customer.  So long Dick's and Richardson's and Rokerj!

mDdCM6Ka0om_PdS9-k7Kaw.text: There is no obvious signage in front, even on the doors, so search for it by street number.  It is next to the coffee bistro.  The food, ambiance and service are wonderful and the setting both comfortable and cozy.  The smell of wood-fired cooking fills the air. A True "home run."

LRN2uXS1_O5HCOUixQ3cgw.text: I rate this place five stars because it is as good as it gets.  Forget the dummies that complain about it being dark, small, like a bar, too spicy, too meaty, whatevs.  The food is great if you are into spicy SW Cuisine, similar to what you find in Santa Fe. My wife and I have enjoyed the shrimp pizza with smoked cheese multiple times (hint, dip it in red sauce).  Blackened chicken caesar is awesome.  Posole is phenomenal, and I also love enchiladas and eggs. Bloody Mary is drink of choice at this place, but they do serve nice wines.

WM37M7UrmcuJ_8CFa9d88Q.text: Headed to Dick's Hideaway this past weekend and it was 'fine'.  We had drinks and dinner (4 of us). The service made us feel like we were an annoyance (and let me be clear, we were as unoffensive and easy as customers can be) and the food was just so-so.  I had the prime rib, and it was so salty and overly spicy that I just skipped it and focused on the side dishes (vegies were good).  My husband had the scallop salad.  He said it was good, but 4 scallops wasn't enough for a main dish.  We also had guacamole - which was fine, but nothing special.  Twice we ordered drinks that never arrived as well.  I can see why people like this place because the location and ambiance is good...  but the food and service just didn't do it for me.

dAn-L_-FROKOisoqJHn-og.text: This place is just freaking yummy. A Phoenix staple with some delicious food. Highly recommend checking it out. Brunch is probably my favorite!

EjIJvsbYbiqBxHAvKZbIxg.text: This might just be my favorite bar/restaurant for brunch in Central Phoenix. The Carne Adovada with eggs is absolutely outstanding. Swap the potatoes/hashbrowns for the green chili potatoes which come stuffed in a green chili (you will not regret this choice). This place can be busy and can be difficult for large groups but if you get there early try to belly up to the bar for VERY strong and tasty drinks. What are you waiting for, stop what you are doing and go to Dicks!

HHiYfG0VXKrgVD7p7hDTFw.text: We sat at the community table. Very interesting. I think I like it.. Drinks were great. Service was great. :) meatloaf was gross..person next to me said enchilada was good. And girls in front had jalapeno stuffed were great..

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meatloaf don&#39;t order it.  Girlfriend had French toast she liked hers.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast for champions. :) Oh with Drinks.

Yhx0lxktDIfXw_LQ43ggrw.text: What a hidden gem in the Valley!!! Everything about this place was amazing. It's a hideaway so don't expect any signage   We got the carne adovado with breakfast potatoes. Best potatoes I've ever had in my entire life. Like ever. Bloody Mary was great as well (and for $5 you can't beat it). Waiter was great and attentive as well and provided us excellent service. I'll be back for sure!!!

kbf8L1xL_1eS0Y51hHGGRg.text: My wife and I came here for breakfast and the name  for it could not be better. I literally had to drive around twice to find it as there is no sign posted and it is very easy to miss. Once you walk in it is dark which is actually a good thing as the windows are covered to keep the hot Arizona sun out. The food I must say was delicious and plenty. I had the carne adovada Benedict which comes with beans and your choice of potatoes or hash browns. My wife had the French toast with bacon and three eggs--ALL GOOD! I also had the Bloody Mary which is kept seeing everyone say how good it was and they were not kidding, it even comes with a side car of Stella Jalisco beer. My wife had the mimosa which she says was also very good. If you're ever in the area coming here is a must.

uOT63lyLYJfXqd-225yjFg.text: We thoroughly enjoyed this place! It's a bit pricey, but worth every dime of it! The first time we set-out to go to this place for dinner, we drove around the block 3 times using our navigation and we didn't see it so we gave up. This time we asked neighboring shops and at our second stop, we were guided through their kitchen to the back alley to a random door that looked like a storage closet from outside and mind you, it had no signage on it. And then you enter through the kitchen of Dick's Hideaway as if it's the norm to be directed to a very dark dungeony cave-like dining room. How on earth would even the above average patron find this place??? But I guess that's the concept, hence "Dick's Hideaway."  After such a voyage, I needed to wash my hands, so I was pointed to the bathroom, or should I say "washroom." Never in America have I seen a shower in the restaurant patron's bathroom... until now. I dared my daughter to take a shower but since there was no towel, she opted out.  On to the food. The menu is very southwest (in a good way). We ordered the special of the day, fish trio (smoked salmon, swordfish and mahi) with grilled veggies and hollandaise, 3 enchiladas (pork, beef and smoked turkey), and the garlic butter pasta with grilled chicken for the kiddo. As a cook, I can appreciate all of the freshest ingredients used from the farm fresh grilled veggies to the homemade hollandaise sauce to the fresh made tortillas and mole to my daughter's amazing noodles, which I'd gamble that they are home-made. They have a nice selection of specialty brews, fine wines and their libations are made with fresh fruits and puree which were very tasty and pricey. But my mom always says, you get what you pay for.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garlic butter pasta with grilled chicken
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The grilled fish trio (smoked salmon, mahi and swordfish) with grilled veggies and hollandaise sauce
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enchiladas with beans, green sauce and red sauce

AqprMOxYEetPO_Le1jI66A.text: This little hole in the wall has a great menu! My favorite dish is their Pork Pulled Enchiladas, red. 3 in the order made with blue corn tortillas fresh made salsa to top them. The nice thing about the sauce is, it's not saturated with cumino or ajo (cumin or garlic) which commonly masks the taste of the chile California. The pork was a little dry this time but other times it has been very moist. They are loaded with cheese and paired with frijoles de la olla ( beans from the clay pot) very authentic. The rice I will always pass! It's uncle bens rice not good and tastes very instant. The cook could have taken the time to saute the meat before placing them on the plate but as he was prepping my food in front of me I noticed that the enchiladas are pre-rolled....hmm  maybe his is not a good idea since r meat dries up.   Service here is consistent, nothing over the top but consistent is always good. Drinks here are way too pricey I would go for drinks somewhere else. I recommend this place if your in the mood for some good enchiladas! It's worth the stop.

ZYZlagDLeWktjNI6GcROqg.text: I keep remembering how good this place is and saw I had not given 5* , but it easily should have all 5 as I dig cool eclectic places that nail their food. And Dicks is all that and more.

3B6_BI_HwwKqegwiOJF8Pg.text: Dick's Hideaway is by far my favorite restaurant in the Phoenix area. Every time I come to town I make a point of at least one breakfast and one dinner is not more at Dick's.  This is Tex-Mex (in my opinion) at its finest. The dark atmosphere, the food, and the bar is outstanding. I love the fact that its located in a very unassuming strip center with absolutely no signage and its always very busy.  Oh, there is a small sign at the bottom of the front door that says "Sorry, we are open." You will not be disappointed.

WFPrB_2BX5cLMsZ9ODZ7-A.text: Truly a "hideaway"!  Great appetizers and dinner options with big servings.  Also, they have a number of daily specials.  You can't go wrong at Dicks

VbSjqW_QbxDZ2FCLNMT7fg.text: What's to say... This place rocks. Amazing food great drinks... The only issue would be the size and limited seating but otherwise.... YUM!!!

clWmuYxpdmk7NmQsqDb8Dw.text: This place has super horrible customer service....not sure what the hype is all about....? Seriously though....what's going on?

t7BITwNwkNyDH9QW8DkizA.text: Horrible service, sat forever waiting had to flag someone down repeatedly for refills, more drinks, better service at Burger King.

R1IFVHkyHi1cWr7Pm_3qSw.text: I absolutely fell in love with this place. Great and friendly staff, amazing ambience and the food was amazing, unlike any other place I've ever been. It's truly a hidden gem, it's my new favorite place and probably the best restaurant in Arizona. I love Doug, he is the best waiter ever. Ask for him and he'll hook you up with the most accommodating service.

cq8x8N_MNv4FEVHe1PMboQ.text: Best ever!!! The food is amazing and the ambiance is the best. This is a little hideaway everyone should enjoy
