Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne adovada eggs Benedict with a stuffed poblano pepper

lqLcpTyKOanGlgfEPpmOMQ.text: It's worthwhile to note that this restaurant does not have a sign out front carrying it's name. You need to know that this is next to Luci's, or things could get frustrating. Once you open the door it couldn't be more obvious, but there are few clues from the outside of what's contained within.   The first room is narrow, a crowded bar and a couple tables. My girlfriend and I opted to squeeze into the former, and ordered a couple beers while we browsed the menu place mats. I ordered the huevos rancheros with eggs, and she had the jalapeno eggs Benedict.   Our food was served on metal plates that had been sitting on the grill, and were thus quite hot. We both received ample portions, ensuring the taking home of leftovers. The carne adovada was delicious, though cooked in a different way than I'm used to in New Mexico, with a smokier flavor reminiscent of certain briskets. The eggs, beans and hashbrowns ensured I got my fill of flavor and texture combinations.   My girlfriend enjoyed her food as well, almost gratuitously laden with toppings and featuring thick cut ham that cut no corners. While the prices here are not necessarily cheap, it could be a wise idea to split a plate of food. I wouldn't mind coming back here; next time I'll actually know where it is.

94wsUh4aLbTCj-XEFlJoiA.text: I love this place. Most people can't even find it. So if you don't know where it is you shouldn't come here... Just kidding and when you do find it you're going to find great Tex Mexican food. Plus the staff here is fantastic. Adam is my favorite

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ef-IHSLRIo_RykCrLjlaIQ.text: Location: Look for a plain brown door with a sign saying "Sorry, we're open" at the bottom. If that is too difficult to spot, look for a large sign saying "Additional Parking in Rear." If you reach the corner and see Luci's Healthy Marketplace you have gone too far and passed it.  I did not have the foresight to read Yelp beforehand and drove around three times before realizing that I kept passing the restaurant. Luckily, we found parking right in front and there were two empty seats at the bar. While you wait for food you can read the entertaining signs and admire the eclectic decor. I ordered the Carne Adovada & Eggs with hash browns and eggs cooked over easy. It came out on a piping hot metal plate and smelled delicious. The portion is huge and could have easily fed both of us. It tasted good but nothing amazing. But I am still glad I got to hunt down this fun restaurant.

ltoz1pHtIgc1AkJpvqcG3g.text: This is one of the best places to eat in all of Arizona. Been coming here for years! Today my friend Nicole and I had brunch and I have to tell you, Jason and Doug are amazing! They are the most polite, friendly and personal people we have met in along time. The food is so amazing! I would recommend the Benedict!

8CnOmo6dGIN2d105CW7NVQ.text: Good service... but the huevos rancheros totally sucked. Feel bad saying so considering how many people rave about them. Overcooked eggs, undercooked potatoes, no refried beans and way too f'ing spicy.   Again, very good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huevos rancheros.. Dick&#39;s Hideaway style.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huevos Rancheros $12

ujPa2etD7J8V4VaG7x-AIg.text: I came for the brunch, expecting the best brunch I've ever had.  This place is so hyped about in Phoenix that I thought it was going to be outrageously good.  I was a little disappointed in that Dick's really didn't stand out that much in my mind.  It's good, yes.  I had some breakfast enchiladas topped with a fried egg, which were incredibly spicy (seems to be the theme here) but weren't anything that much different than enchiladas that I could purchase at any other breakfast/brunch place in town.  The only thing that was really different was the fact that the price is substantially higher here.  The atmosphere is fun - this place is hard to find (maybe that's why it's called Hideaway?) and feels secluded.  However, I'm not sure that I'm willing to pay the increased price tag for the exclusivity.

Y7UdgJYXTo8p3xxLAL6mXQ.text: Got terrible food poisoning here along with my pregnant wife. First time in my life. Avoid this place like the plague.

mqnSIJbeaoqRfEe_ZSs2Xg.text: This place is a solid five stars, except for one major reoccurring issue.   Every time I go in 40-30 minutes before they close, I get turned away from ordering food.   I understand everyone wants to go home and I'm all for it.   The employees are great and I support them.   But management should show the restaurant closing at 10:00pm or 10:30pm, not 11:00pm.   Tonight was the 5th time I've been turned away when showing up 30 min+ before closing.     I'll still come here because it's awesome...    but I'll never attempt coming again in the closing hour.

7BvIhY7zDEDKoIu2nLazaQ.text: One star for the food. The burger, fries and bacon wrapped jalapenos were excellent. Based on the reviews, I had high hopes for Dick's Hideaway. Visited Saturday, Feb 10th around 3PM. Of the three bartenders working, not one of them smiled during the one hour that we spent here. The worst offender was the clown with the beard and man bun. He was just too cool and couldn't be bothered. Needs to find something other than the service industry. Proceeded to count his tips for a good 15 minutes right in front of us while ignoring his customers. completely unprofessional. I could go on, but this place just isn't worth my time. If management is reading this, please tell your bartenders that smug isn't "cool" and maybe make an attempt at a smile. We won't be back

ku7MQeZGllaxzWobzmQuog.text: We get to Phoenix about 4 times a year and in between we dream about the depths of flavors at Dicks.  Seriously.   The adovada and the green chile sauce should not be missed.     Put those sauces on  or with anything on the menu and prepare to transport your taste buds to their happy place.    Our personal favorites are the chiles rellenos and carne adovada.  But EVERYTHING on the menu we have tried has been tasty and delightful.      Sit at the bar during breakfast and marvel at the efficiency of the cooks in their tiny space.      Updating after June 2018 visit... and still endorse every previous word....

TM9BlDa9siVWDVzSD2E5RA.text: Left a lot to be desired!  We love Richardson's/Rolerij so we assumed Dick's would be just as good.   Food was bland and didn't have the "kick" we were looking for.  More of a bar, less of a restaurant.

5t4bb969XaejMTIg8c61SQ.text: The Meal Never Came  My wife and I are in town for a short vacation. Heard great things about this place and you can't get this kind of food back home in Cincinnati. We came in around 815 and we were given the option of sitting at the bar or a table in the back room.   We decided to sit at the bar and enjoyed watching all the great looking food come out while we waited. I had the old fashioned to drink, which was great but just a little sweeter than I prefer. I ordered my next one without the simple syrup and they were happy to make the adjustment for me.   I ordered the enchiladas and my wife ordered the Chimayo chicken. After about 60 minutes of waiting and noticing the guys on the line beginning to prep the grill to close we asked about our orders. They had put them on hold, gotten busy and forgotten about it.   The staff was friendly and very apologetic after they realized what had happened. They were nice enough to not charges us for my two drinks and my wife's club soda. However, we never got to eat and by the time we left around 1045 most everything else we closed. All the food looked and smelled amazing but I'm not sure if that made things better or worse for us.

8G_HJ2qFo3nw9VTA1OpgRQ.text: I've been coming for years, and realised I hadn't reviewed Dick's.   First of all, Dick's used to be the secret speakeasy -no signage- brother to Richardson's (prior to the fire and relocation). The bar is a single counter with a few tables. Now the back room is a much larger space that can house a meeting, party or over flow tables.  For those unfamiliar with the menu: Dick's provides amazing authentic New Mexican food. The chile (despite the warning label) isn't too spicy. When I need my fix on green Chile, I always head over.   Favorites: green chile potatoes, smoked turkey enchiladas and the fresh fish of the day (which there is an abundance of specials).   Note: Red chile is much spicier than the green chile- but typically you should order based on your preference.

3NPEjlE_wzzbcdr6TrWbNg.text: Hadn't been here and live right around the corner.  Showed up at 8:30 pm on a Sun night.  Dining room was closed and we sat at the bar. Bartender was terrific ( Ricky) was wonderful.  Great food and drink.  Laura was the chef and the entrees rocked!  Scallops, skewers and  tomatillo toast. All incredible!  Can't wait to go back for Happy Hour!!

wOxuEJsCmBkyHZ_Qics2zw.text: Great breakfast food and atmosphere. Cheap drinks. Nice staff. Will regularly return.

qMR_0nkMYqtCzEExYfVSmA.text: I love the food, (especially brunch) I love the music and I especially love your $5 mimosas.

LPNrAZvMOWpeycIXi1Rx6A.text: Stopped in here on the way to the airport and it was AWESOME!  Being from MN it's hard to find a good mexican breakfast and this place does it right!  Had the Huevos Rancheros and it was delicious and spicy.  Loved the atmosphere, loved the food and service.  You won't be disappointed!

NO0CnZf_I_9Nd2LUaZuRIw.text: Had breakfast at Dicks Hideaway this morning before a big day of shopping (a group of friends is furnishing a room at a transitional housing program for women0--It was a great place to start the day--I hadn't been there in awhile and had forgotton how good the food is.  As usual the place was crowded (at 10 in the morning) so we sat at the bar (my favorite place)  I ordered carne adovada with scrambled eggs.  The adovado was rich and hot but no so hot to overwhelm the taste buds,  the eggs are nice complement to allow your taste buds to cool off before the next bite of the tender carne adovada.  if you can't get to new mexico any time Dick's Hideaway is a great place to get the red or green chili fix.

4Z2rnUduOkIl2UTfghr8-g.text: Small and hard to find first time there.  Aside from that great ambiance.  Small place with a very personal feel.  The menu has a lot of great options, but you can not miss the smoked turkey/ duck rellenos.  They are filled with amazing meat, topped with your cheese and you choice of red or green chili, every time i think about rellenos this is the first thing that pops into my head.  Service is great sometimes and fair others, but with food this good it easily makes up for it.  If you go for breakfast get a bloody mary, they serve it the traditional way with a beer back.

jcuI85GYXEyK4GyhzVk0NQ.text: Small place, hard to spot, worth the search! Great food, drinks, and the staff was super friendly and helpful. Amazing hidden gem.

02KxbCVgISEUQX0YfUgTfw.text: The food and drinks are really good! Love the idea that it's kind of hidden for the locals. I just wish there was more sitting room! It is really small so you get cozy with strangers.

HzAVahhmB4eogx_NaeFuBw.text: I love this place!  There is no better atmosphere in the valley to compliment the food.  The New Mexican cuisine is fantastic.  It can be a bit spicy at times, so watch out.   One of the only places I know in town to serve Chimay Beer on tap!

20_ETf2gkxbG36mBXTWaLg.text: Good Southwestern food in huge portions.  My friend and I came here around 9:45 last night, and the place was reasonably empty.  One couple came in after us briefly. The place itself is nicely decorated.  I love the open grill at the bar, and the smell of burning wood.  We ordered a couple martinis, gimlets, beer, and actual food.  The drinks were nice  and strong, the bartender has a heavy hand!  The food was delicious.  I got the carne adovada which was just perfect.  The pork was so easy to pull apart.  And who doesn't love a meal where you don't need a knife?  That means less effort put into eating.  My friend got the skewers and enjoyed them as well.  The presentation for them is a little nicer than the adovada, which is just meat thrown on a plate. The bartender was great, asking us what music we wanted to hear on Pandora.  He still needs to watch The Hangover so he can understand why my friend needs to stay in Caesar's Palace in Vegas.  We just might have to stop in and see him tonight.  Word to the wise: be careful about getting drunk at the bar.  The bar stools are wobbly and I can see someone eating shit while wasted.

c3iFt9EYzXOdiV6n8jOdxw.text: Absolutely delicious breakfast!!!  Not an easy restaurant to find as there is no sign outside.  But it is worth the adventure.  It is a small "hole in the wall" but none of the bad stuff.  It has a lush cozy interior.  The food is tex-mex style so everything comes with a tortilla.  There was even a tortilla hidden beneath the salad!  The eggs benedict was cooked perfectly.  Perfectly poached eggs over two juicy perfectly seasoned pork loins... and it was all on top of a tortilla.

GdTmfeiMdKsRkRkFqPf-gg.text: Dick's Hideaway is a great little bar (emphasis on the word "little") on 16th St @ Bethany Home. One part of Richardson Browne's trifecta along with Richardson's and the Rokerij, Dick's has friendly bartenders, Chimay on tap, a dark wood and copper interior, and the same New Mexican dinner menu as Richardson's - what more can you ask for?

LlxwY77YSAe113tBcR7MTA.text: Dick's and the related restaurant, Richardson's are excellent - probably the best New Mexican food I've had (outside of New Mexico of course) - they are always tops on my list when choosing a restaurant.  Service has always been excellent, and the food memorable.  For group dinners, Dick's Hideaway has a private room (often called the 'family room' in many traditional New Mexico restaurants) that will seat close to 20 people I think - an excellent place for small business dinners.  Whether eating in the private room, in a booth at Richardson's or at one of the bars - it's a great choice.

sgsCpDp-KuiiFHPVPb0dBw.text: The name of this place sounds like it should be a secret swingers joint, but I do believe it is not although last time one of my buddies was here, he got hit on by a cougar.  Instead, it's a sweet little hole in the wall bar serving delicious New Mexican cuisine and yummy beer.  It's dark with limited room at the bar and few tables however that just adds to the ambiance.  Dicks is a great place to watch a game if you don't want to go to some lame ass sports bar or just a fun place to grab a brew with one of your friends.  Rock on Dicks.. hmmm, that sounded really bad.

EqQOtOYwR0ycJxuDdNpZHA.text: i've been missing nyc quality food- until dicks.  really great quality, super friendly staff and hearty portions.  found my new favorite place!

8xobC86Vh232uEIf4How9A.text: I really dig this place.  Though I've only been here once, it has a cozy atmosphere, dim lighting, and good music.  The bartenders were attentive & what's more .... they have CHIMAY on tap!  I haven't tried the food yet, so can't comment on that.  Bonus points for being close to where I live.  I think I will be making return trips to this neat little hideaway.

vlbOVsYmMuKqzUIG6QJVrw.text: I love Dick's Hideaway!   The food is amazing!   It's cooked over an open pecan wood fire.  The smells are wonderful, the staff is kind and attentive ... it is the perfect neighborhood bar.   Everything that we ate was perfect ... chicken quesadilla, cheese steak sandwich ... the fries are great.

c23I8NU07LZ6msCe3BJisA.text: We've been going to Dick's for years now.  Such a cool little secret.  Love: the small and intimate setting, the chickens being roasted on the open flames, the smell of pecan wood, fresh squeezed citrus juices, generous pours for drinks, friendly, patient, helpful staff, and the food!  Been there all times of day and the food is amazing.  Brunch is outstanding!  Love everything on the menu.  Do not agree with one writer here that it's too spicy, but I am a native having grown up on hot food.  Don't tell just anyone.  Let's keep it the wonderful secret it is.

k3J_jUOQDQYzJaMu29USrg.text: Love the food, the bar, and the small intimate dining room. I prefer to order food at the bar and watch the cooking. However, if your with more then four people, the dining area is also very nice. Unlike the rude bartenders at their sister (brother) restaurant, The Rokerij, service is very pleasant at Dick's Hideaway. Nice little place to dine and have a drink. Again great food!

PoYdedUjGdcyXKArOAA-XQ.text: Seriously? People giving this place 5 stars? I have lived in Southern CA and now in El Paso, TX. I've tried some of the best mexican food, but this place was just ok. I've eaten "New Mexico" food in New Mexico and it's tasted better than this place. The food was a bit greasy. Granted, we ordered take-out from this place so maybe the food could have been better if we ate it in the very tiny restaurant that doesn't even have a sign on the outside. It's amazing how people even find this place!

1y9KgdUigY9VqblpWjKv8g.text: The only complaint?  Too small!  Which, of course, adds to the ambience.  Carne Adovado is to die for!  Never had a bad meal there.  Food can be pretty spicy (an additional star for that! :-)

3Kiq4X05q6bPjFCVgvzGBQ.text: Little known watering hole, becoming the spot to get a cold beer and enjoy a great meal.  The kitchen is behind the bar, the atmosphere is unique and origional as any good hideaway should be.  The place has always been packed but people have always been coming and going so there's never been a wait.  Unless you get enough people to reserve the back dinning room I would only suggest 2-4 people as seating can be difficult.

OVlolGmHRVeEEbtY23sUSw.text: What a mixed experience here.  First of all, this tiny place is in a stripmall (what isn't in a strip mall in Phoenix??!??!).  It's hardly visible with the darkened doorway and there's really no space to wait.  We arrived for brunch and they were packed.   When we finally got seated, I was so excited to order the poached eggs rancheros.  My friend had the Carne Adovada, which had eggs, smoked pork, and potatoes and beans.  The waitstaff was so overly busy that it was hard to get a cup of coffee or even place our order.  We were seated at the bar and so I was able to watch them cook.  While they were juggling a bunch of dishes, I did notice that the cook put the eggs in to "poach" and left them forever.  Of course, when I got my meal, the eggs were so overcooked, they weren't even edible.  I would have returned the dish, but couldn't get any waitstaff's attention.  So, I ate the sides and some of my friend's food, which was excellent.  When it was finally time to get the check, I informed the waiter of my breakfast disaster and he simply shrugged his shoulders and took away the plate.  So much for good service.  And, is the name of this place a euphemism for a certain part of women's anatomy, or is that just my sick mind?

e1569gQZEM4gbN6wqXu-pA.text: First time here earlier this week.  Wow ... this place is amazing.  New Mexico fare.  It's small just like some of the reviewers mentioned.  But it's perfect for two.  We had four in our party and we didn't have to wait very long.  The waiter was so nice and answered all our questions.  Yes, the food is spicy.  Yes, the food has a smoky flavor.  Yes, it's all good.  Perfect!  It's dark and romantic with candles burning.  And the bar seating looked awesome (you can watch them cooking).  I had the Carne Adovada (generous amount of melt in your mouth spicy pork with rice and beans).  Hey, I can eat, but I ended taking half of mine home.  Hubby had the Skewers.  He said they were really good and he'd order them again.  I'd go back in a minute.  Next time I want to try the bacon wrapped shrimp.  This would be a great place to show out of towners what Phoenix is really about.

RxYA-jA3YdMwZLNQQ1d9AA.text: I love going here and their Sante Fe chicken dish is one of my favorites.  It's small and a little bit crowded inside.......the only regret I have is I wish they had more seating because a number of times I had to leave because there was no space available.

cq4brcW1R_sn443WjqAK6g.text: What huh where is this? Completely speak easy style and definitely packed to the gills! We hit it around 4 and got lucky enough for a table to open up. Dick the owner happened to be there and assured us we would have a table soon. Got us all drinks while we waited and sure enough got seated and ordered some amazing food. My dad ordered the enchiladas I got the pork plate and my stepmom won with some sort of steak and pasta plate. All the food was amazing and the plates are scorching hot I literally still have a burn on my forearm but completely worth it. Place was just a hidden gem even down to strolling through the kitchen to use the bathroom.  If you get lucky enough to get in it is definitely worth it!

WhsCNTOxSwz2tBr_MVOm5A.text: Blackened scallops? Yep.  Brunch? Yep. Southwest flare? Yep.  Cocktails, happy hour, noisy bar, eclectic seating? Yep, yep yep yep.   There's no sign on the door, no flash or flare, but if you scoot up the sidewalk from Luci's you'll find a door and behind that door... well you'll see!  If you turn left into the bar, it's a high-top, bistro style, kinda homey kinda shwank type of place. If you turn right it's saltio tile, booths and tables (and the loo) in the very typical Phoenix Mexican Restaurant visual tradition. Either way, the food is worth trying (but believe them when they warn you about the heat) and the atmosphere is comfortable.   Now, you just have to find it!

ltDxJ740H0Vh9gfFH7Ej5Q.text: This review is strictly written based on the fact we ate at Dick's Hideaway for our wedding reception dinner and utilized the private dining. Being from Ohio we realized it was very very difficult to get responses back from the staff, and we also seemed to have multiple contacts over the planning time when exchanging emails. We tried leaving  a few messages, and we did have a little better results then, however they did call us at 4 am one time...yes 4 am! When we got into the private room and seated there is also a private bathroom for the group however soon after someone from the bar walked right in and used it. I immediately asked our server about it and got some quick attitude from her on me asking to lock the door to not let them in....I mean we did put $500 down just to have the room so I think we deserved the right to call the shots! After that we heard the waitress yell out to the bar not to use the bathroom saying "She just got yelled at, and doesnt like to be yelled at"...yes we did hear you Michelle! Then we also noticed a sign on the door saying....Private Party Stay the "F" Out....dont know if they were trying to "take a dig at us" but we thought it was pretty funny and had the entire wedding party sign it and it will soon be framed here at our house as a momento.  However, the food was TRULY AMAZING!! and HUGE portions which had everyone giving compliments both during and after the dinner. Would I be back...absolutely! What would I tell future wedding goers....to be persistent...they can make it great...BUT its alot of work!!  5 stars for food...but heavily waited on service and common courtesy

3C8mm1siFTpeE9_B3iBZ4w.text: I love this place how its tucked away and hidden! A fan of both Richardson`s and The Rokerij, Dick`s Hideaway doesn`t disappoint!!   Came in recently with some of my work friends for brunch, and needless to say I most definitely plan to return!! I had the tenderloin benedict, flavorful and juicy! And loved their mimosas! My other two friends ordered the jalapeno eggs benedict and the other had the huevos rancheros,both were raving about their dishes as well. My only question was, why the hell did I wait so long to eat here?! Especially when I live so close!!

NK131qF7X4AmxZ5Tpui1HQ.text: One of the best little places I've been to in Phoenix!  The food is always delicious and they have the friendliest service!  Great place for dinner or a Sunday afternoon visit for a Bloody Mary.  Never been disappointed during any of my visits!

xJ6OdWPoB7j3N6SJa-7gOQ.text: Our best meal in Phoenix. Started with some Green Chile Sliders which were hot and spicy (just like my wife). The I had the Carne Adovada (which was awesome) and my wife and her mother had a trifecta of enchiladas. Everything was fantastic. The place is a little divey with an eclectic and fun crowd. Looking forward to breakfast next time we're in town.

l8QHo6Ud15V5WVflIFrWMA.text: Come here as often as possible. This is a great hole in the wall to meet friends, have some great food, where the kitchen is open to the restaurant. Staff is very friendly and the place his dimly lit, but warm. The bar, and tables are made from split trees and the rustic floor just adds to the rustic, New Mexican feel.

5VE3e3VSYlpi7ty4gY8kAQ.text: I lived in Albuquerque for four years and really miss the food.  I met a guy who lived in Santa Fe who recommended this place.  The worst place in ABQ was better than this and would cost a third of what they charged here.  I got the red and the green chile.  Both were unpleasant--the red tasted burnt.

_BA0sQeSxLhcBg_HF78Wqg.text: Best hole in the wall bar and restaurant in town! Great ambiance. Good service. Amazing food! Great location. Perfect date spot or for brunch.

YhZbj8saWBziHRur8oC8Bg.text: This was an interesting dinner.  First, it was little bit of a pain in the ass to find, there isn't a big sign on top of the building, just small print on their glass door, but once we found it, it got even more fun, well, kind of.  The server was casual and down to earth, a little too casual.  He was pretty slow to bring out the drinks, and he told us, in his words, that he was "too busy" to read us the specials, so he dropped off his handwritten notes to our table and left for a while.  This was a little mind boggling since we were the only table in the dining area, and there were 2 people at the bar... But what I did appreciate from our server was his brutal honesty, my friend asked about the tamales, and he was really quick to say that it usually turns our dry, and that we shouldn't get it (she got it anyways and liked it).    I got the Richardson Combo (eggs benedict, asparagus and 2 chicken enchiladas), weird combo right? But they blended together really well as I ate them.  I thought the food was great, they had a garlic infused hollandaise sauce on the eggs benny and the asparagus, and the enchiladas were quite tasty.  I had little bites of other dishes my friends had, and they were all really good, especially this one pork dish, I don't remember its name, but it was a slow braised pork, and it was amazing!   This place lost a lot of points because the server made a douchy move.  After we ordered, he asked if we wanted to start with any chips and salsa, him just asking I assumed they charged for it, but I didn't see it on the menu, so there was the possibility they don't charge for it, but we said yes anyways, and he asked if we wanted guac too, and we said sure (again, nowhere on the menu).  Chips and salsa were $5.50 and the guac was $6, what the hell!?!?! $11.50 for that! UGH!! It wasn't even that good!      To sum this up, amazing food (so amazing that it still gets a 4/5 after this terrible experience), not so great service.

zjCzNiaxkOxUXvBLzKVR1g.text: Often forgotten, even as a neighbor (only because of the speak-easy lack of signage) but always a great place.  Little known fact: Dick's serves breakfast every day starting at 7am and their breakfast meals are amazing!  Go in for dinner and get there early, because this joint is small and space is limited.

Xk_oVZ1sJpQ2LRJnzA6KGw.text: Great food! Went here with my wife and daughter and the food and service was great! I would definitely recommend this place to anybody!

qgUNR2YlIKVU0xtvOopqHQ.text: Best Mexican food in the valley.... Or maybe the best Mexican food I've ever had.   We ate there last week and for once in my lifetime, I saved the leftovers and ate them the next day.  I don't like leftovers and I NEVER ask for a box.  But these were still amazing.  We're going again this weekend because I've been craving it all week.  The only bad part of the evening was when we asked for 2 tortillas, since the meal only came with 1.  They charged us $2 for them?  Talk about  nickle and diming a customer.  $2 for a cheap, store bought tortilla from Fry's.  That really bugged.  They lost a star for that.

FhQMzTulkuYor7dPiMTQBg.text: Perfect name for this joint! It is hidden away in a little strip-mall with no sign. If you didn't know it was there, you'd have a very hard time finding the place (especially for out-of-towners like me).   This is a hip little tex-mex place with awesome food and a surprisingly beautiful wine selection. I went on one of those 20 person business dinners and we had a blast. Service was stellar and the food was outstanding!  I had the blackened scallop quesadilla with shrimp and New Mexico sausage, rice and cowboy beans on the side (it was OUTSTANDING!). Everyone at the table was raving about their selections, so apparently everything is great.   The servers had a vast knowledge of wine and were quick and attentive. Did I mention that the restroom was through the kitchen??? Hilarious place! Check it out if you're near!

bT33Xy_muYbeOapO9_gAew.text: Whatever they put in their food is AMAZING!!!  I got pancakes, eggs and bacon and my partner foodie in feasts got a benedict dish of some sorts effffffing AMAZING!!!!  Everything about the place screams give me more.  The decor is rad, the ambience (at 2PM) was pretty popping I think and the service was spot on.  FInding this place is quite a feat but overall the food experience was grrreat.  Beware first come first served because the size of the place is pretty tiny.  Great place to set a wonderful expectations of being a foodie of sorts with a knack for the unexpected.

QhU5jQV6EiuvniEvZiXGkw.text: Been gone all summer, can't wit to go back. Excellent New Mexico Mexican food.

_ICLMpQwnExCzEG2rWMTdg.text: First had to find the place!  After driving in circles - I saw the address on the door. There is NO SIGN. Look for the beat up brown wooden door. Ordered take out- New Mexico enchiladas with green chile pork, shrimp & chicken with green chile.  Yummy!!!!  Served with beans, rice and a tortilla.  Ate about 1/3rd of my entree. Large portion.  Looking forward to leftovers.  Worth locating. Looking forward to returning to try other menu items.

n2NeSC4Pth-JE2qCcCN4DA.text: We were in Mesa for Spring Training and I love local "Joints" restaurants that are unique with good foo.  Dick's Hideaway hit the spot!  The food and atmosphere was exactly what we were looking for.  I love spicy food and the Hideaway had both.  The service was very good, the food was very good and had bold flavors!  We enjoyed it so much we went back a 2nd day and had the same experience.   Next year during Spring Training we'll be back at the Hideaway.

FcY2OYri40lp3dbXe-bjUw.text: Awesome little hidden (literally) place ... If your trying to find this place just know there is literally no sign .. Just look for black doors with a sign saying "free kittens will be given to misbehaved children" !  The food is great , full of flavor , so filling ! Can be a little pricey so be prepared . Love the dark atmosphere .. Great for date night :)

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best seat in the house
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo pork chops

m0ru-4gekdhpqpNe9IwtKw.text: Food was not to bad nothing to make me want to come back. But overall a good experience. Plus they let you drink while u wait

b0A32qMebcbN06TnusxnKA.text: Oh you guys, I love you. Adovada and that green chili pasta. Your staff is always great! You make awesome drink and wine recommendations and really know your menu. My only wish is you weren't so busy. But that is the price of fame.

6WEhmUwtjuYxU5mvOlXw8Q.text: We have been coming to Dicks for eight or nine years now, ever since a tourist from Vermont that we met in Sedona mentioned it to us.  We were complaining we couldn't find any decent New Mexican style food (being from New Mexico) and he told us of Dick's.  With that said, we tried it and loved everything.... until....  .... the last few years, we have been receiving COLD food.  The plates are extremely hot to the point you literally can't touch them for about 10 minutes and the food on the outside of the plates can't be tasted during that time... but the food in the middle of the plates, cool to actually frozen on many occasions.  We have a friend we brought a few years ago and in addition to his order being forgotten and then rushed, it came out cold.  He won't go back.  (We keep trying to change his mind!) This has happened another time when we brought family to check out our favorite restaurant.  Something is going on with this fantastic diamond in the rough..... cold food?  We went last night and it was not that busy so no idea why the rush to get the food out.  Typically 20 minutes from order our food was brought and yep.. cold.  I only hope our friends we brought to introduce them to our new favorite place didn't have cold food as well.  I only hope the managers see this review and check into their cooking/heating systems of the prior prepared food..... last night was the NM Combo plate with a burro replaced for the shrimp, the burros were cold.  Mine was Relleno Platter with an egg on top and well... the middle of the relleno was not warm.

O5h2MD7NOgwq2xTQAeG-cA.text: This is the best place I've been too the food is amazing the service is great and philly the cook is a really cool nice guy. We tip him $20 every time we go because he gets down in that kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. First time here
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Y5hWaJNlEybcwrrzU2OKfg.text: I'm preaching to the choir here for those that Already know.  For some reason the chefs here do it just a tad better than their sister restaurants down the street...The Carne Adovada is shear perfection!  I'm a flavor guy, and this place hits it out of the park in that department.  Everything they have is good.  I'm partial to the Carne Adovada Benedict, Enchiladas, Burrito...Don't bitch about the slightly higher prices.  The servings are large and quality isn't always cheap!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. All about the flavor...I&#39;m from NM and the flavor of their Carne Adovada rivals the best places in Abq and Santa Fe.

ZHXiNrhdtQgtt9IOJdbTPg.text: Awesome little hole in the wall with the Best New Mexico Mexican Food. Every Thing on the Menu is delicious and served in Big Quantities. You can always order it to go as well

1Jkw2OPZlr_VemScO0MWeg.text: Good luck finding this place if you're not local. My fried and I had to ask around to find it - they don't have a sign or any door indications. Once you find it - you're in for a treat; I usually find Mexican food pretty bland but this place proved me wrong. Probably the best "Mexican" food I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy ceviche

7sXD1V38Py7zgxDMVo2MGg.text: A must try for anyone near the Phoenix area. The atmosphere is so unique b/c it's very dark inside.  Many of the breakfast items are so different from what you'll find anywhere else. Everything I tried has been full of flavor. Just a fun different experience.

zDGInX0FwxAp5ZUNwgfTag.text: Love this place, the food is different and so good.  Great happy hour menu! No name of the front, just the menu in the 'window', but worth finding!  We will be back!

xntZGNsY20GIo_BausZwVA.text: This is a gem hidden in Uptown Phoenix! Took me a little to find this place when I looked for it in person. Maps said that I had arrived but I could not see a sign or anything but this place does not try to pop in your face and just has these doors and is basically unmarked. But don't be shocked or assume that this place sucks, because you are in for a treat! The food was DELICIOUS! I love the options and the portions were gigantic! The mimosas were also spectacular! I would definitely recommend people to come check this place out, but the only thing you need to prepare for is the wait! It was packed last time I came here and we were squeezed so tight in the doorway waiting to be seated, but it was worth every second! Go and check this place out! Don't blink for another second and just go! :D

RRKjCTt3uDtyoIu6clnbow.text: Love everything on the menu. Garlic plater is my favorite along with the Pasta Heidi and Salmon is best I have ever tasted.

eLVdYwPEqZca34i6qZe01g.text: Anyone who gives this place less than 5 stars is in a bad mood or looking for something to complain about in life. Always treated right and the food is insanely delicious. Tenderloin Benedict for the win. Short review but don't doubt the place, just come in and try the food. You will come back after you have tried it once.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Funny

mKjL5XnjK_ukzJcfgnmkKg.text: This is how it's done folks!!!!  Outstanding food, excellent service and the atmosphere ... it's a dive!  This is my new favorite place for a big breakfast on cold winter mornings.  Meatloaf and eggs, rellenos and eggs, enchiladas and eggs, it's all great!!

EFTgR9J_o9H-1pydOoO1hg.text: Came here based on recommendations on Yelp.  We got seated right away and I loved the decor.  The servings were big and service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary with a beer back

50cBlsHLz4R1I46zy5NeNw.text: This place is literally a hideaway. Even with the address very hard to find. But once you do you will be so glad you did. Brunch is AMAZING!  Great options and combinations. You will go away happy and full.

bCgf7w8qLaqwhvT1FIOpIQ.text: Crazy good!!!  Dick's Hideaway couldn't be a more perfect name! The friendliness was so welcoming and the service was great. It's definitely small in there but nice, quick and easy.  The food is exceptional, I can't wait to go back.  This place is a gem as others have stated.

ye2d8GZCqioKEQFHrOoHww.text: 2 Words:  Hidden Gem.  It's a little hard to find, but worth searching for.  This was my first stop after arriving in Phoenix for ASCA15.  I had the Pork Chop Chorizo (See photo).

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Chop Chorizo

3MOyeNMkMYero3EabqZHlw.text: I get the same thing every time I come here; Carne Adovada. Once you've had the best, why downgrade? The Carne Adovada meat is succulent and tender and melts in your mouth. The red sauce gives it heat but doesn't overpower. The beans and rice are an added bonus. My mouth is watering right now thinking about it!  And their Bloody Mary's.......they are on my top 5 list of best Bloody Mary's I have ever had....anywhere!

Ts7zpGiewrC0YsN-trg8sw.text: Dick's Hideaway is truly one of the best kept secrets in the valley for American southwestern cuisine. I cannot fault this establishment for anything: its setting, lack of pretense, extremely warm, welcoming, knowledgeable and efficient staff...and the food mon dieu!   The flavors were so overwhelmingly delicious...that my friend and I were speechless the entire meal. Everything was so farmly fresh from the fresh squeezed orange juice, the eggs benedict combo, the green chile....My hunger was so satisfied for days to follow and smiles to linger...

cbNX8zvlAzFR1hGO4KfgEw.text: Never been on the inside so I don't know how service is, but I visited a friends house who ordered a take out for me here and the chicken quesadilla was amazing! Like no other, I've ever had. Will be going there more often, but probably next time I will go inside to see what it is like and etc.

MneKFWNUpKwYgziESCqIPg.text: Had the Elephant Garlic appetizer and civiche. Chips were stale. I told the waiter that. He did absolutely nothing. Didn't acknowledge my feedback and simply cleared our plates. Not impressed with our $30 app tab. This place is way way over rated. No need to return...

BqU_93np9O8w5-lLp3cd2A.text: I'm from NM and nothing between the 5 of us in my party had anything remotely close to New Mexico cuisine. I should of thought twice when I asked the server what part of nm they're from and he looked at me with a puzzled look, they're from Wisconsin but they spent some time in NM. From now on its los dos molinos for me and mine for real New Mexican in AZ.

9gg09rYyU9qf8_q2ThZAHA.text: Dick's hideaway is one of my favorite restaurants in the phoenix area. I went there for breakfast and wasn't disappointed. They suggested the meatloaf(that's right for breakfast) and I must say it was good. It was hard getting over the concept of meatloaf for breakfast so I wouldn't order it again, but it was worth the experience. The coffee was good and fresh and the service was up to the task. The price however was a bit high for breakfast after tip and coffee it came to 20 dollars for one person. For lunch or dinner that's fine, but not for breakfast. Granted there was enough food; that had I been joined by a comrade we could have easily split.

AFBmt4TE1msmgzCf2O0KCw.text: This place certainly has the charm and secrecy of a speakeasy from the 1920's (NO name on the outside of the establishment and Seriously hard to find!) Based on the reviews here, I ordered the Bloody Mary and Carne Adovada Benedict. The Bloody Mary was attractively presented and delicious but so infernally HOT that my tastebuds were too numb to taste the food for awhile! I love how they cook meat over a wood grill and the pork was very tender and flavorful with a texture like that of beef brisket or pot roast, but I have to agree with one of the other reviewers here that the Carne Adovada was so heavily covered in hot red sauce that it completely overpowered the flavor of the pork and the eggs. Bottom line: When you go there, order food that is not heavily sauced, ask for the Bloody Mary MILD at first (you can always make it hotter)  and I'll bet you'll have a better experience than me. Very friendly attentive service and dark chill atmosphere.

pWVfvFquS6CowdFJmIELjA.text: This place is very small and has a great vibe. Not easy to find - but that's part of the charm. Food was really good. Twist on Mexican as well as some standard American classics. They have a really unique garlic appetizer. Until I ate it I'd never have thought to put these things together. Very good!

xmy51-cj5yH8vLk5IsIrkg.text: Hard to find, but worth the effort! The only sign you'll see is "additional parking in the rear" above the door.   Small, casual place; very intimate. Small wood burning grill adds a wonderful smell to the ambiance. $5 dollar mimosa and bloody mary's for breakfast worth every penny.  Friendly attentive staff (bonus: even offered a beer chaser with the bloody-something you don't find very often outside of the Midwest). I had Carne Adavado and my husband had the eggs Benedict. Everything was delish! Served on hot plates (kept our breakfast warm til we were finished).  Highly recommend. Can't wait to go back!

9U-bS2L9mWtITftBsXbNvg.text: All I have to say is THE FOOD IS AMAZING!  It is hard to find (all good things are)  Its amall, but cozy the food is cooked right there in front of you.   As for the guy who left the only nagative comment... Go eat at Chilli's if you want a host to seat you.  I can't wait to go back.   Cheers

JCL1P9XH2b4fZNX5r7GBzg.text: This truly is a "hidden gem".  We went there with friends not knowing what to expect because my husband is a Phoenix native and had never heard of it.  It was hard to find because it does not have a sign which I guess is part of the ambiance.  It turned out to be s great find.  I had the Chimayo Chicken which was absolutely amazing.  Everyone else loved their meals.  We will definitely go back.

F-ypWYxUpwtoWAjF7OFTrA.text: Part of what I enjoy most when traveling is trying new food. I had wanted to try Dicks Hideaway for a few years and finally got there tonight. My husband are light eaters...especially at dinner. We had intended on just ordering the Carne Adovada. However, when we got there and grabbed the tiny two top facing the wall(the place is small), I noticed the menu noted "ABSOLUTELY no split plates". Did they mean they won't split a plate in the kitchen or we couldn't share a dish? When I asked the server, I was told that they would charge us $5 if we chose to share. Some restaurants charge for split plates because soup or salad come with the main course. That certainly was not the case here. So, we chose to order the Skewers to avoid the ridiculous sharing charge. The portions are insane. And because we are staying at a resort, it's not like we can take leftovers for tomorrow. In hindsight, we should've paid the $5 fee, shared the one dish. The Carne Adovada was tasty. The skewers were terribly boring, bland, and the poor shrimp were over cooked. There's plenty of better food in Phoenix/Scottsdale so I'm a bit confused over their high yelp rating. For me, it was an OK meal but not even close to mind-blowingly good or worth the price.

IGq9VmxJ4L_S7IiS4B1J1w.text: Phenomenal. Friendly staff, exceptional food. Can't wait to visit AZ again and come straight back here!

vJwA3ZDuhV332meGYTokFg.text: Worst customer service! Clyde was very rude and unprofessional. We will never go back there again! To top it all off the food was gross.

KwN2JFgCkQG0-E2tpPt8gw.text: Love the place, dark yet character. Food was great the beer was nice and cold..  Will come back. When I visit...

bnl1MCxCnauLlqFDdJqt7A.text: Dick's Hideaway is definitely hidden, but once you find it, you will enjoy it.  Stopped in for breakfast and had the combo Benedict (pork and beef) with jalapeno Hollandiase it was excellent- just the right amount of kick.  If you want something spicier they have plenty of items on the menu with red and green chili.  The waitress was helpful, friendly and attentive.  Breakfast with a kick and a smile.

HM93nycxjxBml2wqPJBSEw.text: I've been to Dick's dozens of times. You can't say enough about the character of this place. Part 21st century technosaloon, part southwestern foodie's paradise, and no sign on the front. Every time I've been there at 11 on a Sunday it has been packed.   Hands down the best huevos rancheros (overeasy, red & green) you can get, not just in Phoenix, probably the entire western US. I can't remember the last time I've come here and ordered something else. I've had the jalapeno eggs benedict, too, and they're incredible -- not as much heat in the hollandaise as I'd like, but my tastes run spicier. My wife got the tenderloin benedict, which I tried and was very tasty.   They have free wifi, nice cocktail servings (the mimosas and Bloody Mary are very generous), homemade chile sauce, and the coffee is above average.  I cannot recommend this place enough; if Yelp gave me 10 stars, Dick's would get every single one of them.

8lxrgMzG5u6yDJHXVy0ncg.text: Had a wonderful dining experience at Dick's several months ago, and plan to return today :)  I love this restaurant, so cozy, such great service, such outstanding food...yep, this restaurant IS as good as it gets!!!  Thank you!!!

dZvfvsZhH3f2irYhni8m2A.text: I hadn't been to Dick's for years, so I was so glad to find out that it still exists!  I was also happy to find out that the food is still just as good as I remember it!  I won't wait so long between visits now!  I would highly recommend trying it out!

-UR0RGfPfL3LJ3BhqkDlMQ.text: I was missing Richardson's - specifically the garlic plate - so I finally checked out Dick's Hideaway, which is in the "Richardson's family" of restaurants.  Dick's is about half bar / half restaurant.  I would have preferred a nice comfy booth in the dining room, but we didn't like how the dining room was so small and isolated so we sat at a high top table in the bar area.  There's a nice selection of beers on tap and the food menu is pretty expansive.  Start with the garlic plate and don't plan on being hungry for much more after that.    The New Mexican Chicken was fine but was not a particularly distinctive dish and didn't exactly remind me of New Mexico.  The red, white, and blue enchiladas had more character but they were covered in so much cheese that you couldn't tell where one began and the other ended, much less figure out which enchilada was which until you were halfway through eating it.    If I'm being too negative about the food, maybe it's because I was already full from the garlic plate.  Or maybe we just didn't order the right things.  Either way, I would come back here.  The cozy New Mexican-style atmosphere is fantastic and they have some decent happy hour specials.

FZQZue_nZ5ZUshbjFhvuFg.text: Explosive smells and tastes.  Carne Adovado - must eat!  And yes, it's hard to find, totally unlabeled, but the address is correct and on the door.

gEaxmYkhkGujM9aOa9v21Q.text: Three words: Mind-blowingly awesome!  We got there just a little after noon and we only had to wait 2 minutes for them to sit us at the bar. The place was packed. And there's good reason for that. Service was quick and attentive. My partner-in-dine ordered the "Tenderloin Benedict" which had two grilled tenderloin fillets served on English muffins, topped with two poached eggs smothered in jalapeno hollandaise with potatoes and hash browns. I went for the "New Mexico Enchiladas". For my three enchiladas, I chose the green chile pork, grilled shrimp and beef. My enchiladas came with rice and beans and I chose a combination of the red and green chile. I also added two eggs on top of my enchiladas. The food was delicious, hearty and had the perfect degree of spiciness. We also ordered the Bloody Mary which was Bloody Good! We also loved the laid-back and cozy atmosphere. According to my esteemed partner-in-dine, "It was a 'happy tummy' experience!"

5wbPJ8I6-iOcvHRcejahcw.text: One of my favorite spots for brunch (sans- kiddos) . So many great options including amazing green chilie dishes and bloody Mary's! Any time I'm in phx around brunch time (you know, 8-2) I want to indulge here!!! Dark and secluded, smells amazing. My only complaint is the occasional "cool" server who isn't all about customer service-- but that only happened once!!

liB7IgsXCnjYgCbNOXYLHQ.text: Just left the restaurant and tonight was one of the worst experiences ever! Started out pleasant welcomes .. my husband and I sat in the booths and ordered our favorites. I was very intrigued when the younger woman came to our table and stated she was the manager and wanted to know if everything was to our liking?. She however, didn't listen to any of the words out of my nor husbands mouths and nodded her head , and said that's excellent..as though it was rehearsed ... and left the table. It was as though she didn't HEAR ANYTHING we had said. It was insulting and not sure we will return unless there is actual " managers who listen!"

uWj_9aHO1AFTeJHrmGn2ZQ.text: I can't move beyond the scolding I received for attempting to sit at one of the three empty tables in the bar area. It was on off-peak time and indeed the tables remained unused for the duration of my visit, and my only option was the main bar with lighting inadequate for my planned perusal of the Phoenix New Times.  I'm not sure why the New Mexico platter includes bacon-wrapped shrimp. Is that a traditional New Mexican offering? The chicken burro was somewhere between Applebee's and movie theater concession caliber. The relleno was good. But the best part of this platter is the chile. The green is as excellent as its reputation and the red gives a fiery kick.  The carne adovada sliders put the red chile to good use and were also larger than typical sliders.

UfbWYwEkTVOz0KWHiPrANQ.text: Dicks has the best breakfast on the planet. I get the meatloaf, 3 eggs with the red chili and green chili. The scallops are also amazing. All their dishes have flavors that pop. Everything goes great with their cold drinks and fresh squeezed OJ. It's the first place I take my guest from out of town.

31FjXiLDtN7BFXOkoYyucA.text: One of my favorite brunches in town. So nice to go when it cools off and sit at the bar in front of the warm open air kitchen. Portions are huge and served on hot metal plates so your food stays hot during the entire meal. Cheap mimosas and bloodys too! As far as places go grab a good brunch on a weekday, this is my favorite.

0fK3PYU5fbSKq4vuaBqztA.text: Good food. Hard to find. I get the "hide away" aspect, but for those of us out of town people just give a clue there is no sign, maybe on your website. We circled the block 3 times before asking the nice people at The Swizzle Stick where it was. This isn't the Sunset Strip people, get a small sign. While the food is okay, I had a bad experience in the Transgender bathroom with a male employee and a very drunk female patron. Needless to say the employee didn't wash his hands after whatever went down in the bathroom.  I expressed my concern to our waiter who seemed not in the least bit shocked. At the end of the night I couldn't finish my food due to the gross-out factor. Not even a beer was comped.  Obviously no regard for the customer's experience.

JtpxR6JQWQG-x_KGRKvjQQ.text: Went in for Sunday morning brunch last weekend. I'm on a mission to find the best Bloody Mary in the valley, and Dick's did not have that.. the Bloody was pretty thin & generic. Meh.  The food, on the other hand, was delicious. Mexican-inspired menu- I had enchiladas & eggs. Huge portion, so so yummy. The ambience was cool, too. Really small but felt cozy and I forgot I was in a shopping plaza in the middle of uptown Phx. I'll be back, I just won't get a Bloody.

puEhfHC25jg79M0bpkJjzw.text: The closest authentic New Mexican chile in the Phoenix area. Instead of the standard green chili pork and red and green "sauce" that many Mexican restaurants serve here, Dick's has actually chile straight from NM. As others have said, this place is not the most visible establishment. It is on the side of strip mall facing 16th Street. The place does fill up quickly and is not very large. However, it is worth whatever small wait there might be. The portions are huge and service is fast.

QCFTmGCkXReut2ddG9p0UQ.text: Here is what you need for an afternoon of unproductivity. One plate of Carne adovada and 2 bloody Mary's.  Bring your friends, leave the kids at home.  Small and cozy so strike for a good seat when you can.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The best view you can have on a Sunday morning/afternoon.

NqVHNvFqui2o26ZJqdX0nQ.text: Go. But also don't go because I want to keep this place as much a secret as possible! ;-)  Ok, where to start...atmosphere is killer. Think the coolest dive bar mixed with a diner/hipster restaurant. Service is consistently amazing. Drinks are generous, delicious and awesome variety.  And the food...good lord. It's incredible. You can see the chefs behind the bar cooking everything fresh. Everything comes out hot and flavored are astonishing. It's absolutely the best food I've had out in years. We've been for brunch a couple times and dinner too. I can say confidently order anything, it'll knock your socks off. Reasonably priced bc honestly I'd pay double for food this good.  Only con is the wait. Place is small, so go on off hours if you wanna get in right away. But really, even the con is a good sign since it means people keep coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Now that&#39;s a mimosa!

V7sIpuXtKm0mAsJuUt5ntA.text: Always spectacular. Amazing food, great service, and a fun and intimate atmosphere. As a vegetarian, I don't have a ton of options as far as the dishes, but that's ok because the relleno and veg and cheese enchiladas are all excellent. Sometimes the red sauce makes me sweat. And I like that.

BCJ4mwOkb0Xp9kORASPg3A.text: I have been wanting to try this place out with all the good reviews and the great pictures!  It is not easy to find, like some yelpers warned.  We drove by it at first, even with the help of the navigation!  I never even saw a sign.  I finally found it by the sign on the door about the unattended children that I saw on one of the pics!    It is a pretty small place.  They have basically 2 rooms,  one a bar and a dining room so it is not that big.  It was pretty darkly lit but not too dark.  We sat at the bar which is also where they prepare the food.  It was fun watching them do their thing.  I was impressed that they grill over pecan wood!  When I saw that they had 2 skewers of rotisserie chicken I decided that was what I wanted.  I figured they had the chicken as an entree.  Unfortunately, the chicken was only for their chicken enchiladas!  What a tease!  They really should think about putting this on the menu.  I'm not sure if they cook the chicken every day, however.  Before we left they took the 8 chickens and put in a large plastic bin and, I assume, they would go into the cooler to save for the next day's chicken enchiladas.  I wonder how long they keep the chicken?  They have a pretty good selection on the menu plus quite a few specials on the chalkboard.  I had the grilled fish.  I think it was swordfish.  It was grilled over the pecan.  They also take half a pepper, put seasoned mashed potatoes on it and put that on the grill too.  Most of the orders that I saw had this on it as a side.  The fish was grilled to perfection, not overcooked which will ruin most fish.  Dry fish is no fun!   The salad was also very good.    I was close to giving them a 5 star review but had to take away one for the chicken issue,  but 4 is still a high review! I'll be back!

Yse-isw38SWN3OamlUw7vQ.text: This place is so small and cute...consists of a bar and 3 tables!!!  My husband and I started with the Mexican questi dip.  This was very tasty!  It's a cheese and  spinach dip topped with chorizo...added a nice kick!  My husband got the enchiladas and LOVED them.  I had some specialty dish (forgot name) and it was amazing as well.  The food is authentic and delicious!    The servers were so nice and explained the menu as it is our first time.  I would come back for sure, just be careful or you may miss the place all together!!  My only  complaint was that one customer at the bar was watching porn which was unusual and hilarious to my husband and I.  We will come back for sure, food was delicious!!

-qqd-D_XRdlImroioZGWhw.text: The food here is amazing!! Had one of the best Chorizo burritos ever!! Service is spot on and you get to meet new people!! Highly recommend if your looking for amazing Mexican food and some adult beverages!!

sJrBuONtbsStJrSWeg942Q.text: Ok so I rode around and around unable to find this place. They need some better signage although the crowd inside says that business with or without a sign is just fine. Ok so it's hidden in the shopping center. It's a small place with booth, table, and bar sitting as soon as you walk through the door. The menu is diverse offering all types of Mexican cuisine. I had the calamari with the sweet chili sauce . My friend had some type of pasta and omitted the chicken. She said it was good. I'll take her word lol. I wasn't really hungry but I'll go back and try some other stuff.

wdjd-juBrykzzwKN0UbtUw.text: I love the atmosphere of this joint and their unique menu priceless!  HH is wonderful!  This could be a reg place to Hangout. B

5qnCIF2flDRvMLmwXDUXsA.text: Hard pass.   Why all the 4 & 5 star reviews? Because someone wasn't raised well. That's why.   This is an awkward old dive bar that includes hardly good service and below subpar food.   I've eaten excellent New Mexican food. This isn't it. This is over priced and over salted cuisine with Spanish names. Everything is over done or under cooked.   Appetizers should also come hot. Not room temperature.   Fun Fact:   When you charge $27 for plate, it should at least be an upgrade from Chilis.   I will not blame this on this specific restaurant because I do not know if it was caused by Dicks or not. But I didn't feel well after dining here. We were left without water a lot so we initially thought it could have been that. However I did end up violently ill that night and part of me thinks it has everything to do with this place.

-3ydZinXq8MfeaqZjcTBYA.text: I love this little restaurant! I sat at the bar and ordered ribs. I think it was supposed to be an appetizer, but it was definitely enough for a meal. They were so tender, like fall-off-the-bone tender. I've been for brunch as well, and it is probably one of my favorite places to eat for brunch. Everything I've ever gotten was very high-quality. The prices are above average, but it deserves to be. The mimosas aren't half bad either. This place is absolutely superb!

P6M-LcHzlkJCIDKP9Zy9lw.text: If I could give extra stars I would... this place is great. The service was amazing and food was so Good! Prices are a little on the high side, but totally worth it.

H3S1rqEdxxDnKikLW655Hw.text: My husband and I got the worst food poisoning in the world from brunch at this place. We were violently ill for four days and I was pregnant at the time. From the moment we got there, it smelled and tasted off and we only ate a couple of bites before leaving.

Vwjor3qMxZEvv_POgRj04w.text: This little hole in the wall is one of my favorite weekend breakfast places. I get there right when they open so I don't have to worry about parking or waiting for a seat. Every thing in their menu is delicious.

hKw2T0t0_SoznxUJMk5GfA.text: This is a great happy hour spot with an interesting vibe, good people watching, and tasty food!  Before getting on a plane to get back to LA, we stopped at this local-filled spot and enjoyed New Mexican food.  I love that this place is not afraid to bring the heat as well as the flavor!  The Roasted Garlic Plate is huge and full of melted cheese, roasted elephant garlic, salsas, and other tasty bits.  You really need a group to eat all of this!  The two of us gave our best effort, however!   The Carne Adovada and Eggs was delicious, too!  All the portions here are huge, so be prepared.  I wish we could've grabbed a spot in the bar, but it was already full.  We still enjoyed all the happy hour specials in the restaurant area and had good service.  Good local spot to stuff yourself silly!

UwvppSSir7RaK6XlcZXPRw.text: Always a wonderful experience. One of my favorite spots in the valley. The blackened scallops, stuffed mushrooms, chimayo chicken were delicious. Dick's also has fabulous selection of hand crafted drinks and wine. You must try the creme brulee. Keep up the amazing services!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool atmosphere!
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Absolutely delicious!
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome drinks!

Gnhn4fdPkTHyEAR2UM-Ycg.text: Food was very good and had great flavors. We really enjoy our experience. I feel like you get more than what you pay for. I think my brunch entree was sour $15 but I got 2 full meals out of it. Great place and can be hard to find. Totally worth it. A friend from New Mexico visiting loved it and said it reminded her of home.

7dIECXEpsXvqD6Wg_vr1bg.text: This place is a hidden gem, for sure. You can find me here for brunch any day.. love the intimate feel and amazing service! They have a private wine room that's perfect for a small group dinner.. bar and dining area with a small dining space upstairs that would be ideal for a group of 10! I ordered a special carnitas omelette with avocado.. the red sauce and cheese makes the dish unique and extra tasty. My friend ordered the chicken quesadilla, and we shared a Caesar salad- both items were great! And they have pretty big portions. Our other friend ordered the Heidi pasta- they make their own noodles, and it is truly delicious! Would be ideal for a first date for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caesar salad
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House salad
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Heidi pasta

GGBfpVDf0Gw7E0Mgqre7sw.text: Rachel is the non ephemeral entity that blessed me with a experience that was truly exceptional. I think I may love her. Go dicks!

5YGJWEkdyD1MbWQVCxPjJg.text: Didn't take too long to find and once I did, I was very happy.    The caesar salad was solid (except no anchovies).  For our appetizers, we had the bacon wrapped shrimp (might have been a tad overcooked), the stuffed mushrooms, and the garlic platter (delicious!).   For my main, I had the chorizo stuffed pork chops with the mango sauce.  They weren't necessarily stuffed, just two chops on top of one another with the chorizo in the middle (yeah! more chops!).  Great flavor, the pork was tender and juicy and the sweet (mango) and savory (chorizo) complemented one another well.  I'll be hard pressed to order something different the next time I go.  The food was 4.5 stars and the service was a solid 5.  Two things swung me to four stars.  We had a group of six so they put us in this weird room next to the bar  and we sat at this large L shaped table.  Made it difficult to have a conversation. Additionally, that room was hot.

cbg9gkVOpWJYl74Zf0M-PA.text: This is a fun, cool, dark atmosphere. The scallops and mushroom toast are awesome and the drinks are always good. This is a relaxed small atmosphere and the bar is close to the serving area. It's cool to see the cooks cooking in the kitchen. Overall enjoyable.

Lp02ZDSR2pWDdaGetaFU8g.text: Ok so I walked in and saw jesus christ covered in hatch green Chile and I exploded. From extazy. Goooo dicks!

GkFmpX8tAgQo2vfGdw4EdQ.text: This comment is strictly for the guy in the glasses behind the bar. We got there today around noon and I brought my son. I didn't realize that it is frowned upon to take a kid. I was looking for a high chair and the guy was rude. However what really pissed me off is when he brought the food, he didn't say that the plate was super hot(not warm-hot- I'm talking oven-hot). Luckily my arm hit it and not my son who was sitting on my lap within reach of the plate. I guess as lucky as it was for my son, it was lucky for him because the plate would have been placed against his face if my son had been burnt. Good food but won't be back. Now I know why it's called Dick's Hideaway- because of him.

g32cS__gjkLPSWlzZmj8tA.text: If you want your tastebuds to tingle, this is the place to go. It's literally a hideaway. You have no idea it's there because there isn't any signage. But wow. Flavor dot com! I ordered the Rellenos and eggs. An enormous platter with two large chiles stuffed with beef n cheese, topped with red and green sauce, beans, tortilla, potatoes, all topped with three fried eggs! Wow oh wow. It was super tasty and delicious. We ordered the bacon wrapped jalapenos to start and boy they were spicy! They weren't stuffed with cream cheese but whatever it was, it was stingy cheesy goodness.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Relleno and eggs

iIiTOXlGgr_gNI-DlvlCyQ.text: WOW!! I had no preconceived ideas about that this place would be, but it blew my mind! The atmosphere made me nervous when we first walked in, you can't be afraid of people because it is a tight fit, and you may share a table with a stranger. But the waitstaff is excellent and quickly made me feel very comfortable. This is such a quirky place!! I explored the restaurant there are little rooms tucked away. Even the bathrooms are super interesting! Then cane the food! We ordered off the happy hour menu so we could try a few things. We tried roasted pork mole sliders, lobster sliders, bacon wrapped shrimp Jake Leno's, and the roasted garlic plate. Phenomenal!!! Every thing we pick was superbly done!! The garlic cloves were the largest I've ever seen!! Wow, wow, WOW!! We will definitely be back! Try this place, you will not be disappointed!!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wAqCx3VfBocJBRS_EMQxTw.text: Hidden restaurant with no sign out front.  Food and drinks are great but I have only been here for breakfast and brunch and or hangover drinks.  The restaurant is very small and intimate although there are a few tables to the right.

fW3YQdihrPg9Jteei4ldww.text: I live pretty close to here and never realized it was there! It's such a neat little idea and place that it's now one of my favorite restaurants! It's tucked away in a clean, well kept shopping center with no sign or advertisements. You could park right in front of it and miss not realize it's there. Walking in, you see that it is clean and cozy. It's a small place that is pretty creative with it's seating and I appreciate the uniqueness of the set up. To get to the other sitting area, you walk through part of the kitchen and you see how clean it is there too, which hits their score out of the park on "clean factor"! The service is very good as well. The staff takes care of your needs without all the unneccessary chatter to interrupt your evening, which I greatly appreciate. Now, for the good stuff- their food! Having tried several items off their menu, I can honestly say that I have not been dissappointed. Not even a little! The Carne Adovada is my favorite so far, with pork so soft and flavorful I can't help but order it every other time I go there! The red sauce they use in that dish is smooth and it is great with the eggs if you get the breakfast version of the plate. This place is great for breakfast, lunch and dinner, all occasions! Great for dates, or just a fantastic meal!

47ihYaRpwXaqZUjlt1HtGA.text: A new favorite spot in Central Phoenix. It's a fantastic hidden gem for a date night. It's very small inside, so a great spot for a late night dinner. An added bonus is there is a reverse happy hour that starts at 9 pm I believe. The food is out of this world. We started with the spicy chicken tostadas, great flavor and a big appetizer for 2 people. I got the enchiladas Christmas style (red & green sauce). I got the green chili pork, chicken, and shrimp enchiladas and they were some of the best I've ever had. They have a lot of great daily specials that I can't wait to check out next time. Great food, service, ambiance. You can't go wrong here.

yT9cL_23-3qYFwkuN_IoQA.text: Great happy hour spot! The locals certainly know it is a good deal because the place was packed.  We were waiting for a flight back to LA and we stopped in. Beers are $2 off and they have a nice selection of food for $6 and up.  My favorite was the Duck Relleno. Yes, duck and I enjoyed every bite of the large portion for only $6.  They also have select wines, house Margaritas, and well drinks for $5.   Plenty of parking around back if you cant find any in the front.

iul5At3l0zQ9WEqmvHMYXg.text: Meatloaf for brunch? Why not.  There are times I feel I've locked myself in a bubble when it comes restaurant rotations. If I have to drive there, I typically don't go there. But Terry T was returning from China and organized a catching-up brunch. It had been years since I've been here, and I forgot how much I love Dick's! Of course it was packed when we went on Sunday, but that didn't stop us from getting great service.  And trust me: the meatloaf was amazing!

VOeKzfNLVvD9IiKIYZpb1w.text: We came her for a friends birthday party. First off everyone has no clue where the front door is at. We walked around the building twice until we Found the door. This place is super small. So this place gets one star for the ambience and back story.  The other star is for the mash potato stuff green chili. The menu we got had no prices. I had the green pork mole. The waiter said it's smoked for 8 hours. This was like a chunk of beef that tasted like pulled out of the crock pot with green sauce poured on top.  Typically mole is simmered in sauce for hours.My wife had the fish medley plate. For $15 I would say it's an awesome plate. For $37 I would like for it to knock my socks off a little and it didn't.  My friends had the bone in prime rib. Big chunk of tasteless meat. Between the two of us it was around $90 that with no alcohol.

mcrAGmu7YxzJ1975m-X1-Q.text: The food here is amazing! 4 Stars just for the food. New Mexican food cooked well, tasted so good. 5 Stars for the establishment and I loved the decor. The customer service was great. I liked to watch sports with my friends and chill. Will be coming back here if I am back at his city.

u8e3UIqbyCxibH0LqJfX9g.text: Hideaway is the perfect name for this little gem.   Have been there for dinner and brunch when in the mood for New Mexican style off.   Food is spicy and delicious.  Ordered the carne adobada eggs Benedict and it rocked my world.  No shortage of food and portions are large.   Very cozy little place.   Love it!

DV7XDiNK4slaZvzw30vIPg.text: What a great find! Seriously the food was amazing! Nothing to complain about. The only thing you have to beware of is the server chasing me down to my car asking if I took his pen. Other than being accused of a pen thief everything was great lol

wLRBU7p2VDP9N3fkuMYM6w.text: Excellent food!!!!  Great service and atmosphere.  We loved our meal- Meal #1: enchiladas (2 cheese and 1 shredded beef) Christmas style (green and red chile) with rice n beans  Meal #2: 2 happy hour tamales (corn n poblano with green and red chile) and a bowl of beans with red chile and cheese.  Everything was absolutely delicious!!!  The chile was spicy and flavorful.  Washed everything down with a couple of glasses of happy hour wine and Helton pilsners.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corn and poblano tamales (red n green chile) with a bowl of beans.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enchilada trio with rice n beans

3zyIbzpaNFdW39ZmS3EaeQ.text: New Mexican cuisine done right! This place is awesome from it's cool small hidden location. To it's "No Kardashian's allowed" sign in the restaurant. I've been going to this spot for years. Nothing has changed it's always consistently delicious food. The Chimayo Chicken is a home run for bird lovers! Check Dick's out you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

M34dnC0ff045qsI_4NAcug.text: Dicks is just like Richardson and are owned by the same people. The Atmospheres are dark and I really good for a hangover. Also good for a date night if you both want to eat like a lot. The food is Mexican cuisine or Spanish style and I highly recommend the enchiladas or any of the meat dishes. So good!

q1tS07Ls2bS3e-XvfOcMIA.text: I have been coming to Dick's for the best weekend brunches since 1998!!! Yes folks, it's True. My go to is their Enchiladas and Eggs combo. Simply the best New Mexican enchiladas ever in the state of Arizona.  Aside from their food, their bloody mary's are top notch. My favorite part about this is that they are super spicy with a beer chaser of your choice. I've taken many friends here that have not had brunch at this place and everyone loves it.

G3bU4yR2FaqhZe_EvrV2Rw.text: Dick's Hideaway is just one of those cool, hidden gems. I've been here a few years ago, but the parking is horrendous and the restaurant is so small that it would be hard to find a spot at peak times.   We were lucky to visit for happy hour around 3pm before the crowd comes. We ordered from the happy hour menu: Carne Adovada sliders, Crab empanadas, Calamari, and Bacon Wrapped Shrimp. There's a kick to the dishes so be prepared if you cannot deal with spicy food at all. My fave was the bacon wrapped shrimp and empanadas, but you really can't go wrong with any of the plates especially since they are all $6 each. Hell yes...

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne adovada sliders (hh)
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crab empanadas (hh)
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Calamari (hh)

VEucjUq7hfLUq28OJT5pxQ.text: A very nice little place. The food here is really good, the portion to match and the prices little above average. In my honest opinion, places that do not pretend to be something they are not, are my kind of places. The pork shoulder and eggs is one of my favorite breakfast dishes. I don't have to eat anything else until the next morning. Going back for more, is a given.

Z1pIY86uRXphG3PhlMXbFA.text: Used to be one of our favorites. This Monday that changed. I can understand a restaurant being busy with the holiday and all but this was bad! It started with the wait. The restaurant was packed and the poor staff had no clue who had checked in and who didn't. They took people that had just walked in before some that had been waiting for awhile. Same thing happened when it came time to take our orders at the communal table.     I have an allergy to cow's milk (not dairy) and I specifically let the waitress know what I can and can't have and I ordered accordingly. Our waitress though took it upon herself to eliminate all the dairy from my meal, except for the cheese the kitchen decided to put on my salad, yup, that's cow's milk.  Not to mention how long it took for just our salads to come out, about 25 mins. Interestingly enough, it only took a couple of minutes for a new salad to come out with no cheese. When my meal finally arrived there was no hollandaise sauce on it. It was a dry, overcooked piece of chicken with mushrooms and brussel sprouts with no seasoning what so ever. I had to request that be brought out and some butter for the vegetables so I could dress them myself. I was beyond through. We were there for almost 2 hours, while we watched 4 different parties come and go at our communal table while we sat painfully through this ordeal. I guess it wouldn't have been so bad if our service was better, but to have the service AND the food fail was too much. I hope they get it together.

wX8pn5dw03LiaPju6TV3Bw.text: Great food, friendly and feisty service. Bloody Mary happy drinks are great. The place is pretty inconspicuous but is usually busy and fun. Bonus, the kitchen is right in front of you at the bar and the cooks kill it.

4SZfbkoB3oP6JGOn1d628w.text: Great food, pictures don't do it justice.  Large portions, easy to split with someone else.   Hard to find, no signs, but the place is packed. Ok there is one sign the says: "Sorry you found us" We had 8 for dinner, on the high price for dinner, but worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. If this is the kids menu?
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Front door, that&#39;s it
