ywypgxrXUBFDg18Bl-_TnA.text: Solid option if you are looking for large portions of well made mexican food. The enchiladas are large and flavorful. The food isn't anything extroardinary, but the dishes are classic and made right.

dTDJ_GeM7eQLls0pfxHjqg.text: Not enough good things to say about this place!! A little dark at first entrance, but the food is fresh made and terrific. They nailed it as far as doing NM cuisine with just the right twists! My favs are the pasta Heidi and the special Sea Bass!! And whatever you get don't forget the sweet potato filled green chilies!!! Lots of nice beers on tap tap too!!

AlCOC59koNdHCzOPAxcLqA.text: This place is definitely an experience. First of all, i drove around the parking lot three times before i finally decided to just park and walk till I found it. It kind of reminded me of an old speakeasy in some senses.   At first, I was disappointed in the menu because I have strong New Mexican ties and I didn't really see any True authentic cuisine. Their were a couple of dishes, two or three tops, but for the most part it wasn't real authentic New Mexican cuisine. I almost left to go to another restaurant because of this and I'm glad that I didn't because the food was amazing!  If you're looking for authentic New Mexican cuisine, this isn't the place. Regardless, this is still an amazing place to eat. If I could make one recommendation is that I would rebrand it as a Latin food restaurant or remake their menu to have more New Mexican food (and of course give complimentary chips and salsa since that's the True New Mexican way).   Even though I didn't think that this is a True New Mexican restaurant, I'll still go back.

g3HVQJNyAuJixsjFKZO1XQ.text: First and last time here.   Not only was it literally a hideaway it took us forever to find it. There is legit no signs leading to it. You gotta look online to find it. We tried last week and gave up. The menu sounded good so we looked it up and tried again this weekend. Which, I'm kinda disappointed we cared that much. Cause it sucked.   From walking in and getting yelled at it was strike one. My friend and I were literally barely sitting at a bar stool and a server walks up and goes um can you sit together? I said we're just sitting down while my friend was setting her purse down. We had to quickly sit down because some other customers nearly ran us over. I'm sorry, but getting told what to do by a random server when it's an open bar frustrates me as is. We barely had one butt cheek on the barstool before getting told where to move.   The service was good other than that. We had several people check on us and make sure we were taken care of.   The plates were SUPER HOT and no one told us they literally bake the food on there. I burned my arm. That felt great.   The place was so hot I couldn't enjoy my food. It was 100 degrees In there. We were literally dripping in sweat while trying to eat our food. The food was pretty good but not worth the getting yelled at, being burned, and hot temperature of the place.   As I told my friend. Doesn't hurt to try a place at least once. But, this will be our first and last time here.

lwVkLzv_O_6ked3-a3eLAw.text: I got used to eating beans and potatoes for breakfast living in NM and this place is legit the best New Mexican food than any I've had from Albuquerque all the way south to the border.   I can think of no where else I'd like to be nursing a hangover on a Sunday morning. It's hard to get a seat but I always get lucky and grab a spot at the bar. It's dark and cozy, a nice place to hide.   You'll have to make the ultimate decision between red and green chile. They're both amazing but maybe too spicy for some so you can get a small sample of each before choosing.   I usually go for the carne adovada and eggs but the enchiladas and chile rellanos are also beyond good. I'm a red chile kind of person... The wine selection is great and mimosas are on point. The bloody Mary's are so hot they serve them with a beer chasers so be aware. Dick's does dinner too but brunch is served until three and I can't get enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UWBWb4vzKg5GQUq7cVb-kQ.text: Food not good. I ordered a chicken burrito with rice and beans.  The chicken was like those frozen chicken strips you get at Safeway, the sauce was tasteless and the rice and beans the same.  I ate a third and left the rest.  I have eaten Mexican food all over Mexico and the US Southwest.  If these people who give this place a high rating really think this is good Mexican food, then they need to get out more..... Much more! Taco Bell has tastier food.  The bar has room for 6, they cram 9 people in there so everyone is breathing in your food. The ceilings are low, the place is cramped and noisy.  The staff starts barking questions at you the moment you enter.  Overall a bad dining experience, I won't go back.

fVNi9zGW7Zny_B2Z8jRAVQ.text: Unbelievably good- this place is a gem. Everything we ate exceeded expectations with the New Mexican sausages topping the list.  Deeply flavorful with the perfect level of spice. This was the best meal I have had in my many visits to Phoenix. Thank you Dick's for this little slice of green chili heaven.

ZunEEjkbhTVrj4dRwUqpUg.text: You look inside and think it's a small bar. Then you dig a little deeper and see a beautiful restaurant. This is NOT a dive bar, but it kinda looks like one. This is NOT cheap eats, but you might expect it to be. What is it? The ABSOLUTE BEST breakfast I've ever had. Amazing tamales, enchiladas, tortillas, meat, even the eggs, beans and hash browns are perfectly cooked. Only had coffee this time, but I imagine a bloody mary or screwdriver may be in order next time. Order anything, you'll be satisfied and probably have enough for 2 or 3 meals. Wow, just wow!

QJIe8wuVN3EUkwHXGUB-hg.text: Very friendly great food great proportions very tastey amazing drinks can't wait to go back all fresh cooked and made to order

CHnpcEmWbF849kU1JsV5ow.text: Great atmosphere! My friend from SoCal visited last weekend and we had some food and drinks. Little slow on getting our tab paid from staff. As a former New Mexico resident I will be back, love that you have my Hatch green chile and would recommend this to any of my New Mexico friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XlgpKb8Ls4tky8ftJFi-eg.text: I had a hard time finding this place because there's no exterior sign lol. I called to ask where exactly they were located and I was led in. The staff here is extremely friendly and efficient. The breakfast enchiladas are amazing. The only reason i didn't rate a five is because the beans could be improved.

rBlkrVdyAYrk-QGksAS2XQ.text: Dick's Hideaway is the smaller and cooler version of Richardson's.  This place will forever have a spot in my heart because they serve brunch until 4pm every day.  Yes, you read this correctly, Every Day.    When I lived in AZ, I stopped in a few times for drinks, but it took moving away and coming back to visit to finally come to my senses and order food.  Duh.  Happily settled in with my mimosa (scandalously on a Monday!) my friend and I enjoyed:  Carne Adovada Benedict  with hash browns - I cannot say enough good things about this.  The generous portion of delicious pork topped with two perfectly poached eggs completely hid the English muffins beneath.  I ordered this without the beans that usually accompany it, and there was still more food than I could possibly finish.  Carne Adovada & Eggs - more glorious pork, served with eggs (any style) and beans.  Roasted Garlic Plate - not quite sure what we were thinking when we added this to our (already large) order.  I was happy we did, though.  An enormous head of roasted garlic served with toasted bread, roasted chilies and cheese.  I was absolutely safe from vampires for the rest of the day.    Our bartender/waiter was fantastic.  Handing me another mimosa before I can even think of asking for it will make me love you forever.  For-Ev-Er!  A word of advice.  Don't touch the plates.  No matter how badly you may want to. They are HOT.  Trust me on this one, OK?

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Adovada Benedict with hash browns (no beans). I needed a nap after this - SO good!
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Safety first!!
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Haaaaaa!

ep6VelESyPQqx0J7BHMALw.text: By far THE BEST PLACE to eat in Phoenix!  The food paired with the atmosphere is completely SPOT ON when it comes to southwestern comfort food!  I've had the opportunity to come to Dick's only on a couple of occasions since I live out of state but it has now become my must-go-to-spot when I fly into town, even going so far as to adjust my flight schedule to accommodate my craving.  All I will say is SMOKED PORK!  OMG...it's like sensory overload when it comes the pork paired with the hollandaise sauce on the benedict and then you add the beans and potatoes, it's quite possibly the best breakfast on the planet!  Know before you go:  It's called "Hideaway" for a reason...it's virtually impossible to find.  Look for the hardware store and the door will be to the left.  There is no sign.  It's always crowded so be ready to sit at a community table if there is no room in the bar.  It may seem awkward but you can meet some interesting folks AND you have a great view of the fireplace with just a slight sent of mesquite.  Their Bloody Mary's are BOMB-diggity served with a shot of beer which I like to pour in.  Great hangover remedy!  They open early at 7am to accommodate my early arrival flights!  Booya!  Kids are not recommended and they're not afraid to tell you.

mUKs0lN45dk5lT_vD7yx5Q.text: THE BOMB!! Food and service was awesome.   It is a small place and they have shared tables but def worth it if you don't mind sharing a table.    I had the carne Benedict.  Only thing i would change is getting the english muffin on the side because the sauce made them so soggy.

Fpm5ag0fxLACfIL6jvqXTw.text: Absolutely amazing food. The beans and rice had this amazing fiery/smokey taste and the carne adovada was a home run.

2oQ4J7Nlq2PP0QTgtwSiwQ.text: the place is amazeballllls... the happy hour deal is just insane. we ordered a BUNCH of tapas/apps and drinks, and our total for 3 people was $90 - insane. service is quick and efficient too - and the waiters are pretty friendly. the food also tastes pretty good - my favorite item was probably the duck relleno - the mole was flavorful and spicy, and the duck was super tender.  sauce was perfect for those crunch tortilla chips!  was also a fan of the crab empanada.. my colleagues absolutely devoured the other tapas, including the chips n dip, lamb chops, calamari, and stuffed mushroom caps.  definitely would come back for hh again with my team!  note that the restaurant is tucked away and quite small - so get there early (or late!)

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips n dip
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ceviche
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Calamari!

e12-ZvGL9ESLap-XuLYlbA.text: Always great food and the service is on point. They always give you a healthy portion so bring an appetite. It's a little spicy but I recommend going with Christmas which is half red half green. Pork enchiladas are my go to for breakfast.

lOLgkXGpv-lauSt3lc41jg.text: I really enjoyed my experience here.  It's tucked away and I actually walked past it several times before it dawned on me which door to use.  The inside is dark and has a dive bar feel, though it's no dive bar.  I came here for lunch so there weren't many other customers, which definitely helped with the dive bar feel.  The food was really good!  Everything had great flavor and I really enjoyed the beans.  There was plenty of food and I found the price point to be good.  The service was good, I didn't want for anything.  I'm really glad I tried this place.

d5D4V3C5bu6yjTASDPftdA.text: A whole in the wall little gem. Drinks were great, house margarita was nice and I ordered beer because ...beer. At this point I was filled with beer and Mexican queso so I wasn't able to eat my Mexican platter , because ....beer. Anyway the service was very nice. Man bun was a sweet thing with a fine behind. He even Drew a little smile on my take home Container. So potential baby daddy. I highly recommend this, so give it a go. And beer !

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thank you man bun potential baby daddy . I enjoyed the smiley face the way home

1q1acdLfE4JTjpGARrieOQ.text: Liked it so much we ate there twice! Dick's was the top pick recommendation from a friend of a friend who lives in Phoenix. We headed there straight from the airport on the way to Sedona.  New Mexican cuisine is a rare treat.   Dark and pleasantly smoky from a wood burning fire, great margaritas and green chili pasta I can't stop thinking about. Unmarked but not hard to find. Winner!

1913TxH9w1zgHg2Y_-R06w.text: This is a hidden gem in Phoenix - Happy Hour is amazing. Leave your attitude at the door and be prepared to have a good time. Amazing food and drinks.  You must go here!!!

c2mA-yUg8vQ6cgLp6Pj6rA.text: Awesome service! Great drinks and appetizers! Jalisco mule was on hit! Bartenders were down to earth and very attentive. It's a 5 star in my book! Highly recommended. It's a plus when u got good music to chill to...

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Preview of the menu
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jalisco mule...yummy
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House margarita

PGJ9d7Qx8nMOIgHrFVUPDg.text: Great food and atmosphere. It's really more of a local hangout restaurant that does not care to cater to tourists which I find appealing. If you are a Kardashian or Carey this isn't your place. You don't judge the book by the cover here assuming you can find the restaurant as there is no external signs (by choice). A local friend brought us here and it was utterly amazing. The chicken tostado was amazing.... the Pasta Heidi.... oohh laaa laaa and the Chimayo Chicken was excellent too. We definitely recommend this for SW Mexican fare. Try the Rodney Strong Chardonnay as it was very smooth.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. And a little more humor
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sign above the door
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Exterior just so you know what to look for.

TocbRY4CBQg-Ws-LjuCdrA.text: This was my second time visiting for breakfast and I couldn't have been more pleased.  I had the adovada benedict with jalapeno hollandaise.  It was tremendous!  A touch of spice but not overpowering at all.  And the adovada; EXCEPTIONAL.  Served with perfectly done hash browns and pinto beans, I had to take half of it home with me for a second round.                                                    My girlfriend came for the French toast.  It's all she ever wants here and is worth the drive from Surprise.  Add some awesome local sausage to the plate and it's near nirvana!                                                         Seating is super limited so get there early and be thankful there are no signs or you'd never get in.

_0bCAN7t8E7FfimJa0bCSA.text: Well, I guess the name was a hint to its location because it is indeed hidden. There is no signage on the street or even on the door and parking is limited (additional spots behind the building). It's located between Luci's and TEXAZ Grill. Look for the address "6008" over the black vertical-barred doors. You enter to the bar and a few tables and there is additional seating on the right through a short hall. You seat yourselves.  Our server arrived quickly and along with the bartender made a wonderful and friendly team. Service was consistently great throughout our visit and our water glasses were always full. I also loved the laidback and mellow atmosphere of the restaurant. Great spot for a date!  We came for brunch (served daily until 4pm) --  Spicy Chicken Tostadas ($9): Three tostadas topped with salsa fresca. The menu deceptively says mini, but the tostadas are as large as an appetizer plate and piled high with lettuce and marinated chicken. The chicken, although slightly dry, were flavorful and the tostadas were delightfully crispy. I could eat a few of these.  Carne Adovada Benedict ($14): Two poached eggs, English muffin, Carne Adovada, jalapeno hollandaise, beans, and potatoes. I was really excited about this dish because I have a thing for unique eggs benedicts, however, it was just okay. I didn't really enjoy the adovada as I could only taste the chilies. I liked the addition of jalapeno in the hollandaise. Beware: it's spicy!  Pasta Heidi ($16): Green chile linguine, grilled chicken, and chipotle cream sauce. This is a wonderful dish! The pasta was cooked perfectly and the sauce was delicious. It had the right amount of spice without being overpowering. A little on the heavier side, so it doesn't hurt to share the plate with someone else. Highly recommended!

UBhdOzJm7Co0z3f2BmKAEw.text: When did they get rid of my favorite bartender and hire all these old people who don't know how to serve and are just creepy as hell

98j9LMSwkJGqXFm8cFcFrg.text: Absolutely incredible!  It was so good I came back for breakfast which was also amazing. I wish I would have found this place earlier.

bjDCkm413iJvkPhKlkl4kQ.text: Ate at Dicks for breakfast after landing in Phoenix. We checked out a few places here on yelp and decided that Dicks reviews were the best for what we were looking for. The portions were large, the interior was dark, wait staff friendly.   All in all everything we look for in a good breakfast place was checked off. The wife had Blueberry pancakes that were fluffy and delicious, I went for the Eggs breakfast with the NM sausage.  Eggs came out over easy as requested and the sausage hit the spot.  Would definitely go here again and recommend to anyone in Phoenix. Just get here early, it's a smaller place with a hell of a line.

qKmgVdzyYhJvIw3LSVUYsg.text: I was blown away by the Food and Service! Went on a Sat night and got seated right away. Drinks, Apps and Entrees were soooo good!!

BI86NNZj2kc9mpk4MAIbQg.text: The carne adovada dish with eggs on top is to die for.  The restaurant also has a fantastic ambiance.  Wine racks floor to ceiling, low lighting, and an obscure entrance all contribute to a nice, cozy feeling inside.

uS-WaKUXH9cuwtpJ0p96NA.text: This is literally a hidden gem on 16th Street and Bethany Home. There is no signage outside so you just have to find it. The place is TINY, essentially a bar and a few tables and a function room behind the usually closed door by the entrance. As with their sister restaurant Rokerij, the smell of burning wood permeates the place. They serve beer and cocktails and have a good selection of wine. The food here is great. If you don't mind waiting this is a great place for brunch. The green chile meatloaf is probably my favorite-it is served over a tortilla with beans and two eggs. OH IT IS SOOOOO GOOD!!!! I also had green chile stew which was fantastic as well. One of my favorite places to hit in Phoenix.

wT41D93Rdgtiskw1rklSoQ.text: Undoubtedly one of the best places to eat in PHX. Do not come here to fetch a seat right away or call to make a reservation. Not that kind of place. Place is always packed because the food is killer. First come first serve. Look for the steel doors as there is no sign. Been eating here for 16 years and never had a problem getting a seat. New Mexican styled cuisine. Almost everything is cooked over a wood grill. Great daily specials. Stiff cocktails and great wine selection. Try the prickly pear margarita! GARLIC PLATE, GREEN CHILI BURGER, PORK CHOP CHORIZO, CHIMAYO CHICKEN, EGGS BENEDICT JALAPENO, are some great choices. Can also try their other restaurants Richardson's and Rokerij right up the street.

OJAGJKtUicH1c3Xo2tbGtw.text: I have been at dicks around 5 times and it never disappoints. I shared the blueberry pancakes and the carne adovado with gf the first time and it was so good that we couldn't get ourselves to order anything else there  yet. Friends have tried diner there and professed equally good reviews.  And the service is top notch

LDn5Ztsaamn5CPFTKusjXw.text: EXCELLENT!!!! Love the atmosphere, the FOOD, and the down to earth servers that handle it like a boss! Favorite phoenix brunch!

ynIfYM9-YIAVzGbizM22pw.text: My wife and I went to Dick's one morning for breakfast, when we were in Phoenix last month, based on the Yelp ratings.  It was so good, we returned the following day also.  The huevos rancheros are very good, as are the bloody marys (served with a beer back).  The atmosphere (literally - how many place have a mesquite wood grill burning in the kitchen) is great.  Can't wait to go back and eat more of the menu.

rbl3hK5vUfEJNitcE_TwZA.text: Disappointed - I've been wanting to try Dick's Hideaway for a while now.  Tried to get in yesterday but there wasn't any seating available.  A server told us that we needed to get out of his way and we might as well go somewhere else, which is exactly what we did.  I won't be going back.

d5vUy8MAUGwT5TmX-C2vmA.text: Dick's Hideaway is adorable and charming, which is a rarity in Phoenix.  As I walked into the restaurant, I immediately saw it as the kind of place that I could bring out of town guests to in an effort to convince them that unique, soulful restaurants can exist within strip malls.  We sat at the bar and ordered a beer and a glass of wine - good selection at reasonable prices.  For our meals, we decided on the Chimayo Chicken and the Tamale Plate.  Unfortunately, both were mediocre.  The chicken was a little bland and sounded better on the menu than it tasted, which at $24 was annoying.  The tamales were dry, although when we got some extra red chile to put on top, they improved a bit.  I still have high hopes for Dick's Hideaway, but I'll need to hunt to find the best menu items before bringing guests here: 3 stars

j_n-Qziq3gB5U0cfRRNiiw.text: Carne Adovada.... Ugh. What can I say?! I usually don't even like beef. Spectacular. Get it to share though. I ate it for the next three meals. Coffee was also better than i had expected. Not that I was complaining. Great atmosphere, great food.

zd0ZbVWPX75xFytMVyVnEg.text: Happy hour small plates are the way to go. Good value at $5 per plate and good tasting. We returned for dinner and it was underwhelming. I got the skewers and watch the cook throw them on the grill and them proceed to get torched by the flames. My girlfriend got a Mexican platter and her burrito was cold in the middle and the tamale was not that good.

zwHSjd1k1cPPTdPTLxtyog.text: The best Breakfast I have had in at least 10 years. When we walked in the whole place had this wonderful mesquite campfire smell. The carne asada I ordered was amazing. It had the perfect amount of charred, smoky, red chille flavoring and made this one memorable meal.

fJT2Fm7WlmzayQfSuGy7qg.text: A chef at another restaurant in Scottsdale suggested this place and for that I am grateful.  Truly hidden away, I drove past it a few times, then finally pulled into a lot to call and ask if they were still open and confirm their address (if you see Lucy's, go one door over).  Small and dark upon entrance, I took a seat at the bar.  The menu was to drool over and caused me to waver between something with pork loin or something more Southwestern.  I opted for tha latter.  I had the shrimp enchiladas with beans, red chile sauce, scrambled eggs, and potatoes.  The first bite was kind of strange since it was a food combination I was not used to, but soon I was devouring it like manna in the desert and did not leave a morsel over.  I did not partake, but they also had mimosas for $5. If I return to the Phoenix are, I definitely would return.  I would love to check out lunch or dinner.   Worth the search!

TikmyNrOj2CQOfADnr1Dfg.text: Awesome.  A little hard to find, just park in strip mall and walk to the barely marked door.  Try it, you won't regret it.

13f9cxdVM7YbForztRnAfg.text: This place really is a hideaway.  I think we drove by it twice before calling to discover it's in between the mart at the end and the hardware store.  Also, it's pretty tiny.  Just a bar and 3 1/2 tables.  It looks like they did have a small place for groups when you walk in on the right.  The place was super cozy and inviting and the service was great.  One of the servers was a fellow gaucho so instant connection, obviously.  Food:  ROASTED GARLIC PLACE- A MUST!!!!!!  This dish is crazy good.  Sure a lot of garlic is never amazing for the stomach, but it's well worth it.  The plate comes with a huge roasted garlic, sauteed peppers covered in 3 different sauces smothered in melted cheese, and all on a flour tortilla underneath.  It really was the most amazing thing.  Also this is SUPER FILLING!    Blue, red and white corn enchiladas and Carne Adovada-  Both of these were nothing amazing and awfully hard to follow after the garlic plate.  We both agreed that for main dishes we enjoyed our food at Carlsbad Tavern the previous night.  Maybe it was because of what we ordered.  A shrimp quesadilla to me was foreign and not super enjoyable.  The rice was ok.  And everything seemed really greasy.  Also the play list was AWESOME.  From Rolling Stones to the Band to Tom Petty, I absolutely loved the music and in general the atmosphere of this place.  Overall, I almost wish we had stopped with our negra modelos (on tap!!) and the roasted garlic place.  Everything was still good but not as amazing as the garlic plate!

vkzUXEJRma8nGPuRkq1VeA.text: As others have said they have no sign so you need the address. They do have a menu posted outside with their name on it so you will know you are in the right place. The food is good and the service was great. Not a large place. I had the Huevos Rancheros with red chile. This is more of a New Mexico style than Sonoran style.

4LjbLti3UQto8K4Oyjs8BA.text: Fun little place, really tucked away.  Good food and Bloody Marys served with a beer sidecar.   The meatloaf had a great kick.  Staff was friendly and efficient. We'll definitely be back.

BOY0ZpCH1NUenGeoZVVrxg.text: It's hard to find. We were parked right in front of the place and didn't see it. But once we realized we were there, we walked in and found Dick's Hideaway was literally a hole in the wall. It was small and dark, but we could tell immediately that what they lacked in size, they made up for in large, delicious plates! In fact, their dishes are so large they can be easily shared for up to two people. They had whole chickens roasting over an open fire pit. That was pretty cool. Don't expect to go dancing after, as your clothes and your hair will smell deliciously of food.   One thing we've found helpful was to ask the server what the restaurant is best known for. The server said the Carne Avodava. This dish was in a class of its own, and I highly recommend it. We also ordered the New Mexican Platter, which gave us a generous sampling of their chile relleno, tamale, and chicken burrito. The spices they used for all three dishes were incredible!   They serve breakfast too, but we didn't get a chance to return. When in Phoenix, Dick's Hideaway is a MUST!

Y6biPlLelvKCsQFf3mnYKQ.text: Love, love, love. That's if you can find it, of course.  This gem is really tucked away - hence, the "hideaway."  Dick's is unmarked in the strip mall at 16th and Bethany between the hardware store and Luci's.  It makes for the perfect Saturday or Sunday brunch spot, as long as you don't mind dark (low light / no windows) quarters.    They have great Sunday mimosa specials - $5! Can't beat that! My favorite dishes are the traditional Mexican dishes. Hands down, the chicken enchiladas with both red and green sauce are the best. The chips / salsa rock too - although it's not complimentary. Diner beware... their mexican food is spicy, so order a margarita or a glass of milk to dull the spice.  Oh, and check out the back bathroom - funny and odd (not the one off the kitchen).

Y-XaviZ6SppRcXX5ic_gSg.text: It's dark in there!  Honestly, I walked in last Saturday and it was like trying to see where you are going right after you turn out the bathroom light at 2:00 am:)  The last time I was at one of the Burning Embers/Richarsdson's Family of Restaurant offerings (Richardson's, Rokerij and Dick's Hideaway, as I understand it), I told myself I wouldn't be returning...I had listened to the boss (the owner?) screaming at an employee, over some error, for a solid 3-4 minutes as the Beautiful Carin and I tried to eat a nice dinner at Richardson's:(  It was like watching Hell's Kitchen, up close and personal.  And not what I expect in a dinner house, quasi fine dining establishment.  However, I got roped into a post squash tournament group brunch/retox with my buddies from the Village.  They all wanted to go to Dick's, so I was outvoted...I could have gone home, but that would have been impolite and no fun:)  As I stumbled over the threshold trying to adjust my eyes from the arc welder intensity of the Phoenix noon hour, to the eerie dark wood, leather and no light world that is the Hideway, I told myself "well, I didn't darken their door again...the door was already darkened":)  Would I have gone back on my own...even to score a coveted review for Yelp?   I'm going to have to say "No"...Much as I love the spicy food and the New Mexican style of cooking, I was pretty sure that I would rather drive to Santa Fe for New Mexican style food than have dinner disturbed by a Gordon Ramsey wanna be again:(  But you know something...I am not one to hold a grudge or to be "Donnie Downer" so let's start with some positives from the brunch the other day:  * There was no screaming, whatsoever:)  * The service was outstanding...no really, our server was excellent  and friendly, as well as knowledgeable and competent:)  * They know how to make a pretty good vodka martini:)  * They sure know where to find the peppers in the kitchen:)  * The menu is reasonably creative:)  On the other hand (oh, you knew it was coming...two stars...it couldn't be that everything was great)  * The Carne Adovada and Eggs (the "signature" dish, as I understand it) was mediocre...the pork was pretty dry, the potatoes were a bit undercooked and I was frankly glad for the eggs and beans to put a little moisture back in the dish...the flavors were good, though and if the pork hadn't been dry and if the potatoes were done, I could see this dish being a solid choice:)  * $25 for two vodka martini's on a Saturday afternoon...really? I don't like to complain about prices, generally, but this seems to be a stretch...these things were  1/2 the size of the marti's at oh, say AZ88, yet they cost more. That doesn't make me happy:(  I just haven't had the best of luck with places named "Dick's" anything...Dickey's BBQ is just a pit and Dickie's Dog's apparently fed the wrong person a crappy hot dog one too many times and got fire bombs thrown through their front window for their trouble.  The Richardson's Family of Restaurants has already had enough trouble along the fire front, so I certainly wish them the best with their restaurant activities.  But I probably won't be back until the next time one of my buddies wants to drag me here again...or if I miss an episode of Hell's Kitchen and want to catch up:)

mT2Zlp4QxWhR0FtKJ-Jcpw.text: Driving down 16th st sometimes you can smell what they cook, so you HAVE to go inside,  hungry or not. The best on the menu is,  in my opinion, smoked turkey enchilada. Tamales are not the greatest but there are so many other things to choose from. Sitting at the dark bar I got to know many people who go there "all the time" . There is no street sign but they don't need it. The place is just great.

cR8EmvH4AUc087S44wqzUg.text: Hard to spot unless you have the address. The carne avadado was to die for. Little pricy for breakfast - $100+ for party of 5. Very good service and great atmosphere

zTOggDgQs5bY-U_G0R1_4g.text: My very 1st Arizonian eat occurred in this no-joke hideaway.  Its cross intersection was a good indicator, but yeah--what a D^&# it was to uselessly search for its giant signage.  All we could additionally rely on were its 2 front doors falling almost directly below the "Sunbrite Corner" and the helpful host aiding Kurdy S--on the phone--navigate him, Daniel L, & me to the right, high-end HITW.  Once inside, there could be several interpretations or feelings about this crowded, dimly lit (thus not very photo-friendly) and compressed space, leaving an elongated table in this separate section exclusively suited for humongous groups.  The 3 of us sat in one of their high-rise, smallish bar table across from the typical bar arrangement, & after looking through our paper mat menu we decided on the Red Pork Chile Tamale plate ($13), the New Mexican Platter ($16), & the Green Chile Cheeseburger ($13).  Keep in mind that we were seriously curious about Phoenix's Tex Mex cuisine--so please expect flavor instead of questioning authenticity =).  DL's New Mexican Platter came with 3 samplers--Red Pork Chile Tamale, Chile Relleno, and Chicken Burro--plus rice and beans.  Outrageously yet deliciously cheesy & smoky yet slowly spicy were the most remarkable essences, while the textures of the nicely seasoned rice, pinto beans, chile, & masa of the tamale were refined and gnaw-friendly--i.e. no mushiness.  Of those samplers, though, the pork one would have to be my least favorite for its average meat being too decent for its price.  Several weeks of me being burger-deprived were my reason to irresistibly choose this pecan wood-grilled, 8-ounce hunk.  In spite of flaunting a medium degree, rather than a medium rare I did request, the beef was easily steak knife-cut, juicy, & agreeably smoky.  Plus, I pretty much was chomping on that yummy Chile Relleno on top of the meat, & that was the only veggie topping sandwiched in its spongy bun.  The seasoned fries were ample & cordially tasty, but b/c of its slightly soft exterior for its dense cut I wished it had that all-familiar bite.  So from our experience I relished the ginormous goops of cheese & smoky sensation of the red chili and beef patty, which all speak out to those who, like me, have a crush on at least one of them.  Service and mostly the clientele could give a much friendlier vibe, but our waiter was spot-on accommodating, advising us to be careful handling our hot iron plates.  They're not presenting any entities calling out that D-word, but I think a revisit for their Enchiladas & Carne Adovada would sanguinely suffice for a 4.  Just look on the Sunbrite side =).

oh9sybiAnza9_uJx7zg6Kw.text: Omg! What a gem!! This place is truly a hideaway. I had a hard time finding it, but I was determined. The food? Immaculate. Sat at the bar and watched the guys prepare the dishes I ordered in front of me. I also went during reverse happy hour, so the pricing blew me away. Definitely recommend this place for sure!

HR-bmgw2wZeDox0L61-r-g.text: Great meal today! Grilled shrimp  app and chicken  quesadillas. Perfectly  spiced bloody mary($5) with a beer chaser.. Yummy! Not the friendliest bartenders but efficient..Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Look for this sign and you&#39;re there!

lgBL6jK4WJxiICrA1VpUzw.text: This is the second visit to this joint in 4 years... we live in Seattle, so it's hard to just stop in by... but when we come to town, it's a must do on our agenda. The food is stellar. The restaurant is very hard to find as there is NO SIGN! Also, it's pretty dark inside.... we have yet to have something we don't care for. Totally awesome place! Small, and it always has people in it.... so u know it's good!!

HameWlX27DzmWs0h7gnDdQ.text: A hidden place that you must try, pick carne dish with eggs and have a blast. Great service and friendly people. There is sign that says no kardashian allowed and coming from la, I simply fell in love with this little place.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Sx1wT-g48jPWoHFs3OaMpA.text: In town for Dodgers Spring Training and found this place via Yelp search. It was delicious, unique and flavorful!!! My husband and I plan to def return.

uTCg0UebZhUFKR7Ryf4kJg.text: Very small and hard to find from the street but once inside the food was amazing. The only knock is that service could have been a little more timely and attentive especially on an off night.

Isc8dvgZakC7WxLSBo4nKw.text: Definitely the best breakfast and dinner in town. We are here back to back for dinner and breakfast the next morning. Great food and service. Prices we're very reasonable. Definitely worth a trip.

Uf_Bb21jyPafXQHQmDsrgg.text: Dinner for 4, 7P on a Thursday.  I found the location no problem but I did Google a picture of the front since I had heard it was difficult to find.  Another person just put the address in to navigation and had a heck of time.  The couple in our party was sent to a completely wrong address by Google.  The place is small.  We were in the only booth.  The balance of the seating is shared tables.  Dick's came highly recommend.  We started with the New Mexican Con Queso.  Delicious.  Could have eaten the entire bowl myself.  I ordered a special, Taos Trio, rice, beans, 2 New Mexican sausages, two bacon wrapped shrimp, one red, one green and a Carne Adovada quesadilla.  A lot of food.  Rice and beans (whole) were ok.  I consider these filler food.  The sausage was fantastic.  Not hot but very flavorful.  Shrimp were good.  Red was by far the better of the two.  A very nice heat.  The Adovada was SO scrumptious.  I would absolutely order this dish again.  Guest 2 had the New Mexican Surf and Turf.  Loved the shrimp, red was best.  Could not stop talking about the beans.  Ate mine as well.  Very much like his grandmother's.  The layered enchiladas were made with crispy corn tortillas which he was not expecting and it threw him.  Thought the food overall was good but pricey.  Guest 3 ordered the Pappardelle and a couple glasses of wine.  Did not care for it one bit.  Said the duck was overdone and had a weird seasoning.  She literally had 6 or so bites.  At the end of the meal she had a full dish and the waitress did not even question her when she declined a to-go box.  Not the best customer service.  Guest 4 ordered another special, Beef Stroganoff.  Green chili pasta noodles with huge pieces of roasted meat on the rare side.  He said individually they were very good but did not care for them together.  All the meals but mine came with a salad.  Based on this meal I would stick with the more traditional New Mexican dishes for the best experience.

osXCgYcBMH_XRy9wEEvcCQ.text: Probably our favorite place in Phoenix to eat and drink. Food is spicy so beware. But it is fresh, delicious and different. Not much room with a casual neighborhood feel. Love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prime rib over open flame rotisserie for tonight&#39;s guests.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New Mexican platter with cheese relleno, chicken burro, bacon wrapped shrimp. Yum. With lots left to take home.
Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Skewers with wood grilled chicken, beef tenderloin, shrimp and sausage.

SJE7nIXbCw0lvhEP_2dqaw.text: A hidden gem. Only been for brunch, but would come for any meal. The menus is overwhelming. Sauces are spicy, flavorful, and served with everything.  All good.

fAoalFl0l1OIwwyRBTax1g.text: Wow, what can I say about a place I walked out of?   The bottled beer was good...     First, it's a hideaway.  So no road signage, and VERY difficult to find parking.  I called and they explained that to me.  If that were the only issue I would have chalked it up to uniqueness and been happy, but...  We walked in to this expecting a restaurant.   We found a bar, that also has a restaurant.  When you first walk in, you walk into a very small and uncomfortably crowded bar.  We were there for lunch and surprised at how cramped it was.  So we thought OK, where do we sit. The bartender said we could sit over in the "other" area. The other area was the restaurant seating.  The restaurant seating is actually pretty nice. As we walked in there was a gentleman placing menus on the tables, in the otherwise completely empty area. We asked him where was we should sit and he said "it doesn't matter". So we found a table and my wife and I sat down.  The waiter was really the beginning and the end of our problems. He asked us what we wanted to drink, then walked away and around a corner.  But still kept talking.  My wife ordered a Coke, I asked him if he was familiar with the beers. At this point shouting a little because he was around a corner and behind a divider.  He said, "what do you mean?" I said "do you know the beers?  Like if I were to tell you what I was looking for would you be able to tell me what beer to get?" He said "well tell me what you want and I'll tell you if I know."  I just said give me a dark beer because I did not trust him to tell me much about the beers at that point.  We waited five to ten minutes for my beer to show back up, but no Coke for my wife. He brought out water glasses but never filled them.  There was also no offer or mention of chips and salsa. I don't even know if that's something they offer. But when I searched on yelp for best chips and salsa, this restaurant came up. It is not their fault if yelp search engine is screwed up but certainly we never saw them if they offer them.  He disappeared after giving me the beer and ten minutes later came back and asked if we knew what we wanted or had questions. I said I did, and asked him if the adovada was hot. He said "give me a second" and walked out without another word.  After five more minutes he came back with the adovada,  a green, and a red sauce.  I thought that was very nice, but then he said "there's the adovada and I figured her next questions were going to be about the sauces".  Then he was gone again. And not like he stood there for a few seconds and then moved on, I mean like before we could say thank you he was gone. Still no Coke, no water, no chips and salsa, no service other than samples.    The adovada and the sauces were all very good. I would love to have stayed and tried them on actual food. But unfortunately we did not see your waiter again for 15 minutes. I finished my beer. He still had not returned. My wife and I decided that we should try somewhere else. We walked out, took my beer bottle with me so I could show whomever what I drank and they could charge me, walked into the bar, And there was our waiter.  He walked up very quickly.  I don't know where he was or what he was doing but he was on me quick.  "OK, did you decide on what to eat? ". Seriously, that's what he asked. With my wife and I standing there looking at him. I said no, we're leaving. At this point it had been 35-45 minutes.  He said oh OK. In retrospect I think he was quick to get to us because he didn't want us talking to any other servers or employees at the restaurant.   Anyway, he charged me full price for the beer, I paid and we walked out.  Based on this I did something I never do, I gave no tip.  Maybe it was an off day, but we won't be back. I've been to Richardson's and Rojkeri (sp?). Both of those restaurants by the same owners are good and fairly close to this one. Skip the hideaway and go to Richardson's.

AWhnlpqX3Z4cfBlXDn-IiQ.text: Delicious fresh food. A hidden gem with delightful service. The portions are huge and the happy hour specials are great!

ETk_2DvJi16CuYh-FUR4yg.text: Food was soooo good. Fun little spot with unique seating. When your map app says you're there, turn in. It's in a strip mall and not well marked which adds to the hideaway effect. Sante Fe chicken, shrimp pasta and adavacado carne all very good. The sides were just as good as the main course ( house salad, veggies and green chili potatoes).

K_ivpbV147nxqzwVt8sqlg.text: This is such a quaint place. It is tiny, but makes up for the lack of space with excellent food, drinks, and service. It just means you can be closer with the peeps you came in with.  The New Mexico enchiladas are the most delicious and tastiest items on the menu. As a former New Mexican, it is nice to be able to come to a place that tastes like home.  Stop in with a friend or two...it's worth it!

yUneXayVXeXq4FBt6DntaQ.text: The table we were seated at was polished, hand-hammered copper. Atmosphere was a little dark and it was reasonably hard to find. Looks a bit sketchy from the outside, but the food and service was spectacular.

RNZo_Q5uQYV3kdRMjIuF1Q.text: The huevos rancheros were probably some of the best I've ever tasted. The combination of beans potatoes eggs green chili with the tortilla was just perfect. I will definitely visit there again! The menu choices look amazingly tasty.

kEL8frB5Cr1h2D229e8VvQ.text: Wanna blow your mind early in the morning? Holy smokes. Breakfast Burrito, Christmas style.

kBKAShoR_8dLv7ZpR9ysdA.text: Quick Hit: Consider Checking Out  The place was recommended to me by several friends that have lived in Phoenix their whole lives as a tucked away restaurant gem serving authentic New Mexican Cuisine. Gem is an adequate description since the restaurant is decently nondescript in external appearance and seating is very limited - they have a handful of tables and bar seating available. Due to limited space and great popularity, you would expect significantly long waiting times. Indeed when we arrived there for brunch there was hordes of folks waiting outside. This sight alone deterred other Dicks Hideaway dining hopefuls from trying again another time. We decided to wait and have drinks (Bloody Mary and Dicks White Sangria - both well made, and the sangria is like drinking liquid candy, it was delicious). With drinks in hand, the 30 minute wait seemed much shorter. The restaurant atmosphere is definitely a relaxed one with humorous tag lines and stickers with funny phrases scattered across the walls. Heck, you are even greeted at the door by a "kids left alone will receive a drink and a kitten" - don't quote me directly. All in all, real chill and laid back vibe. Now for the most important part, the food. Several appetizing items on the menu representing New Mexican cuisine. In all honesty, the items looked more appetizing on the menu than it truly tasted. After eating my steak Benedict and sampling my friends dishes, everything was just ok. Some dishes were so over seasoned that it completely masked the individual taste of the combined ingredients, while mine was blandly flavored. The food portions were large and came out hot (actually the plates are so hot that I encourage you to wait several minutes or you may get a first degree burn - serious). Service was incredibly friendly, grounded, and accommodating. The service rounded out the experience.  Overall, cool place, decent food.

Zz4Kh_xtSAy5QLPtA5LV7A.text: A little tricky to find but well worth the effort. The Carne Adovada/Smoked pork shoulder is phenomenal... Best I have ever had. They smoke the shoulder for 8 hours and then simmer in a fabulous red chile sauce for another 8 hours. Smokey, with just the right amount of heat.

kO45BWim3vJl6v_zwlLcaQ.text: Really wish they had a better beer selection, both bottle (no craft beers at all-just mega brews and a few Mexican beers) and tap (only 8--and 2 locals).   Food VERY expensive.

0oxBlgKou7dbNSdqpNeQ8w.text: Yelp Rating: High; Expectations: High; Reality: So-so. I ordered what the server recommended (Carne Adovada), but there just wasn't a lot of flavor (a rare fluke?). I think I'm going to have to go back to make sure I'm not missing something.

photos.caption: Photo of Dick's Hideaway - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BIZO3i-rLI9CynHzHZF1jA.text: The house is small, dark and cozy.  At Dicks Hideaway it's all about food heritage and breakfast served late in the day.  For my late lunch I had a draft hoegaarden 6. And the Richardson's combination plate with one jalapeno benedict and two chicken enchiladas with green chili, asparagus with hollandaise 15.  The guys and gals are super duper friendly and my meal was excellent. I have learned the original Richardson's of New Mexico will be opening up in about three weeks. Can't wait to see the new shack.  Richardsons family of restaurants, a cooking style that is notably divergent and takes a unique approach to Southwestern cuisine.

g8FdZzXgnJYWAwflEqNvag.text: This place has the best brunch!  It's about a 30 minute drive but we seem to be here at least once a month. Be hungry,  the portions are big but oh so worth it.

hMIM2ms99QEAfCWMVAzZtw.text: Freakin Amazing!  The roasted Garlic is a meal on its own.  The Carne Adovada is top shelf...  will be trying to recreate that this weekend at home....

mSLeOrr7yTerg4ND9b_EhQ.text: Place is just always great! Had the green chile stew and love the burn! Never fails! Gonna have to bring my wife for the fish special! It looks phenomenal!!!

he4eeeiKGWQSvBf3RWo0ig.text: We went their based on the reviews seen here and we were not disappointed! Very cool vibe to the place, the wait staff was great and the food was fantastic!  We ordered The Taos plate and the Scallops special...WOW.  Everything taste incredible and the scallops were probably one of the best we have ever had...super tender and way mouthwatering.  Had margaritas...those too were very good.  Mrs. had the prickly pear version and was thoroughly impressed.    We want to take some friends back...might not be able to sit in the bar ( we went on a Wed. during happy hour and it was full) , but the back room looked like you can hang out with a group a little more comfortably.  We will be back!

-eppTlM-X8n2JLtiMkBamg.text: My boyfriend and I ate lunch at Dick's Hideaway today before we left for the airport (we'd been visiting Phoenix and Scottsdale for the weekend).  The food was absolutely delicious.  I had the Blackened Scallops and he had the Carne Adovada.  We were both blown away by the flavor of our dishes.  I actually couldn't stop eating mine - it had five different sauces.  I don't eat meat and the bartender let me know there was chicken stock in the rice so I just got the beans with it.  Very cool and I really appreciated it.  The vibe here was low-key and just great.  We sat at the bar.  The margaritas were very tasty too.  We will definitely return whenever we are in town and will always recommend it.  Terrific!

303r_3y46OENb0Bc1EQ7Ig.text: The best place for Bloody Marys in town! The food is incredible and the service is stellar. Each time I've gone there's been a bit of a wait (its a tiny place) but totally worth it!

aJKVVOk8JNeltqE4iQAbRg.text: I was there last night I dont like this place they take so long to bring the food and the place look dirty the menu its a piece off paper and the prices are to much for the service  .I never come back

oh84eP3ElqCQky87gcVMDw.text: Great great chile! Little kick but just great taste. The hamburger was just incredible also. Ambiance was just perfect. Little loud but fantastic everything.

3JdN5gHlKSy4gy4b8ZkwdQ.text: Discovered this little gem for Breakfast.  The Adovada with eggs is just freakin amazing!!!  Everything we ate was full of flavor and what we have been looking for since moving the Phoenix.  This is definitely our new favorite breakfast place.. I can't wait to try literally everything else on the menu!

6o_8yGM-sLhl0kXrZmrtSg.text: Giving it a full constellation.  I do so love a hole in the wall,  and Dick's isn't much larger than that. ....literally. But,  wow,  the food.  Unbelievable.  Not the place to go for a salad,  mind you,  but fantastic grilled and Mexican dishes, cranked out by one guy in the tiniest of work spaces. Simplicity and complexity on the same plate.   Full bar,  happy hour specials.  My new go-to lunch spot when I'm headed to the airport.

xdZWolQJB2a1Yfyb4Yzi4Q.text: Yummy, yummy, yummy. This place is consistently delicious. Another New Mexican style food treasure right here in the middle of Phoenix. If you don't get in the door early, be prepared to wait a while for one of the 5-8 tables inside. Absolutely worth seeking out!

ApHO4jls9p5BecAvOmGdbA.text: Another spot that will make your rotation Hidden gem with charm and simplicity.. the mimosa's are full no skimping for this place! French toast to die for.. and new friendly people to meet every time I walk in the door!

tnTfLt_kAAcPwRGJTsJxtQ.text: I really enjoyed my meal here.  It doesn't seem like they care about whether or not you're impressed, but they're confident you'll enjoy your experience.  A friend, who is a regular, brought me.  Obviously, as an out-of-towner, I never would have found this place on my own.  It's not a place you simply stumble across.   It's definitely not inexpensive, but I wouldn't say it's outrageously priced.  You get what you pay for: fine food, prepared well, served in a pretty cool space.   It's New Mexican cuisine.  I'm not sure what, exactly, that means, but there were a lot of chillies and tortillas.   There's not a whole lot of seating, so you may or may not get seated right away.  And I think they discourage bringing children, although I don't think they're necessarily unwelcome.   Also, I guess they have excellent breakfast, although I ate dinner when I went.

V6xWwXdds3MCnGqKymrrKA.text: Great atmosphere.  Fantastic food.  Great service. Well worth a visit for a casual dining experience for small parties.

t-t_0OT8bITnwj4V6ysKSw.text: I travel a lot for work but whenever I'm back in Phoenix I stop here for brunch. The staff is great, the atmosphere is pleasant, and the food is even better. As the name would suggest it's a hole in the wall joint without any sign to let you know where it is. My favorite is any one of the eggs Benedict meals. It may sound weird but I love the Ham / tenderloin there. They smoke it themselves and then cook with a wood fire grill. Awesome. Busy time are kind of hit and miss but considering they have absolutely no advertising their doing pretty well.
